loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José  es socio del bancomunal Grandioso Milagro.
José es conviviente tiene 37 años, dos hijos de 12  años que esta en la escuela estatal. Y un hijo de 1 año.
La familia de José lo animo a poner un negocio de video juegos, hace dos años el se animo y empezó su negocio de video juegos, también da servicio de Internet;  estaba estudiando en la universidad administración de empresas en el quinto ciclo, cuando su esposa salio embarazada tubo que dejar los estudios.  
José necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para el mantenimiento de sus maquinas computadoras y sus equipos de video juegos.
Desde que esta en Finca, ha  podido resolver varios problemas  económicos, esta mas tranquilo y tiene para invertir. 
El sueño de José es cancelar todas sus deudas que tiene y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
José is a member of the Grandioso Milagro communal bank. He lives with his wife and is 37 years old. They have two children who are 12 years old and attend the state school, and one child who is 1 year old. José’s family encouraged him to open a video game business, so he started a business that has video games and also internet service. He was at the university studying business administration when his wife got pregnant and he had to leave his studies. José needs a loan of 800 PEN for maintenance on his computers and his video game equipment. Since he has been with Finca, he has been able to resolve various financial problems, he is more relaxed, and he has money to invest. José’s dream is to pay off all his debts and to expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: José needs a loan of 800 PEN for maintenance on his computers and his video game equipment.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth es socia del bancomunal Grandioso  Milagro.
Elizabeth es conviviente tiene 26 años, dos hijos de 6 años que va la escuela estatal y el otro estar por nacer.
Elizabeth termino la escuela y no estudio nada, se puso a trabajar en ventas, al tiempo salio embarazada y se fue a vivir con su esposo,  empezó vendiendo polos que su esposo le trae de la fabrica donde trabaja, pero ahora ella quiere confeccionar sabanas y ropa en general. 
Elizabet necesita un préstamo de  800  soles, para la compra de una maquina, y compra de tela para hacer sabanas.
Desde que esta en Finca, aprendió ahorrar, a ser responsable y a escuchar a las señoras que tiene mas experiencia en el negocio, a como incursionar en nuevos negocios. 
El sueño de Elizabeth es comprarse su casa por que vive en casa de sus suegros.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Grandioso Milagro communal bank. She is 26 years old and lives with her husband. She has two children who are 6 years old and go to the state school, and another will be born soon. Elizabeth finished school and didn’t continue her education. She started working in sales. Eventually she got pregnant and went to live with her husband. She started selling polo shirts that her husband brings from the factory where he works. But now she wants to make sheets and clothing in general. Elizabeth needs a loan of 800 PEN to buy a sewing machine and fabric for making sheets. Since she has been with Finca, she has learned to save, to be responsible, to listen to the women that have more experience in the business, and to venture into new businesses. Elizabeth’s dream is buy a house because she lives in her in-law’s house.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Elizabeth needs a loan of 800 PEN to buy a sewing machine and fabric for making sheets.

loans.name: Señor De Huanca De Cusco Group

texts.es:
El grupo “SEÑOR D. H. D. CUSCO”, está conformado por 20 miembros, estos socios llevan en su mayoría más D. 15 años trabajando con la organización D. bancos comunales en la ciudad del Cusco.

Los socios alternan sus actividades personales con labores comerciales diferentes, encontramos a socios que tiene sus tiendas D. barrotes, otros tienen tiendas D. venta D. ropas, para bebes y adultos, otros socios tienen carpintería, librería, y en particular una socia la más antigua del grupo la sra. Margarita tiene su pequeña tienda abarrotes y ahí mismo a apertura do un restaurante y en las tardes es un cafetín, ella misma prepara los menús y los ponches y sándwich y empanadas D. pollo, carne, los socios solicitan el préstamo en razón D. implementar sus diferentes negocios y la sra. Margarita quiere terminar D. construir su casita, que poco a poco con la ayuda D. este tipo D. préstamos lo está logrando.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el apoyo otorgado mediante este préstamo y así mismo se comprometen en cumplir con el pago total D. la deuda en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
The group "Senor D. H. D. Cusco" is formed by 20 members, most of these members have been working 15 years with the organization of community banks in the city of Cusco. The members work in different commercial activities, some have grocery stores, other sell clothes for babies and adults, other members work on carpentry, bookstores, and one of the oldest members of the group Mrs. Margarita has a small grocery store and a small restaurant on the same place, in the afternoons is a coffee shop, she prepares the menus, beverages, sandwiches, chicken and beef empanadas. The members request the loan in order to get working capital for their business and Mrs. Margarita wants to finish building her house. The members value and appreciate the loan and commit to pay the debt on the time determined.

Translated from Spanish by N. Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for their business

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
LUZ MARIA R. S. pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS MARGARITAS” vive en el jr misti Mz 5. Lt 7 AA:HH. MARTHA CHAVEZ. del distrito de Manantay, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 39 años de edad, 4 hijos.  Su pareja no cuenta con trabajo, y es ella quien solventa los gastos del hogar.

Se inició en el negocio de venta de ropas de niños y manualidades.  Con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró camisas y pantalones de niños, cuenta con muchos clientes y su negocio ha ido creciendo.

Hoy continúa con el mismo negocio, vende ropas para niños y su negocio ha mejorado, tiene la oportunidad de vender en su propia casa.  Con este crédito de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará más ropas de niños, en diferentes modelos y tallas.

“En la vida tenemos algunos altibajos  y en esta oportunidad mi esposo esta desempleado, pero me siento feliz que en esta oportunidad sea yo la que este costeando los gastos de la casa y esto lo valora bastante mi esposo... Todo esto gracias a Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Luz María Ruíz S. belongs to the “Las Margaritas” communal bank. She lives in the district of Manantay in the city of Pucalla. She is 39 years old and has 4 children. Her husband is unemployed and she provides for the household expenses. She began a business selling children’s clothing and crafts. With her first loan of 300 PEN, she bought children’s t-shirts and pants. She has many customers and her business has been growing. She still has the same business selling children’s clothing, and business has improved because she has the opportunity to sell from her own house. With this loan of 1,000 PEN, she will buy more children’s clothing, in different styles and sizes. “In life there are ups and downs. At this time my husband is unemployed, but I am happy that I am providing for the household expenses, and my husband really values this. All of this is thanks to Manuela Ramos.”

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's clothing.

loans.name: Amina

texts.es:
AMINA G. SALDAÑA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SHIPIBAS” vive en pasaje Julio C. Tello. en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 23 años de edad, 2 hijos, y su pareja es técnico dental.

Se inició en el negocio de venta de abarrotes  y el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró víveres como azúcar, arroz, fideos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Cuenta con muchos lientes y su negocio ha ido creciendo.

Hoy, ella ha progresado con su familia y el negocio de la bodega ha mejorado.  Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles,  comprará 3 cajas de leche, 2 bolsas de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz y mas víveres  para ampliar su  bodega.

“Manuela Ramos es una ONG, que apoya a una gran cantidad de familias, con pequeños préstamos que permite a las mujeres de esta zona a iniciar o a mejorar sus negocios y estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
Amina G. S. belongs to the “Mujeres Shipibas” communal bank. She lives on Julio C. Tello street in the city of Pucallpa. She is 23 years old and has 2 children. Her husband is a dental technician. She began a small grocery store and with the first loan of 300 PEN, she bought staples such as sugar, rice, noodles, and other basic products. She has many customers and her business has been growing. Amina has been able to help her family and the grocery store business has improved. With this loan of 1,200 PEN, she will buy 3 boxes of milk, 2 bags of sugar, 1 sack of rice, and more staples with which to expand her store. “Manuela Ramos is a non-governmental organization that helps a large number of families with small loans that allow the women of this area to begin or improve their businesses, and I am very happy with this help,” she explains.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 boxes of milk, sugar, rice, and other staples.

loans.name: Ayda

texts.es:
AYDA M. C. pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS MARGARITAS” vive en Av. Colonización c/16 de noviembre. del distrito de Callería, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 32 años de edad y 1 hijo.  Su pareja es motocarrista (servicio de transporte).

Se inició en el negocio de manualidades y costura hace algunos años,  Su primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con este dinero compró telas e hilos, cuenta con clientes frecuentes y su negocio ha ido creciendo.

Actualmente se dedica a la costura, su clientela ha aumentado.   Con este crédito de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará una máquina de coser.

“Me encanta lo que hago.  Gracias a Manuela Ramos que me dio esta gran oportunidad para generar ingresos con lo que me gusta hacer y además  me permite cubrir las necesidades de mi casa.
texts.en:
Ayda M. C. is a member of “Las Margaritas” Community Bank and lives on Colonización Avenue in the Callería district of the city of Pucallpa. She is 32 years old and has one son. Her husband drives a motorized rickshaw.

A few years ago, Ayda began a handicrafts and sewing business. Her first loan was for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles, which she used to purchase fabric and thread. She has many regular customers and her business has grown.

She currently focuses on sewing, and her clientele has expanded. She will use this loan for 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase a sewing machine.

Ayda says, “I love what I do. I am grateful to Manuela Ramos for giving me the opportunity to increase my income doing what I love while meeting my household expenses.”

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase one sewing machine.

loans.name: Bella Judith

texts.es:
BELLA JUDITH L. L., pertenece al Banco Comunal  “MUJERES SHIPIBAS”   vive en  el  del distrito  de  Yarinacocha,   tiene 43 años de edad,  1 hijo, y su pareja es maderero (compra y venta de madera).

Con su primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, se inició en el negocio de venta de refrescos, paralelamente se dedica a costura. 

Ella ha progresado junto a su familia y el negocio de los refrescos ha mejorado.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,600.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará telas e hilos y también invertirá en productos para preparar sus refrescos.

“Manuela Ramos para mi es mi mejor alternativa, para seguir adelante  y así apoyar económicamente a mi familia.
texts.en:
Bella Judith L. L. is a member of the “Mujeres Shipibas” Community Bank and lives in the Yarinacocha district. She is 43 years old, has one son, and her husband works buying and selling wood.

She used her first loan for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles to begin a business selling soft drinks. She also works as a seamstress.

Bella and her family have gotten ahead, and the soft drinks business has improved. With this loan for 2,600 nuevos soles, she will purchase fabric, thread, and ingredients to prepare soft drinks.

Bella says, “For me, Manuela Ramos is the best way to get ahead and financially support my family.”

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, thread, and ingredients to prepare soft drinks

loans.name: Carla Priscila

texts.es:
CARLA PRISCILA P. Y., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS INNOVADORAS II” vive en el Jr Toronto Mz 6.Lt2.Km 7, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 27 años de edad y 1 hijo.

Se inició en el negocio de venta de víveres y productos de belleza.  Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró víveres para abastecer su tienda, cuenta con muchos clientes y su negocio ha ido creciendo.

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio (venta de abarrotes), pero aun le falta implementar con más productos para satisfacer las diferentes necesidades de su cliente.  Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles invertirá en la compra de más víveres.

“Doy gracias a Manuela Ramos por brindar esta oportunidad del crédito por que así nos permite invertir en el negocio par generar mas ingreso en la familia.
texts.en:
Carla Priscila P. Y. belongs to the Las Innovadoras II (The Innovative Women) Communal Bank. She lives on Toronto Street in the city of Pucallpa. She is 21 years old and has a son. She started her business selling provisions and beauty products. With her first loan of 300 New Sols she bought supplies to stock up her store. She has many customers and her business has been growing. At present she is continuing with the same business (selling groceries) but it suffers from not having enough products to satisfy all the different needs of her clientele. This loan of 1,200 New Sols will be used to buy more supplies. "I am thankful to Manuela Ramos for providing this lending opportunity, because it allows us to invest in our businesses and generate more income for our families."

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products such as rice, noodles, sugar, tuna fish, etc.

loans.name: Jorge Humberto

texts.es:
el Sr. Jorge O. tiene 36 años de edad y tiene un negocio de venta de comida en el mercado los dolores de Tegucigalpa, el tiene 4 locales donde junto con sus trabajadores cocian y asan la carne para venderla y atender a la clientela que tienen en la zona, el tiene mas de 6 años de trabajar en el negocio, tiene 2 hijos los cuales no reciden en tegucigalpa, ellos estudian en la zona sur del pais, gracias al esfuerzo que realiza el Sr. Jorge en su negocio logra darles todos los gastos como ser educacion, alimentacion, distracciones, salud,.
el necesita el credito para poder comprar mas carnes y refrescos ya que la demanda de sus clientes es mucha y a veces se le termina rapido la comida.
texts.en:
Jorge O. is 36 years old and has a business selling food in the Los Dolores market in Tegucigalpa. He has 4 places where he and his workers cook and grill the meat that they sell and serve to their customers in the area. He has worked in his business for more than 6 years. Jorge has 2 children who don’t live in Tegucigalpa—they go to school in the southern part of the country. Thanks to the effort Jorge puts into his business he is able to pay for all of their needs such as education, food, entertainment, health, etc. Jorge is requesting this loan so he can purchase more meat and soft drinks, since his customers’ demand is great and he sometimes runs out of food quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing beef, pork, chicken, beans, tortillas, vegetables, soft drinks, plates, glasses, plastic forks, rice, cheese, and butter.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lilian Patricia

texts.es: la sra. Lilian H. tiene 35 años de edad, ella tiene un local de venta de comidas y golosinas en el mercado los Dolores de La cuidad capital, ella comienza a las 5 de la mañana a cocinar para el desayuno y almuerzo y tenmina a las 5 de la tarde con sus ventas de golosinas, ella trabaja todos los dias y los fines de semana son mucho mejor las ventas ya que los fines de semana las gente va al mercado a hacer sus compras para la semana y ahi es cuando ella mas vende ya que siempre le compran comida., cabe mensionar que ella tiene 12 años de tener este negocio ahorita ella quiere comprar mas comida ya que hay dias que se queda sin vender. por tal razon necesita el credito
texts.en:
Señora Lilian H. is 35 years of age. She has a place where she sells meals and sweets in the Los Dolores Market in the capital city (Tegucigalpa). She begins cooking at 5 a.m. for breakfast and then lunch, and she finishes at five in the afternoon selling sweets. She works every day and the weekends are better for sales since that is when people go to market to do their week's shopping. That's when she does her best business since they always buy her meals. It bears mentioning that she has been in this business for twelve years. Right now she would like to buy more food since there are days when she has nothing to sell. That's why she needs this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, beans cooking oil, lard, tortillas, pork, chicken, drinks, butter, cheeses and plantain bananas.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
La señora Carmela pertenece al Banco Comunal “INDOAMERICA” vive en Iván sit Mz10. Lt 10. del distrito D. Manantay, en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene 72 años D. edad.

Se inició en el negocio D. venta D. néctar,  con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró frutas para preparar néctar.  Cuenta con clientes frecuentes y su negocio ha ido creciendo.

Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio D. venta D. néctar D. frutas, el mismo que ha mejorado.
Este préstamo D. S/.3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la perforación D. un pozo tubular para mejorar la calidad D. agua que usara en la preparación D. sus productos.

“Manuela Ramos me enseña que no importa la edad para seguir trabajando y sentirse realizada y tengo muchas ganas D. seguir adelante aunque mis hijos no lo permitan, pero soy feliz con mi negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Carmela belongs to the IndoAmerica Communal Bank. She lives in the Iván neighborhood of the Manantay District, city of Pucallpa. She is 72 years of age. She began her business selling fruit nectar. With her first loan of 300 Newe Sols she bought fruits to make it and her business has been growing. At present she is continuing with the same business which is thriving. This loan of 3,000 New Sols will be invested in drilling a well to improve the quality of the water that she uses to prepare her products. “Manuela Ramos has shown me that age doesn't matter if one wants to continue working and to feel fulfilled. And I really want to get ahead, although my kids won't allow it, but I am happy with my business."

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Infrastructure:  To drill a well.

texts.es:
CHARITO R. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS MARGARITAS” vive en el pasaje zagarra 131. del distrito de Callería, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 35 años de edad y 1 hijo.  Su pareja es transportista.

Se inició en el negocio de venta de comida regional, el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró víveres para preparar platos de la región y ponerlos a la venta,  cuenta con clientes frecuentes y su negocio ha ido creciendo.

Hoy en día vende comida regional, tacacho con cecina, juanes, majas a la parrilla y lo hace con una sazón increíble que sus comensales salen satisfechos.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de mas productos alimenticios como; arroz, aceite, carne regional, etc.

“Con este negocio puedo cubrir los estudios de mi hijo por que el tiene que se profesional y el se siente orgullosa de su madre y valora lo que hago y gracias a las oportunidades que nos brinda  Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
CHARITO R. M. is a member of the “LAS MARGARITAS” Microfinance Institute. She is a 35-year-old mother who lives in the city of Pucallpa with her son. Her spouse works as a driver.

She started her own business selling regional food. Her first 300.00 PEN loan was used to purchase provisions for the preparation of regional dishes. She has a steady clientele, and her business has been growing.

She still sells regional dishes like tacacho con cecina (a dish that consists of green plantains, cured smoked pork, and lard), juanes (rice, chicken, olives and an egg wrapped in a plantain leaf and parboiled), and flame-grilled majás (Peruvian jungle rodent). She prepares her dishes with such an incredible flavor that her patrons leave satisfied. She will invest this 1,300.00 PEN loan in purchasing more ingredients, such as rice, cooking oil, regional meat, etc.

“With this loan, I have been able to pay for my son’s studies because he has to become a professional. I want him to feel proud of his mother and value what I do thanks to the opportunities that Manuela Ramos gives us.”

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel A. works as a petty trader, selling soft drinks at Bantma near Elmina which he has done since 2003.  He is married with 5 dependents and received an education through Senior High School. While Daniel is employed as a petty trader, his wife works as a hairdresser.  He is responsible for paying school fees and bills. His loan will be used to purchase additional crates of drinks to sell. Daniel hopes to use the new profits from his business to finish building his house.

loans.use: purchase additional crates of drinks for selling

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel D. is a 44-year-old man married with three kids who are currently in school. He trades in cassava, maize and plantain. He treks to Techiman in the northern part of the country to buy his stock in bulk and supplies his customers on a credit basis. Apart from petty trading, he is also a shoemaker who manufactures ladies' and men’s footwear, a profession he learnt about 10 years ago.

With the loan Daniel wants to buy more maize, cassava, and plantain and also buy more leather to enable him to manufacture different kinds of shoes to meet his customers’ demand. He believes the loan will enable him to save more income to pay for his children in school. He is member of the group called Aminkyi which literally means ‘unity’ Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as a means of collateral.

loans.use: To purchase cassava, maize and plantains in bulk.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
CLARA C. G. pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS MARGARITAS” vive en Jr Cesar calvo de Araujo nº 1005 del distrito de Callería, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 33 años de edad y 3 hijos.  Su pareja es motocarrista (transportista).

Se inició en el negocio de la venta de abarrotes, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró golosinas, huevos, plátano, frutas, etc. cuenta con clientes frecuentes y su negocio ha ido creciendo día a día.

Actualmente vende diferentes productos de la región entre ellas frutas, plátanos, cocona, etc. 
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de mas productos para su pequeña bodega (arroz, huevos, leche, etc.).

“Hoy tengo la oportunidad de tener un negocio en mi propia casa que me permite además atender los quehaceres de la casa porque tengo hijos que están en la escuela. Me siento contenta por tener esta oportunidad y solo   Manuela Ramos me la dio”.
texts.en:
Clara C. G. is a member of “Las Margaritas” Community Bank and lives on Cesar Calvo de Araujo Street in the Callería district of the city of Pucallpa. She is 33 years old and has three children. Her husband drives a motorized rickshaw.

With her first loan for 300 Peruvian nuevos soles, she began selling groceries. She used the money to purchase sweets, eggs, bananas, fruits, etc. She has many regular customers and her business is growing day by day.

Currently, she sells a variety of products from her region, including fruit, bananas, and “cocona” (a tropical fruit resembling a persimmon). She will invest this loan for 2,000 nuevos soles in the purchase of more items for her small store (rice, eggs, milk, etc.).

Clara says, “Today I have the opportunity to have a business in my own home that lets me take of my household chores while my children are in school. I feel happy to have this opportunity that only Manuela Ramos has provided.”

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grocery items including rice, sugar, and pasta

loans.name: Diana Melissa

texts.es: la sra. Diana O. tiene 24 años de edad, ella tiene un local en el mercado los Dolores en Tegucigalpa, ella tiene mas de 6 años de experiencia en este negocio, ella en este momento quiere invertir el dinero para comprar zandalias, ropa interior y pañuelos, tambien comprar mas productos de los que vende para tener mas variedad. estos nuevos productos que quiere vender tienen mucha demanda, muchas mujeres compran zandalias y ropa interior, este tipo de producto se le saca buena gananacia, ella es una mujer soltera y no tiene hijos, ella desea tener una tienda muy grande para poder adquirir una casa y luego tener una familia que ese es su mayor sueño.
texts.en:
Diana O. is 24 years old and has a shop in Tegucigalpa's Dolores Market. She has had her business for more than six years and is requesting a loan to purchase more of the items that she already sells as well as new products, including sandals, underwear, and handkerchiefs. These new items are in great demand, as many women buy sandals and underwear. This type of product also provides a good profit.

Diana is single and does not have any children. Her goal is to have a very large store so that she can buy a house and later start a family, which is her biggest dream.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sandals, underwear, handkerchiefs, necklaces, watches, stickers, erasers, hangers, nail polish, nail polish remover, and nail clippers

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Saratu

texts.en: Saratu A. is forty-six years old. She is divorced and has one daughter who is currently independent and working. Saratu sells maize and millet in the local market of Abeka, a town in the Greater Accra region of Ghana. Her major difficulty has to do with funds to support the business. She is requesting this loan to enable her to buy maize and millet in bulk to grow her business and scale up sales. She hopes to increase her savings to pay for the education of her late sister’s children. She is a member of a community group called “Baameyi shei Allah” which literally means unity Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase maize and millet for re-sale

loans.name: Vicky Jicela

texts.es:
la Sra. Vicky A. tiene 25 años de edad vive en union libre con el Sr. Santos Lagos, con el cual han procreado un hijo que tiene 3 años de edad, su compañero de hogar es taxista y juntos se apoyan para los gastos del hogar.
ella se dedica a la elaboracion de comidas y tambien vende pizzas caseras, tiene 6 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, ella ahorita necesita el prestamo para comprar al por mayor el producto y mantenerlo refregerado como ser las carnes ya que cada dia que pasa se ponen mas elevados los precios de estos productos.
su sueño es tener un comedor completo con todas las necesides que exijan los clientes.
texts.en:
Ms. Vicky A. is a 25-year-old woman who lives with Mr. Santos Lagos, her common-law spouse, with whom she has a 3-year-old son. Her domestic partner is a taxi cab driver, and they help each other in covering the household expenses. She prepares meals and sells homemade pizza for a living. She has been in business for 6 years. She now needs a loan in order to purchase wholesale goods, such as meat and vegetables, and keep them refrigerated because the cost of these goods is increasing everyday.

She dreams of having a full restaurant equipped with everything that her customers request.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meat, vegetables, soft drinks, and water

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
CONSUELO C. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas de Pucallpa” vive en Asentamiento Humano 4 de junio. del distrito de Manantay, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 53 años de edad y 1 hijo.

Se inició en el negocio de venta de desayunos, con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró víveres para cocinar y vender, para poder mostrarlos, cuenta con clientes y su negocio ha ido creciendo.

Actualmente ella se dedica a la venta de desayunos a los trabajadores de los aserraderos, dado que ellos madrugan.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus alimentos, también comprará gas y vasos.

“Si no fuese por Manuela Ramos no tendría el negocio dado que recurrí a muchas entidades financieras pero la cantidad de requisitos no me permitieron dar el crédito, por ello estoy muy agradecida por esta oportunidad
texts.en:
CONSUELO C. R. is a member of the “Las Estrellitas de Pucallpa” Microfinance Institute. She is a 53-year-old woman who lives in the city of Pucallpa and has one son.

She started her own breakfast sales business. With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased goods to prepare and sell. She has a steady clientele, and her business has been growing.

She currently sells breakfast to the local sawmill workers, who have to get up very early in the morning.

She will invest this 1,000.00 PEN loan in purchasing food to prepare her meals. She will also purchase gas and cups. “If it weren’t for Manuela Ramos, I would not have this business given that I went to many financial institutes but was not given a loan because of all the requirements. For this reason, I am very grateful for having been given this opportunity.”

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase provisions, cups and natural gas

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria A. is a forty-year-old woman, married with three children who are currently in school. For the past seven years Victoria has been producing "gari" which she supplies to her numerous customers in and around her community. "Gari" is a native food prepared from cassava, which is enjoyed by many Ghanaians. She says prices of cassava have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditure.

With the loan, Victoria wants to purchase more baskets of cassava, to produce more gari. She would be grateful for the assistance. Victoria is a member of a community group called "shining star" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava to make "gari" to sell

loans.name: Jacqueline Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Jackeline Blas  Z. tiene la edad de 27 años, habita en el  barrio Los Martines, junto a su esposo, el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen a su cargo tres hijos los cuales dos estudian y el bebe de 20 meses, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, ya que no logrado terminar de construir su casa. Ella desde hace 3 años, es operaria de Zona Franca, la mayor dificultad que se le presento es la fallecimiento de sus mamá y el accidente de su esposo; ya que con mucho esfuerzo, cumplió con sus cuotas de pagos. El préstamo lo quiere para la compra de materiales de construcción y poder seguir construyendo su casa para lograr una casa digna para su familia, este es su sexto ciclo de préstamos en Afodenic y da las gracias por los objetivos adquiridos y desarrollo para  su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jackeline Blas Z. is 27 years old and lives in the Los Martines neighborhood, together with her husband, who helps her with the household expenses. They have 3 dependent children; two remain in school and they also have a 20 month old baby at home. Their plan for their family is to improve the conditions in which they live; they have yet to reach their goal of completing the construction of the family home. For three years, Jackeline has been working in a factory in the Free Trade Zone known as Zona Franca and dedicated primarily to textile production. The greatest difficuty she has faced has been the death of her mother and an accident that affected her husband. With a lot of effort she has complied with her loan payment plan. She wants this loan for the purchase of construction materials, so that she and her husband can continue the work on their home in order to achieve their dream of providing a dignified home to their family. This is Jackeline's sixth loan cycle with Afodenic and she is thankful for the objectives she has met and the improvements in her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials in order to finish building her family's home

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: Since 2007, Philomina M. has worked as a petty trader in Elmina selling such goods as rice, oil, canned tomatoes and salt.  She is married with 2 children and has received an education through Senior High School.  While Philomena makes her living as a petty trader, her husband works in the Elmina area as a boat carver.  She is responsible for assisting her husband in paying school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase additional food items for re-sale and she hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and build a home.

loans.use: purchase additional food items for re-sale

loans.name: Delicia

texts.es:
DELICIA O. A., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SHIPIBAS” vive en Jr Rio tapiche, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 52 años de edad.

Se inició en el negocio de venta de abarrotes y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró víveres para vender.  Cuenta con clientes frecuentes  y su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco.

Hoy, ella ha progresado junto a su familia y el negocio de la bodega ha mejorado.  Con este préstamo de S/. 1,400.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará más productos como arroz, fideos, azúcar, papel higiénico, etc.

“Manuela Ramos es una ONG que apoya a una gran cantidad de familias, con pequeños préstamos que permite a las mujeres de esta zona a iniciar o a mejorar sus negocios y estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
DELICIA O. A. is a member of the “Mujeres Shipibas” Microfinance Institute. She lives on Rio Tapiche Street in the city of Pucallpa. She is 52 years old.

She started her own general store, and with her first 300.00 PEN loan, she bought goods to sell. She has a steady flow of customers, and her business is growing little by little.

She and her family have now made progress, and business has improved. With this 1,400.00 PEN loan, she will purchase goods like rice, noodles, sugar, bathroom tissue, etc.

“Manuela Ramos is a Non-Governmental Organization that supports a great deal of families with microloans that allow women in this area to start or improve their own businesses. I am happy with this help,” she stated.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods like bathroom tissue, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris B. is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, one son and two daughters, who are all still in school. One is in the senior high school, one in junior high schoo, and another in primary school. Her husband works with a small mining firm in the community.

Doris lives with the husband and children in a family house in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Doris is a petty trader. She sells smoked fish and tilapia. She procures the goods from nearby towns and sells on a table top in the market square. Doris has been in business for one year and desires to expand her business. She is hopeful to improve her standard of living and give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica A. is 48 years old. She is a wife and mother of two children. Currently both the children are in school. She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her source of livelihood. She has been supplying and retailing tiger nuts (edible tubers) for five years to support her family.

Tiger nuts have medicinal properties used in preparing local medicines for treating minor ailments. People also enjoy eating them for their good flavor. Veronica treks to Dambai in the northern part of Ghana to buy her stock of tiger nuts from farmers. This saves her from middlemen who buy from the farmers and re-sell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy a bulk supply of tiger nuts to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to pay for her kids' schooling. Veronica is a member of a community group called "shining star" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and support one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To purchase tiger nuts in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah T. is thirty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, one son and two daughters, who are all still young. One is in junior high school and one in primary school. The other has yet to start school. Her husband works with a small mining firm in the community.

Hannah lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She is a beverage seller. She prepares and sells beverage such as milo (cocoa), tea, porridge, etc. She prepares and sells the beverages in the evenings on the busy main street in the community. She procures the materials from provision stores in the nearby towns. Hannah has been in business for eight year and desires to expand her business. She is hopeful to improve her standard of living and give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy provisions for re-sale

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Isabel Nasceu em chibuto,tem 40 anos de idade vive maritalmente e e mae de 5 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 10 aos  25 anos de idade, somenta os tres mais novos e que vao a escola.

isabel sai de chibuto a namaacha uma vila na fronteira da swazilandia quando seu pai e transferido para trabalhar nas aguas da namaacha, apos a sua chegada não teve oportunidade de estudar pois o seu pai dava mais prioridade aos rapazes e as raparigas tinham que ir trabalhar na machamba.Entao comeca a fazer mukero venda de produtos contra bandiada, mas a actividade era de muito risco e implementa uma nova actividade de venda de sacos de amendoim e feijao adquiridas na swazilandia e revendidas na cidade capital actividade esta que pratica ate entao.por mês tem feito 3 viajens adquirindo 20 sacos em cada viajem 10 feijao a 1.320.00mt cada  e 10 de amendoim a 1.500.00mt cada e revende a 1.600.00mt e a 1.900.00mt respectivamente.tem tido um lucro no valor de 5.000.00mt por mês,não consegue poupar nenhum valor pois para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pela sua mae esta que se encontra na cidade capital enviando lhe um valor de 1.000.00mt em cada mês e e proprietaria de uma obra ainda em construçao..Conhece a hluvuku atraves da sua amiga nossa cliente MARTA ZUCULE e aproxima se aos nossos servicos solicitando um emprestimo no valor de 10.000.00mt para aumentar oo seu volume de mercadoria.
  

Este e o segundo emprestimo de isabel na hluvuku e primeiro no kiva. Os primeiros 5.000.00mt foram usados para aumentar o volume do seu negocio valor este que pagou sem nenhum problema  e pede estes 10.000.00mt para reforçar a venda dos mesmos produtos. Esta confiante que irs reembolsar antes do prazo e pedir um novo para comprar uma carrinha que lhe facilitara na venda a  dos seus produtos na capital
texts.en:
Isabel was bornin in Chibuto. She is 40 years old, married, and mother of 5 children between the ages of 10 and 25. Only the 3 youngest are going to school. Isabel moved from Chibuto to Namaacha, a village that borders Swaziland, when her father was transferred to work on the waters of Namaacha. After their arrival, Isabel did not have the opportunity to study because her father gave priority to the boys, and the girls had to work on the “machamba” (small agricultural holding). She began going across the border to get contraband products to sell, but this became too risky so she switched to selling sacks of peanuts and beans purchased in Swaziland and sold in the capital city. Isabel does this until today. She makes 3 trips per month and purchases 20 sacks each trip – 10 of beans, which cost 1,320 MT each, and 10 of peanuts, which cost 1,500 MT each. She is able to resell them for 1,600 MT and 1,900 MT each, respectively. Her monthly profit is 5,000 MT a month, but she is not able to save any of it because, besides being responsible for her children, she also supports her mother who lives in the capital with 1,000 MT a month, and has some construction being done on her property. Isabel found out about Hluvuku through a friend and Hluvuku client, Marta Zucule. Isabel is asking for a loan of 10,000 MT so that she can increase her stock. This is Isabel’s second loan with Hluvuku, and her first through Kiva. Her first loan of 5,000 MT was used to increase her business, which she repaid without any problems. She is requesting 10,000 MT to strengthen the sales of the same products. Isabel is confident that she can repay her loan before the due date so that she can request a new loan that she will put toward buying a pickup truck or van that will make selling her products in the capital easier.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying and selling grain

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Married with five children, Patience G. is a forty-four-year-old petty trader. She believes in hard work and dedication as the primary antidote to poverty and for that matter, she is very serious with her business. She sells maize, beans and gari. She has been in business for the past twelve years and has been very resourceful for her family. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of maize, beans and gari to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices. She is a member of the trust group called "shining star". In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and provide support for each other to repay the loan

loans.use: To purchase maize, beans and gari in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence O. is fifty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, three sons and three daughters. She says some of her children are in junior high school while others are in primary school. Two are currently in senior high school.

Florence lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works to support her husband financially to provide for the family and especially meet the children’s school demands. Her husband is a farmer. He cultivates palm nuts. Florence is a petty trader. She runs a provision store on one of the principal streets in her community. She also sells vegetables on a small table top in front of her store.

Florence procures her goods from wholesalers in Oda and other nearby towns. Florence has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure provisions for re-sale

loans.name: Julio Alberto

texts.es: El señor Julio Alberto A., tiene la edad de  75 años, habita en el barrio las Francia numero uno en Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa, la cual le apoya con los trabajos agrícolas, ellos tiene a su cargo dos nietos, una niña de nueve años y un niño de siete, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida a sus nietos, para poder darle mejor bienestar. Don Julio desde hace 25 años se dedica a la agricultura, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la perdida del cultivo ya que los gases del volcán, le afecta, el inicio los trabajos agrícolas lo inicio con sus propios esfuerzos. El financiamiento lo quiere, para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes para mejorar el cultivo y poder sacar una buena producción y vende a mejor precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Julio Alberto A. is 75 years old and lives in a neighborhood of Ticuantepe together with his wife, who helps him with the farm work. They are raising two dependent grandchildren, a nine year old girl and a seven year old boy. Their plan for the family is to improve the conditions in which their grandchildren live in order to improve their wellbeing. Julio has been working in agriculture for 25 years. The greatest difficulty he faces is the loss of crops, since the gases from a nearby volcano affect the crops. He started his farming business with his own efforts. He wants the loan in order to buy supplies and fertilizer in roder to improve the quality of his crops, reap a good harvest and sell his products at a better price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and fertilizers in order to improve his harvest

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
casada con tres hijos. 

Comenzo con su negocio hace 2 años, haciendo demostraciones de productos para el hogar.
ella pide su colaboracion para comprar mas productos y poder hacer estas demostraciones, y seguir con las ventas, ya que es parte fundamental de los ingresos en su hogar, junto con el apoyo de su esposo, para brindarun  mejor futuro a sus hijos.

la señora es buena en las ventas y le han estado demandando mas productos, pero no le alcanza para la compra de estos.

apoyemos este caso emprendedor.
texts.en:
Rosa Maria is married with three children. She began this business two years ago, giving demonstrations for home products. She requests your collaboration to buy more products and to be able to give these demonstrations, which will allow her to continue with her sales. These sales are a fundamental part of her household income. Together with the support of her husband, they want to offer a better future to their children. Rosa Maria is good at sales and has requested more products, but she does not have enough money to make the purchases of these items. Let's support this enterprising person.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY GOODS

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
DORA S. R., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SHIPIBAS” vive en el Jr Israel Mz.193.Lt.6, yarinacocha, tiene 51 años de edad, 7 hijos, y su pareja es maderero (venta de madera).

Se inició en el negocio de venta de abarrotes, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles compró arroz, azúcar, huevos, etc. para vender, cuenta con clientes frecuentes y su negocio ha ido creciendo.

Ella ha progresado con su familia y el negocio ha mejorado.  Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de más gaseosas y productos diversos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, otros..

“si no fuese por estos préstamos que dá Manuela Ramos creo que no tendría mi negocio, por ello estoy feliz de pertenecer a esta institución.
texts.en:
DORA S. R. is a member of the “MUJERES SHIPIBAS” Microfinance Institute. She lives in Yarinacocha . She is a 51-year-old mother with 7 children. Her husband sells lumber for a living.

She started her own general store with her first 300.00 PEN loan. She purchased rice, sugar, eggs, etc. to sell them in her store. She has a fixed clientele, and her business has been growing.

She and her family have made progress, and her business has improved. With this 1,200.00 PEN loan, she will purchase more soft drinks and an assortment of goods, such as rice, sugar, noodles, and others.

“If it weren’t for the loans that Manuela Ramos has given me, I don’t think I would have my own business. For this reason, I am happy to be a part of this institution.”

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks and other products (sugar, eggs, rice, etc.)

loans.name: Helena

texts.pt:
Helena nasceu em gaza tem 42 anos de idade, e casada e mae de 2 filhos a primeira de 22 anos e o segundo de 20 anos o mais novo e que vai a escola.

Helena sai de gaza a namaacha uma vila na fronteira da swazilandia  quando seu marido e trsnsferido para trabalhar como guarda fronteira. Anos depois o seu esposo perde a vida deixando a com 2 filhos por criar, a vida fica muito dificil para helena entao seu genro da lhe um fundo para iniciar o seu proprio negocio. Entao inicia com o negocio de troca  de latas vazias adquiridas na capital e revandia na fronteira em troca ganhava lagerins, sandalisa plasticas e cestos consequentimente  de novo fazia a revenda na capital e vice versa, o seu negocio foi crescendo e resolve mudar de actividade pois aquela era muito cansativa. Em 2000 consegue aranjar uma banca no mercado central onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade tem como melhor produto o amendoim, o tomate , o coco , e o oleo adquiridos na swazilandia o saco a 1.320.00mt a caixa a 500.00mt , o saco  500.00mt e a caixa a 450.00mt. tem viajado 2 vezes por semana porque para alem de vender no mercado central tem vendido tambem não mercado informal shoprite nas quartas e sabados, tem um lucro de 2.500.00mt por mês consegue poupar 500.00mt responsabiliza se somente pelo neto.

Este e o segundo emprestimo de helena na hluvuku e rpimeiro comkiva. Estes 8.000.00mt seram usados para aumentar o volume do stock esta confiante que vai reembolsar sem nenhum problema pois para alem de ser negociante e secretaria do bairro 25 de junho onde recebe algumas propinas em cada 3 meses, e pretende construir a sua propria barraca na sua residencia.
texts.en:
Helena was born in Gaza. She is 42 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children. The oldest is 22 and the second, who is in school, is 20. Helena moved from Gaza to Namaacha, a village that borders Swaziland, when her husband was transferred to work as a border guard. Several years later her husband lost his life, leaving her with 2 children to raise. Life was very difficult for Helena, so her son in law gave her some money to start her own business. She began by obtaining empty cans in the capital and re-selling them on the border in exchange for lingerie, plastic sandals, and baskets. These she took back to the capital to re-sell, and start the process again. Once her business grew, Helena decided to change because it was very tiring. In 2000 she was able to obtain a stand in the central market where she sells primary goods. Her best sellers are peanuts (1,320 MT a sack), tomatoes (500 a box), coconuts (500 a sack), and oil (450 a box), which are acquired in Swaziland. She travels twice a week because besides selling at the market she also sells at the informal Shoprite market on Wednesdays and Saturdays. Helena’s monthly income is 2,500 MT, and she is able to save 500 MT a month. She supports only her grandson. This is Helena’s second loan with Hluvuku, and her first through Kiva. The 8,000 MTshe is requesting will be used to increase her stock. She is confident that she can repay her loan without problems, because besides being a businesswoman, she is also the 25 de Junho neighborhood secretary from which she gets some income every 3 months. She intends to build her own home on her property.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and selling primary goods

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina N. is a 32-year-old married mother of six children – three sons and three daughters. Some of her children are in junior high school while the others are in primary school. Georgina lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Takorase, a farming/commercial town near Akim Oda, in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Georgina works to support her husband in providing for the family and, in particular, to provide for the children's schooling. Her husband deals in diamond minerals.

Georgina is a trader in foodstuffs and has been in business for two years. She buys plantain from nearby smaller communities and sells it to food vendors and retailers. Georgina wants a loan to purchase goods in bulk so that she can expand her business and give her children the best education.

loans.use: To purchase plantain

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a 46-year-old widow with five children. She is a hard-working businesswoman who trades in her community in plantain, cassava, tomatoes and palm nuts. She buys her supply of foodstuffs from surrounding villages, and enjoys her work very much. However, commodity prices and transport costs have gone up due to the current fuel crisis, and this has rendered Rita's working capital most inadequate to purchase appreciable quantities to sell. She therefore needs a loan to inject additional capital into her business to enable her to meet the demands of the market. She wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies of foodstuffs. 

Rita hopes to increase her savings in order to pay her children's education fees. She is a member of the community group Shining Star, a trust group in which members guarantee for one another as social collateral for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase plantain, cassava, tomatoes and palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet O. is 23 years old and is married with one son, who is currently in nursery school. She lives with her son and husband in a rented apartment in Takorase, a farming/commercial town near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Janet works to support her husband in providing for the family. Her husband deals in diamond minerals.

Janet is a trader in pastries. She fries pastries such as meat pies, doughnuts, etc. in her home and hawks to sell them. She also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Janet buys her ingredients from nearby supermarkets. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to purchase goods in bulk. Janet hopes to expand her business and generate some savings for the future.

loans.use: To purchase flour and ingredients

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Josefa del Carmen G. , tiene  la edad de 37 años , habita en el barrio el Edén , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo , el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ya que ellos tienen a su cargo tres hijos , los cuales estudian actualmente , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , para darle un mejor bienestar , ella desde hace 21 años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y las plagas que afectan al cultivo, ella inicio los trabajos agrícolas , con la ayuda de su esposo y el esfuerzo propio de ella . El financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para mejorar las condiciones de sus siembras. En donde tiene la esperanza que esta vez será una buena cosecha la cual le generara buenas ganancias. Este es su sexto ciclo en Afodenic y da las gracias por los beneficios  y el apoyo que ha obtenido para seguir adelante con la producción.
texts.en:
Mrs. Josefa del Carmen G. is 37 years old and lives in the Eden neighborhood in the city of Ticuantepe together with her husband, who helps her with the household expenses. They have three dependent children, all in school. Their plan for their familiy is to improve the conditions in which they live in order to improve their wellbeing. Josefa has worked in agriculture for 21 years. The greatest difficulties she faces are the lack of financing and the pests that affect the crops. She started the farming business with her own efforts and the help of her husband. She wants the financing to buy supplies and fertilizers, in order to improve the growing conditions of the crops she plants. She has hope that this year will be a good harvest and will generate good earnings. This is her sixth loan cycle with Afodenic and she is thankful for the benefits and the support that she has received and that have made it possible for her to move ahead with her crop production.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy supplies and fertilizers in order to treat her crops and improve crop production.

loans.name: Edit Luz

texts.es:
EDIT LUZ M. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SHIPIBAS” vive en el Jr nueva york Mz.B.Lt.7, en yarinacocha, tiene 45 años de edad, 2 hijos, y su pareja es operador de máquinas.

Se inició en el negocio de venta de abarrotes y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró víveres para vender en su bodega.
 
Hoy, ella ha progresado con su familia y el negocio de la bodega ha mejorado.  Con este préstamo de S/. 1,400.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará diversos víveres y frutas para implementar su bodega.

“Manuela Ramos me esta apoyando  en la educación de mis hijos, por ello estoy muy agradecida y contenta por esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
EDIT LUZ M. V. is a member of the “MUJERES SHIPIBAS” Microfinance Institute. She lives in Yarinacocha. She is a 45-year-old mother of two. Her husband works as a machine operator.

She started her own general store with her first 300.00 PEN loan. She purchased goods so that she could sell them at her store.

Now, she and her family have made progress, and the general store has improved. With this 1,400.00 PEN loan, she will purchase assorted goods and fruits to restock her shop.

“Manuela Ramos is helping me provide an education for my children, and for this reason, I am very happy and grateful for this opportunity.”

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods like rice, noodles, sugar, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.pt:
Elisa nasceu em maputo tem 30 anos de idade vive maritalmente, estudou ate a 8 classe  e mae de 2 filhos o primeiro de 10 anos e a segunda de 6 anos todods vao a escola.

Elisa sai de maputo a namaacha uma vila na fronteira de swazilandia com sua mae apos a sua nascencia, inicia com os estudos muito tarde quando tinha 12 anos  pois era muito duentinha o tempo foi passando e a sua mae não conseguia mas custear os seus estudos. entao ela sacrificava se levando alguns produtos e ajudava a sua mae a vender na hora do recreo, passou tambem a vender nas noites  caçando o movimento dos alunos que estudavam de noite e fica gravida do seu primeiro filho. mas como o seu namorado era desempregado e ela intendia de negocio a mae da  lhe um fundo e ela inicia o seu proprio negocio de venda de produtos de primeira necessidade entao consegue construir a sua propria casa. Anos depois muda de actividade e começca com a venda de produtos de beleza mas teve que interroper quando entra em vigor nas escolas uma lei  que alegava que nenhuma aluna deveria trançar mecha, entao ela divercifica a sua mercadoria comprando calçados e capulanas adquiridas na capital a 35.00mt por par e a 50.00mt cada capulana  e revendida a 50.00mt o par e a 75.00mt a capulana consecutivamente aqui no distrito. Tem viajado a capital 2 vezes por semana pois para alem de vender no mercado central vende no mercado informal shoprite nas quartas e sabados tem um lucro mensal de 3.000.00mt por mês não consegue poupar nenhum valor pois encontra se a construir e responsabiliza se pelo seu cunhado que vive  com ela em sua casa.Este e o primeiro emprestimo de elisa na hluvuku e kiva . estes 7.000.00mt seram usados para aumentar o volume do seu stock uma ves que se aproxima o inverno mitos clientes solicitam sapatilhas e ela quer estar preparada para satisfazer a necessidade dos seus cientes a tempo e hora. Esta confiante que vai desembolsar antes do tempo determinado e pedir mais emprestimo para melhorar mais ainda o seu negocio.
texts.en:
Elisa was born in Maputo and studied until the 8th grade. She is 30 years old, married, and mother of 2 children. The oldest is 10 years old, and the second is 6. Both are in school. Elisa moved from Maputo to Namaacha, a village that borders Swaziland, with her mother right after she was born. She began her schooling only when she was 12 because she had always been very sickly. When her mother could no longer to pay for her schooling, Elisa did her part to help by selling a few products at school during recess time, and at night to the night-school students. When Elisa got pregnant with her first child, her boyfriend was unemployed. Seeing that she was good at business, Elisa’s mother gave her some money to start her own. She sold primary goods, and was eventually able to build her own house. Some years later she began selling beauty products, but had to stop when a law went into effect saying that students were not permitted to braid their hair. So she began selling shoes and sarongs purchased in the capital. The shoes are purchased for 35.00 MT and sold for 50.00 MT, and the sarongs are purchased for 50.00 MT and sold for 75.00 MT in this district. Elisa travels to the capital twice a week because, besides selling her wares at the central market, she also sells at the informal Shoprite market on Wednesdays and Saturdays. Her monthly income is 3,000.00 MT, and she is not able to put any of it toward savings since she is having some construction done and takes care of her brother in-law that lives in her home. This is Elisa’s first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. The 70,000.00 MT she is requesting will be used to increase her stock now that winter is approaching and many clients are requesting shoes. She wants to be prepared to meet the needs of her clients at the right time. She is confident that she can repay her loan before the set time, and so she can request another loan to further improve her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and selling shoes

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama S., twenty eight years, is a married woman with three children who are in school. Mariama lives with her family at Bawjiase, a suburb of Sweduru in Ghana. She runs a small provision kiosk in her neighborhood. She also sells food items such as macaroni, tomatoes, etc. on a table top in front of her kiosk. She has been in business for seven years.

 Mariama buys her goods from wholesalers in the city and markets in nearby towns.  She desires to buy the goods in bulk whenever she travels to the city in order to save her the problem of frequent trips. She is in a group called “Shining Star”. The group members guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Issah

texts.en:
Issah A. is a forty-four-year-old married man and the father of two children, a son and a daughter. He says his son has yet to start school while his daughter is in nursery school. His wife works to make some income to help him out financially. She is a food vendor.

Issah lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Takorase. Takorase is a farming and busy trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Issah is a butcher. He works in his own small abattoir shed in the market square. He buys live animals such as goats, sheep, cattle, etc, kills them and sells the meat. According to Issah, most of his customers are food vendors in his community. He buys the livestock from the farmers in his community. He has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to procure more livestock.

loans.use: To buy livestock to slaughter and sell

loans.name: Rahinatu

texts.en:
Rahinatu M. is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, two sons and three daughters. Some are in senior high school while others are in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Rahinatu works to help her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband is a mason by profession. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells porridge in the mornings.

Rahinatu prepares the porridge from ingredients such as millet, maize, beans, etc. She sells in front of her house to the people in her community. Rahinatu has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She is hopeful to expand her business and make some savings into her future.

loans.use: To buy maize, millet, etc. to use to prepare cooked food

loans.name: Elita

texts.es:
ELITA S. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas de Pucallpa” vive en AA:HH 4 de junio. del distrito de Manantay, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 37 años de edad, 2 hijos, y su pareja es profesor.

Se inició en el negocio de venta de ropas y con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles compró ropas de niños y adultos.

Actualmente continúa con el mismo negocio, vende ropa a todas  sus  amistades y conocidos de la zona.  Elita nos menciona que su negocio ha mejorado, por ello necesita más capital para volver a abastecerse de ropa que pueda vender a crédito y contado.  Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en comprar más ropa para niños y adultos.

“Manuela Ramos es una ONG, que apoya a una gran cantidad de familias, con pequeños prestamos que permite a las mujeres de esta zona a iniciar, o a mejorar sus negocios y estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
ELITA S. S. is 37 years old and belongs to the Communal Bank “Las estrellitas de Pucallpa” (The little stars of Pucallpa). She lives in AA: HH June 4th, in the Manantay district of the city of Pucallpa with her two children and her partner, a professor. She started in the business of clothing sales with the first loan of s. 300.00 Nuevos Soles and bought clothes for children and adults. At the moment she continues with the same business, selling clothes to all her friends and acquaintances in the area. Elita mentions to us that her business has improved, and for that reason she needs more capital to re-supply clothing to sell on credit and cash. With this loan of s. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, she will invest in buying more clothes for children and adults. “Manuela Ramos is a ONG, that supports a great amount of families with small loans that allow the women of this area to initiate or improve their businesses and I am happy with that help”.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing for children and adult

loans.name: Getzamani Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Getzamani esta ubicado en la zona sur de nuestro pais, un lugar caliente y muy bonito por su infraestructura, Choluteca es uno de los departamentos que tiene mucho moviemiento comercial, la gente que vive en esta ciudad se caracteriza por ser muy amable y hospitalaria.
los integrantes del grupo son:
Martha Dilia R., ella se dedica a la venta de empanadas, tamalitos y pisques, desde hace mucho tiempo, con esta actividad a logrado sacar adelante a su familia, ella es madre soltera tiene dos hijas, una de ellas ya esta casada y la otra esta en el colegio, en los tiempos libres le ayuda, ella viaja a la ciudad para comprar los platanos, frijoles, hoja de huerta, azucar, canela, aceite y maseca para poder preparar los tamalitos y las empanadas, ella vende su producto en su pueblo y en los caserios cercanos a el.
 Ritza E.: se dedica a la venta de verduras, tiene un pequeño puesto de ventas en su casa de habitacion, ella compra la verdura a carros que la traen de varios lados, ella tiene muchos clientes por su buena atencion que les brinda a los clientes, las verduras es un alimento que se consume mucho en nuestro pais, ademas de ser muy ricas contienen muchas vitaminas las cuales el cuerpo las necesita en el diario vivir, , ella tiene 3 hijos que estan en la escuela del pueblo. con el esfuerzo y el de su esposo han logrado sacar adelante su hogar y estan muy felices ya que todo les ha ido muy bien. el sueño de ella es llegar a tener un mercadito de verduras con muchas variedades y tambien vender frutas.
 Blanca L.: se dedica a la venta de tortillas, ella se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para preparar la masa y empezar a hacer las tortillas, ella tiene tres hijos los cuales estan en la escuela, ella compra el maiz y la leña para fabricar sus tortillas, ella las vende en diferentes pulperias y tambien en su casa de habitacion.
ellos necesitan el credito para poder salir adelante con sus negocios y familias, tienen la fe en Dios en que todo les va a salir muy bien de ahora en adelante.
texts.en:
The Gezamani group is located in the southern zone of their country. It is hot place with a beautiful infrastructure. Choluteca is one of the departments with a lot of commercial movement. The people who live in this city are characterized as being friendly and hospitable. The members of the group are: Martha Dilia R. has been selling empanadas, tamalitos or little tamales, and large tamales for a long time. This activity has allowed her family to get ahead. She is a single mother with two daughters. One of them is married. The other goes to school, and helps during her free time. Martha travels to the city to buy bananas, beans, vegetable leaves, sugar, cinnamon, oil and corn flour to be able to make her little tamales and empanadas. She sells her products in her town and in nearby areas. Ritza E. sells vegetables from a small stand in her home. She takes cars to buy the vegetables from different places. She has many customers because she gives them good attention. Lots of vegetables are eaten in her country. Besides being delicious, they have lots of vitamins that the body needs daily. She has 3 children who are in the town school. With her efforts and the efforts of her husband, they have been able to do well with their home, and they are happy that everything has gone very well for them. Her dream is to have a little vegetable market with lots of different vegetables and fruit. Blanca L. sells tortillas. She gets up at 4 in the morning to make the dough and start making the tortillas. She has three children who are in school. She buys the corn and the wood to make her tortillas. She sells them in different stores and from her home. They need a loan to be able to get ahead with their businesses and their families. They have faith in God that everything will turn out well from now on.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy corn flour, corn, meat, oil, butter, vegetables

loans.name: Zuera

texts.en:
Zuera A. is thirty years old, single and independent. She loves fashion very much and as a result, she sells costume jewelry like earrings, necklaces and ladies' bags. She has been selling jewelry for the past 8 years.

Zuera buys her goods from Accra and Togo. She hawks her goods from house to house and also treks to nearby markets to sell. Zuera wants to use the loan to buy costume jewelry in bulk so she can trek to other markets. She is in a group called ‘shining star’ Trust Bank in her community. The members in the group guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more costume jewelry to sell

loans.name: Maura Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Maura del Socorro López Cáceres , tiene la edad de 61 años , habita en el barrio Juan Ramón Padilla , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , ella es madre soltera , tiene seis hijos , ya todos mayor de edad , trabajan por cuenta propia ella tiene una pulpería el cual ha ido incrementando poco a poco también sus hijos le apoyan con algunos gastos de la casa , doña Maura quiere mejorar su vivienda , ya que se acerca el invierno y no quiere que se le pase el agua , como en años anteriores , Ella inicio a construir con el apoyo de su hija , pero ella ya esta casada .La señora  quiere el financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción y poder hacer las mejoras necesarias como cambiar el techo de su vivienda. Este es su sexto ciclo en Afodenic y da las gracias por contribuir a las mejoras de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maura del Socorro López Cáceres, 61, lives in the Juan Ramón Padilla neighborhood, which is located in the Ticuantepe municipality. She is a single mother, and she has six grown children who all work on their own. She has a small mini market that has been growing little by little. Her children help her with some of the household expenses. Maura would like to improve her home. Since winter is coming, she does not want water to leak into the house as it has done in previous years. She started construction with her daughter’s help, but now her daughter is married. She wants the loan to buy construction materials. She will then be able to make the needed improvements, like changing the roof on her home. This is her sixth loan cycle with Afodenic. She is thankful that they have contributed to improvements for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to repair the roof on her home

loans.name: Zaida Avelino

texts.pt:
Zaida nasceu em marracuene tem 33 anos de idade, vive maritalmenta estudou ate a 8 classe e mae de 1 filho de 11 anos que vive na africa do sul em casa da sua irma mais velha, e encontra se a estudar.

Zaida sai de marracuene devido a guerra com seus pais a namaacha uma vila na fronteira de swazilandia. Apos sua chegada continua com os estudos mas teve que interroper quando fica gravida e sua irma convida lhe para morar com ela na africa do sul onde ela começa a trabalhar num salao de beleza durante 2 anos. Anos depois  com o fundo que havia colectado enquanto trabalhava inicia o seu proprio negocio de venda de roupas diversas que revendia em marracuene, entao junta se com o seu esposo este que vivia em moçambique e ela muda se mas continuando a praticar o seu negocio. Tem como melhores encomendas e adguiridos a (vasos a 250.00mt, cortinas a 450.00mt, mantas a 500.00mt, lençois e calças a 350.00mt) e revende ao dobro cada encomenda, tem viajado 2 vezes por mês pois os seus clientes fazem os pagamentos em prestaçoes e tem tido um lucro mensal no valor de 3.000.00mt não consegue poupar nenhum valor  porque esta a viver numa casa de  aluguer onde paga um valor de 800.00mt por mês  e esta  a construir a sua propria casa, Para alem do seu filho responsabiliza se pela sua sobrinha que vive com ela em sua casa


Este e o primeiro emprestimo de zaida na hluvuku e kiva, estes 10.000.00mt seram usados para aumentar o volume dos seus stocks e poder satisfazer a necessidade dos seus clientes a tempo e hora. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo estipulado e pedir um novo emprestimo para dar continuidade da sua obra pois ela já não aguenta viver numa  casa de aluguer.
texts.en:
Zaida was born in Marracuene and is 33 years old. She is married, went to school until the 8th grade, and is the mother of an 11 year-old son who lives in South Africa with her oldest sister. He is in school. Zaida left Marracuene with her parents due to the war and went to Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland. After her arrival she continued with her schooling, but she had to stop when she became pregnant, and her sister invited her to live with her in South Africa. She began working in a beauty salon in Marracuene. She married her husband, who lives in Mozambique, and moved with him but continued practicing her business. Her best orders are vases at 250MT, curtains at 450MT, blankets at 500MT, and sheets and pants at 350MT. She resells for twice the cost each order. She travels 2 times per month since her customers make payments in installments, and she earns 3,000MT monthly. She is unable to save any money because she is living in a rental home and pays 800MT per month, she is constructing her own home, and besides her son she is also responsible for her niece who lives with her in her home. This is Zaida's first loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva. The 10,000MT will be used to increase the volume of her stock to satisfy the demand of her customers on time. She is confident that she will pay off the loan before the stipulated time so she can request another loan to continue her work on her home because she cannot handle living in a rental house anymore.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of various linens

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO BUY GOODS

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Since 1997, Vivian D. has worked as a petty trader in Elmina selling various goods such as tomatoes and onions.  She is married with 4 children and has received no formal education. While Vivian works as a petty trader, her husband is employed as a fisherman.  She is responsible for assisting her husband in paying various household expenses, such as school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase additional food supplies for re-sale and she hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and build a home.

loans.use: purchase additional food supplies for re-sale

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
ELSA S. C., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES PRODUCTIVAS” vive en el Jr Walter Mz.403 Lt.6, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 48 años de edad y 2 hijos.

Se inició en el negocio de venta de gaseosas y carbón (combustible), con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró víveres para vender, cuenta con clientes frecuentes.

Hoy en día, ella ha progresado junto a su familia y el negocio de la bodega ha mejorado.  Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará 3 paquetes de gaseosas, 1 caja de atún y hará algunos arreglos en el local (mantenimiento).

“Manuela Ramos es una ONG que apoya a una gran cantidad de mujeres, con pequeños préstamos que permite invertir en negocios que podamos vender y así aumentar los ingresos en la casa para apoyar a la familia”.
texts.en:
Elsa S. C. is a member of the Community Bank named "Mujeres Productivas", meaning Productive Women. She livesin Jr. Walter Z. 403 Lt.6, in the city of Pucallpa. She is 48 years old and has 2 children.

She started her business selling soft drinks and coal (fuel). With her first loan of S/.300 nuevos soles, she purchased groceries for resale to her steady clientele.

She and her family have grown and the grocery store business has improved. With this loan of S/1000 nuevos soles she will purchase 3 cartons of soft drinks, 1 box of canned tuna, and in addition she will also make some repairs to her store (maintenance).

"Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) is Non-Governmenal-Organization that provides support to many women through small loans to invest in our businesses, to sell and increase the household income to support the family."


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and canned tuna. To carry out maintenance to repairs to the store.
