loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: La señora Karla Patricia C. R., habita en las Pilas Orientales, junto a su esposo, el cual le apoya con los trabajos agrícolas, ellos tiene  a su cargo dos hijos, una niña de 6 años y un niño de dos, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y en un futuro poder comprar mas terreno e invertir en mas producción. Ella desde hace ocho años trabaja como agricultora, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento, ella inicio como agricultora con el apoyo de sus suegros, con el financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para mejorar la producción y poder vender la producción a mejor precio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Karla Patricia C. R. lives with her husband in Pilas Orientales. He helps her with her agricultural work. They have a 6 year old daughter and a two year old son. The family plans are to improve their living conditions and, in the future, buy more land to increase production. She has been working in agriculture for eight years. The biggest difficulty is the lack of financing. She started her work with the support of her in laws. With the loan she will buy fertilizers and supplies to improve production and be able to sell at a better price.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizer to improve her crops

loans.name: Eva Mercedes

texts.es:
EVA MERCEDES P. Y., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las innovadoras II” vive en el Jr Toronto MZ.6, tiene 37 años de edad, 3 hijos, y su pareja es albañil.

Se inició en el negocio de venta de abarrotes y con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró víveres para abastecer su negocio.

Hoy en día, ella ha sabido progresar con su familia y el negocio de la bodega ha mejorado, tanto que le permite costear los gastos del colegio y así sus hijos pueden estudiar.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará 1 caja de leche, 2 paquetes de gaseosas, y caja de atún, etc. 

“Mi negocio lo tengo gracias a  Manuela Ramos que me otorgó el préstamo sin mucho trámite ni dificultades y estoy segura que podré hacer crecer más mi negocio para que mis hijos sean profesionales”.
texts.en:
Eva Mercedes P. Y. belongs to the Communal Bank “Las innovadoras II”, lives in Jr Toronto MZ.6, is 37 years old with 3 children, and her husband is a bricklayer. She started her business selling groceries, and with a loan of 300 Nuevos Soles she purchased provisions with which to supply her business. Nowadays, she’s been able to move up with her family and her business has improved, so much so that it has enabled her to afford school expenses, allowing her children to study. With this loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles she will purchase 1 box of milk, 2 packages of soda, cans of tuna, etc. “I own my business thanks to Manuela Ramos, who approved my loan without much paperwork or difficulties, and I’m sure that I’ll be able to make my business grow so that my children can grow up to be professionals”.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase of various products such as milk, soda, tuna, etc

loans.name: Laurentina Naife

texts.pt:
Laurentina nasceu em zavala, tem 40anos de idade vive maritalmente estudou ate a 7 classe e mae de um filho que se encontra a estudar na universidade pedagogica na capital. 

Laurentina sai de zavala com seus pais em emissao de serviço a namaacha uma vila na fronteira de swazilanda pois seu pai era funcionario do governo do distrito, chegado a namaacha não teve acesso a escola devido a falta de documentaçao d transiçao de uma escola para outra e ficou sem estudar. O tempo foi passando e esta fica gravida do seu primeiro e único filho este que foi regeitado pelo seu namorado alegando que o filho que ela esperava ter não lhe pertencia, laurentina fica desesperada e pede ajuda ao seu pai este dalhe um fundo e ela iniicia com o seu proprio negocio de venda de riçois no mercado clandestino.Com o fundo colectado ela começa a fazer refeiçoes na fronteirada swazilandia onde amaior fluxo de gente, hoje e dona de um estabelecimento de refeiçoes  por dia tem comprado 10 frangos a 100 cada, 5kg de dobrada a 50 o kg  , 5kg de carne a 95 cada, cada  prato tem seu preço por exemplo o frango tem feito 40.00mt o prato e consegue fazer 7 pratos por frango a carne e a dobrado não tem numeros esactos dependem muito mais da qualidade da carne, tem vendido diariamente 1.500.00mt nos dias normais e 2.300.00mt nos dias de muito movimento mas consegue poupar somente 500.00mt devido as dispesas do seu filho que se encontra na universidade e  dos 2 empregados um dos quais ajuda lhe na barraca ganhando 800.00mt e outra em casa gahando 700.00mt mensalmente.

Este e o segundo emprestimo de laurentina na hluvuku e primeiro com kiva . estes 10.000.00mt seram usados para comprar mais produtos pois ela esta prestes a abrir um outro estabelecimento de refeiçoes no mercado informal shoprite e revender produtos produtos de primeira necessidade. Esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo estipulado e pedir um novo emprestimo para mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Laurentina was born in Zavala. She is 40 years old, married, and went to school until the 7th grade. She is the mother of one son who is studying at the Pedagogical University in the Capital. Laurentina left Zavala with her parents who were serving in Namaacha, a town on the border of Swaziland, since her father was an official of the local government. Having arrived in Namaacha she did not have access to schooling due to a lack of documentation for transfers from one school to another so she went without. Time passed, and she became pregnant with her first and only child who was rejected by her boyfriend who alleged that the child she hoped to have did not belong to him. Laurentina became desperate and asked for help from her father who gave her some funds. She began her own business of selling empanadas on the black market. With the funds collected she began to prepare food on the Swaziland border where there was a large flux of people. Today she is the owner of a food stand. Every day she purchases 10 chickens at 100 each, 5kg of stomach at 50 per kg, and 5kg of beef at 95 per kg. Each plate has a price. For example, the chicken plate is 40MT per plate, and she can make 7 plates per chicken. The beef and the stomach do not have exact numbers because it depends on the quality of the meat. She sells 1,500MT on the normal days and 2,300MT on the busy days, but she is only able to save 500MT due to the expenses of her son, who is at the university, and her 2 employees. One of her employees helps her in the stand earning 800MT, and the other helps at home earning 700MT monthly. This is Laurentina's second loan with Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. This 10,000MT will be used to purchase more products since she is ready to open another food stand in the informal market, Shoprite, to resell staple products. She is confident that she will be able to pay off the loan before the stipulated time and request another loan in order to furnish her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare foods

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es:
GIOVANA M. C. pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS MARGARITAS” vive en Jr Pisqui nº 383. del distrito de Callería, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 23 años de edad, no tiene hijos.

Se inició en el negocio de confección y costura de ropa, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró telas e hilos.
 
En la actualidad confecciona juegos de  ropa de cama, juego de sabanas y es muy creativa en lo que hace.  Con este préstamo de S/. 2,200.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de una nueva máquina de coser.

“Me siento realizada dado que Manuela Ramos me dio la oportunidad de tener mi propio negocio y así poder costear mis estudios y mi sueño es ser una gran empresaria.
texts.en:
Giovana M. C. belongs to the Banco Comunal “Las Margaritas”. She lives in Jr Pisqui #383 in the Calleria district of Pucallpa, is 23 years old and has no children. She began her business of tailoring clothes, and with her first loan of 300 Nuevos Soles purchased fabrics and thread. These days she sews linen sets for beds and is very creative in what she does. With this new loan of 2,200 Nuevos Soles she will invest in the purchase of a new sewing machine. “I feel very accomplished thanks to Manuela Ramos, who gave me the opportunity to own my business, thus allowing me to afford my studies. My dream is to be a great entrepreneur”.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco Javier C. Ríos, tiene la edad de 38 años habita en el barrio Juan Ramón Padilla, en el municipio de Ticuantepe,  junto a su esposa, la cual trabaja como comerciante, para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos, una adolescente de 14 años y un varón de 10 años, estudiantes de la primaria,  los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus hijos y darle un mejor bienestar. El trabaja como guardas de seguridad para INTA, desde hace ocho meses, el solicita financiamiento para la compra de materiales de construcción ya que quiere mejorar parte de la vivienda ya que es de tabla y zinc y desea tener las paredes de concreto y poder darle a su familia una casa digna.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier C. Ríos is 38 years old and lives in the Juan Ramon Padilla neighborhood of the city of Ticuantepe together with his wife, who works as a shopkeeper in order to help help with the household expenses. They have two dependent children, a 14 year old girl and a 10 year old boy, both of whom are currently elementary school students. Their plans for the family are to give the children better living conditions in order to improve their wellbeing. Francisco has worked for 8 months as a security guard for INTA. He is requesting financing in order to buy construction materials since he wants to improve part of the family home, which is current made of wooden planks and zinc sheeting. He wants to have concrete walls and to give his family a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials in order to add concrete walls to his home.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris A. is married with 2 children and has received an education through Junior High School. Since 2006, Doris has worked as a seamstress in the Elmina area making clothes and also selling materials. While Doris works as a seamstress, her husband is employed as a salt producer.

Doris’ husband pays their family’s financial expenses, and because of this, she is able to focus her attention and monies on her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase additional sewing materials for the sewing of her customers' clothing and with the new profits from her expanded business, Doris plans to save and reinvest.

loans.use: purchase additional sewing materials for sewing

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is forty-four years old; she is married with three kids. Currently, the kids are in school. She lives with her family at Bawjiase in Ghana. Lydia is an achiever and a resourceful mother. She loves selling goods, the business through which she makes a living. She trades in garden eggs (small eggplants) and pepper at Bawjiase market. She treks to Kumasi and nearby villages to purchase bulk stocks from farmers and retails to her customers. For lack of adequate working capital, she is not able to pick enough stock at a time to make enough profit to support her family.

With the loan, she wants to purchase garden eggs and peppers in bulk to enable her to scale up her sales. She believes the loan would enable her to save more income to support her kids in school. She is member of the group called Shining Star Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To procure more "garden eggs" and peppers

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Since 2007 Florence Y. has worked as a petty trader in Elmina, selling goods such as Milo (cocoa mix), sugar, and milk.  She is married with one child and received an education through Senior High School. While Florence works as a petty trader, her husband is employed as a teacher in the Elmina area.  She is responsible for assisting her husband in paying various family expenses, especially school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase additional food supplies for re-sale. Florence hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to save and build a home.

loans.use: purchase additional food supplies for re-sale

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra, observa la gran oportunidad, poniendo su propio negocio.

Junto con el gran apoyo de su familia, comienza aventurarse, y ahora tiene 10 años con este negocio, pero en uno de sus obstaculos es la compra de mercancia, y poder ofrecer a sus clientes lo que necesitan, la situacion es que no cuenta con dinero suficiente para poder comprarla.

Pide el apoyo, para vencer el obstaculo que se le presenta.
texts.en:
Out of a great need for extra income, she saw a great opportunity in starting her own business. With the support of her family she ventured out, and has now had her business for 10 years. One of her obstacles is purchasing merchandise to provide to her customers with what they need. The problem is that she does not have enough money to be able to afford this. She is asking for help so she can overcome this obstacle before her.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY GOODS

loans.name: Sandra Carolina

texts.es: La señora Sandra Carolina Sánchez, tiene la edad de 31 años, habita en el las pilas Orientales, ubicado en cuidad de Masaya, junto a su esposo, el cual trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene a su cargo tres hijos , una mujer de 15 años, un varón de 12 años y niña de 7 años , actualmente todos estudian, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, ella se dedica a trabajos de confesiones desde hace cinco años, solicita un financiamiento para poder incrementar su inventario, para esto va a comprar tela, hilo, súper, bordados entre otros que mejore su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sandra Carolina Sánchez is 31 years old and lives in the Pilas Orientales neighborhood in the city of Masaya together with her husband, who works in order to help her with the household expenses. They have three dependent children: a 15 year old girl, a 12 year old boy and a 7 year old girl, all of whom are currently in school. Their plan for the family is to improve their living conditions. Sandra has worked for 5 years as a dressmaker. She is requesting a loan in order to be able to expand her inventory. To do so she is going to buy cloth, thread, embroidered pieces and other raw materials that will improve the quality of her work.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, thread and other products she needs to do her dressmaking.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: La señora Maria Esperanza M. Hernández, tiene la edad de 36 años,   habita en el barrio San Juan de la Concepción , junto a su esposo  el cual trabaja como lector de medidores de agua , ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos , una adolescente se 14 años y una varón de 12 años , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , ella desde hace 6 años se dedica a los trabajos agrícolas , ella inicio con sus propios esfuerzos , la mayor facultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y las plagas. Con el financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para mejorar el cultivo y obtener una mejor producción.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Esperanza M. Hernández is 36 years old and lives with her husband in the San Juan de la Concepción neighborhood. He works as a water-meter reader. They have two children: a fourteen-year-old girl and a twelve-year-old boy. The family has made plans to improve their standard of living. Since the age of six, she has worked as a farmer. She began to farm through her own efforts. The two biggest problems she faces are lack of financing and pests. With the loan she is going to buy fertilizers and consumables to improve cultivation and obtain better production.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase agricultural consumables to improve cultivation

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Comenzo con ventas hace 11 años, gracias a que una amiga la invito , para formar parte de las ventas por catalogo, ella requiere estos ingresos para poder pagar sus estudios, y apoyar a su madre, se encuentra estudiando actualmente estilista.

Ella comenzo con la venta con sus amistades y ahora se encuentra en una problematica ya que la clientela le pide otros productos y require de la compra de ellos , la cual no puede conseguir ya que no cuenta con suficiente dinero.

Una gran mujer de exito, un gran futuro muy prometedor, estudiante y trabajadora.
texts.en:
She started in sales 11 years ago, thanks to a friend who invited her to be involved in catalogue sales. She needs this income to pay for her studies and support her mother. Currently she is studying to be a stylist. She began selling with her friends and now has a challenge, as her customers are asking for products which she needs to purchase, but cannot since she doesn’t have the funds to do so. She is a woman of success, a promising future, studious and hard working.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY GOODS

loans.name: Nelsa Abigail

texts.es: La señora Nelsa Abigail M., tiene la edad de 58 años de edad habita en el barrio Esquípulas en la capital de Managua, esta señora es soltera no tiene hijos pero tiene a su cargo a su papá y a un sobrino que su hermana le dejo a su cargo ya que falleció hace mucho tiempo, el joven de 14 años  después que llega de clases le ayuda con el negocio ya que ella le entrega y vende comida desde hace cinco años , los sueños de esta señora es llegar a tener un comedor, este es su segundo ciclo en Afodenic el cual va invertir en  comprar  insumos y granos básicos para hacer mas alimentos ya que ahora la buscaron para entregar comida a la iglesia de Ticuantepe al personal que labora en la tienda, y ella no cuenta con muchos recursos para poder cumplir con sus encargos. Y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nelsa Abigail M. is 58 years old, lives in the Esquípulas neighborhood in Managua, and is single and without children, but is responsible for her father and a nephew, as her sister passed away a long time ago. Once home from school, the 14 year old boy helps her out with her business of 5 years, which is food sales and delivery. Her dream is to have a dining room. This is her second loan cycle with Afodenic, which she will use to invest in the purchase of supplies and grains to cook more food, as she’s been asked by the church in Ticuantepec to deliver food to the personnel working in the shop and currently doesn’t have the funds to meet the demand and provide her customers with better service.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains, meats and other supplies to cook delicious meals

loans.name: Mirna Estela

texts.es:
Es Casada y tiene dos hijos.

La situacion de esta señora era la  busqueda de un ingreso extra, pero el salir a trabajar , no era muy conveniente ya que no queria descuidar a sus hijos, muy interesada en la invitacion de una amiga, acepta entrar a las ventas por catalogo.

ahora ella requiere comprar mas productos de los que ya tiene para poder ofrecer, variedad y calidad.

sus clientes le demandan mas productos, y hora requiere de cierta cantidad de dinero para comprar todo lo que se le solicitan.

Junto con esposo, trabajan para darle mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, y este negocio de las ventas por catalogo le ayuda mucho ya que no tiene que salir  de su hogar, y asi ella pueda  estar al pendiente de su familia.
texts.en:
She is married and has two children. She needed extra income but leaving home to go work was not convenient and she didn’t want to leave her children unattended. She was very interested in a friend’s invitation to join catalogue sales. Now she needs to purchase more of the items she’s already offering so she can provide more variety and quality. Her customers are asking for more items, so she requires a certain amount of money to purchase everything being requested. Together with her husband they work to provide a better quality of life for their children, and the catalogue sales business is very beneficial, as she doesn’t have to leave home and she can take care of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY GOODS

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es: La señora Karla Patricia M., tiene 31 años de edad, reside en el reparto el Carmen en la ciudad de Managua, madre soltera de dos hijos de 8 y 9 años de edad, que cursan sus estudios, su negocio es una miscelánea que con muchos esfuerzos y ahorro inicio con ahorros propios, y la necesidad de sobresalir adelante para alimentar a sus hijos, este es su quinto ciclo en Afodenic el cual va invertir en comprar granos básicos, carnes y productos de limpieza. Sus planes es poder vender variedades de productos que sastifagan a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ms. Karla Patricia M. is 31 years old and lives in the Carmen neighborhood in the city of Managua. She is the single mother of two children, 8 and 9, who are students. With much effort and with her own savings and from the necessity to move forward and feed her children, she began to sell miscellaneous items. This is her fifth loan through Afodenic, with which she is going to buy basic grains, meats, and cleaning products. She plans to be able to sell a variety of products which satisfy her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains, meats, and cleaning products

loans.name: Edith Xiomara

texts.es: Doña Edith Xiomara López, tiene la edad de 43 años de edad, reside en Unidad de Propósito en la ciudad de Managua, tiene cuatro hijos de 5,10,22 y24 años de edad, los dos mayores son independientes y los otros estudian, el negocio de la señora Edith es una pulpería con tres de administrarla, inicio con prestamos en micro financieras. Con este crédito quiere invertir en productos Como granos básicos, carnes, productos de limpiezas y otros. Sus planes es hacerlo crecer y así obtener mejores resultados, a si como hacer mejoras a su vivienda. También quiere apoyar a sus hijas para que estudien y se preparen para un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Edith Xiomara López is 43 years old and lives in Unidad de Propósito in the city of Managua. She has four children, who are 5, 10, 22, and 24 years old. The oldest two are independent, and the other two are students. Mrs. López owns a local store, which she manages with her two children. She began her business with loans from micro-finance companies. With this loan she wants to invest in products such as basic grains, meats, cleaning products and other products. She has made plans to grow and in that way obtain better results, as well as improve her standard of living. She also wants to help her children study and prepare for a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains and meats

loans.name: Nohemi

texts.es:
Es casada y tiene 3 hijos.

Queriendo apoyar a su esposo, en los gastos de hogar, elige la venta de productos por catalogo, ya que no tiene un horario fijo y asi puede atender a su familia, le ha hido muy bien en las ventas, pero ahora necesita invertir en mas productos, de mayor novedad para atraer mas clientes, y ofrecer lo mejor a los clientes que ya tiene.

este ingreso que le generan estas ventas es parte fundamental en su hogar ya que con el sustenta los estudios de sus hijos, que ya cursan carreras profesionales.

Apoyemosla.
texts.en:
She is married and has 3 children. Wanting to help her husband with the household expenses, she joined the catalogue sales business, since it doesn’t require a set schedule and she can tend to her family. She’s done very well in sales, but now she needs to invest in more, newer products so she can attract more customers, and so she can provide the best to the customers she already has. The income that these sales generate is crucial to her home, as it is used to pay for her children’s studies, who are both studying professional careers. Let’s support her.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY GOODS

loans.name: Fiatagata

texts.en: Fiatagata N., 32, is married with 4 children.  She has 5 years of experience in the Fishing business. She sells to the village people and the public 4 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 240 Tala (approximately 140 USD).  SPBD loans are Fiatagata’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To buy a new fishing canoe, swimming shoes, spear and a cooler to store the fish

loans.name: Matata

texts.en:
Matata A., 52, is married with four children. She has many years of experience in the fishing business. She sells to the villagers and the public three days per week. She has four previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (about $187).

SPBD loans are Matata's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks. The entirety of the loan will be used to maintain her business needs. Specifically, she would like to purchase goggles, a fishing net, and a flashlight.

loans.use: To purchase goggles, a fishing net, and a flashlight.

loans.name: Test

texts.en: dsa

loans.use: dsa

loans.name: Neetia

texts.en:
Neetia L., 36, is married with two children. She has three years of experience in the vegetables business. She sells to the village people and to the general public three days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (approximately $140).

Neetia has no previous loan with SPBD. SPBD loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seeds, a bag of fertilizer, a wheelbarrow and a spade

loans.name: Fatima Argentina

texts.es: Doña Fátima es una mujer con deseos de superación, tiene una librería  que desde hace siete años administra, ella inicio con capital propio que su mama dio,  tiene 42 años de edad, reside en el barrio Monte Cristo en la ciudad de Managua. Con un hijo de 14 años de edad que estudia la secundaria, con este crédito es su sexto ciclo el cual va invertir en la compra de cuadernos, bolsos pinturas, calculadoras entre otros para surtir la librería y poder ofrecer a sus clientes una gama de productos nuevos. Sus planes es invertir más en su negocio y poder dar estudio a su hijo.
texts.en:
Fátima is a woman with a desire to get ahead. She has a bookstore which she has run for the past 7 years. She started it with her own money, which her mother had given her. She is 42 years old and lives in the Monte Cristo neighborhood in Managua. She has a 14 year old son who is in secondary school. With this loan, which is her sixth, she will buy notebooks, bags, paints, calculators and other things to stock her bookstore and to be able to offer her customers a selection of new products. Her plans are to invest more in her business and to give an education to her son.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy notebooks, bags, calculators and other products to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.name: Vicuñitas Group

texts.es: El comercio informal es la principal actividad de la asociación “Vicuñitas”, se dedican a la venta de leche, Feliza vende Chinelas y pantuflas, otras venden papa, y también venden almuerzos. Esta asociación trabaja hace más de dos años junto a la familia de Pro-Mujer. Se reunen quincenalmente en el centro focal Los Andes, a la fecha el grupo esta integrado por 16 miembros. Ahora ellas quieren reforzar sus negocios comprando mayor cantidad de mercadería, tienen la seguridad que obtendrán mayores ganancias para poder cumplir con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
Informal commerce is the main activity of the group "Vicuñitas". Some members make a living selling milk. Feliza sells flip-flops and slippers. Others sell potatoes, while others sells lunches. The group has been with Kiva partner Pro-Mujer for more than two years. They meet every two weeks at the Andes focal center; at the moment the group consists of the 16 members. Now the women want to reinforce their businesses by purchasing larger quantities of merchandise and have the security to obtain more earnings to be able to fulfill their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es:
Se encuentra casada y tiene 3 hijos.

La idea de un negocio propio surgio despues de que se quedo sin empleo, y la venta de tacos le parecio rentable, su padre le comento que podria poner un carrito de tacos y con la liquidacion y todos sus ahorros, comenzo comprando lo mas indispensable.

ahora ya tiene 2 años con el carrito y este se ha hido deteriorando, asi que ahora quiere pintarlo para, proyectar una mejor imagen y asi tener mayores ventas.

solicita el apoyo para la compra de pintura y otros detalles para remodelar el carrito de tacos, ya que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para hacerlo.

apoyemos el caso de esta señora, ya que estos ingresos son parte fundamental para al sustento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Berta is married and has three children. The idea of having her own business came to her losing her job, and selling tacos seemed lucrative. Her father commented to her that she could start a taco cart by selling some things and using all her saving, and she started buying what was most needed for the business. Now she has had the cart for two years and it has already deteriorated, so she now needs to paint it to protect her image and have better sales. She is requesting the loan to purchase the paint and other items to remodel the taco cart since she does not have the sufficient funds to do it. We are support this woman's cause because the income are a fundamental part of her family's sustenance.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paint and remodel taco cart

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: El señor Gregorio tiene 57 años de edad, reside en el barrio 31 de Diciembre en la ciudad de Managua, su negocio es una pulpería que desde hace cinco años administra, inicio con fondos propios y prestamos, sus dos hijos son independiente y laboran en zona franca, este es su tercer ciclo y ha sido de muchos beneficios ya que ha podido mantener su negocio, con este crédito quiere comprar una mantenedora para comprar mas carnes, productos lácteos para ofrecer alimentos frescos a sus clientes y poder vender mas y obtener mejores ganancias. Sus planes a futuro es poder hacer una mejora el local donde tiene la pulpería y poder apoyar a sus hijos en lo que pueda.
texts.en:
Gregorio is 57 years old and lives in the 31 de Diciembre neighborhood in Managua. His business is a convenience store which he has run for the past 5 years and which he started with his own money and with some loans. His two sons are independent and work in the duty-free zone. This is his third loan and the loans have brought many benefits which have allowed him to maintain his business. With this loan he wants to buy a cooler so he can buy more meat and dairy products and can offer fresh foods to his customers, be able to sell more and have better earnings. His future plans are to make improvements to the store and to help out his sons.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cooler for storing meat and dairy products.

loans.name: Martha Ines

texts.es: La señora Martha Ines M., tiene la edad de 53 años, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, es viuda y con cinco hijos, tres de ellos trabajan y dos estudian, su negocio es la venta de ropa, y alquila cuarto tiene seis años de administrar su venta ella inicio con fondos propios. Este es su séptimo ciclo en Afodenic y ha sido de muchos beneficios para su vida personal como para su negocio. Con este crédito va a comprar ropa interior para seguir ofertando a sus clientes y poder seguir captando clientes.
texts.en:
Martha Ines M. is 53 years old and lies in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood. She is a widow with 5 children; three of them work and two study. Her business is selling clothing. She rented out a room and has been running her business, which she started with her own money, for 6 years. This is her seventh loan with Afodenic and the loans have benefited her both in her personal life as well as in her business. With this loan she will buy lingerie so she can keep offering goods to her customers and continue to get clients.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy lingerie to sell.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca.
Ana es casada, tiene 24 años y 3 hijos, Ana junto a su esposo elaboran panes típicos de la región, actividad que realiza en el horno de su  suegro, sus ventas los realiza en las ferias de la región a donde viajan.
Ana necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina.
Los sueños de Ana son mejorar su negocio y tener un horno propio.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of Señor de Huanca Community Bank. She is a 24-year-old married mother of three children. Ana along with her husband make breads typical of the region, which she does using the oven of her father-in-law. She sells the breads at the flea markets in the region she travels to. Ana is requesting a loan of 800 soles, which she plans to use to purchase flour. Her dreams are to improve her business and have her own oven.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour

loans.name: Ambrosia

texts.es:
Ambrosia es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca.
Ambrosia es soltera, tiene 45 años y 2 hijos, Ambrosia vende emoliente (bebida caliente que se prepara con hierbas y semillas de lino) actividad que realiza de manera ambulatoria por las noches y mañanas.
Ambrosia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar y hierbas.
Los sueños de Ambrosia son comprar un terreno para construir su casa y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Ambrosia is a member of the Señor de Huanca (Our Lord of Huanca) Village Bank. She is 45, single, and has two children. She sells emoliente (a hot drink made with herbs and flax seed), from a cart at nighttime and in the mornings. Ambrosia needs a loan of 1000 soles which she plans to invest in sugar and herbs. She dreams of buying a piece of land on which she can build her house, and having her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar and herbs.

loans.name: Jardin De Rosas Group

texts.es: La costura de ropa, tejido de chompas a mano, el tejido de bolsos y mantas en macramé, son algunos de los negocios de la asociación “Jardín de Rosas” Este grupo trabaja en el centro focal Los Andes, ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, a la fecha esta formado por catorce miembros. Ahora ellas quieren ampliar sus ventas por lo que necesitan materia prima, tienen la seguridad que sus ventas serán mayores y de este modo generaran mayores recursos.
texts.en:
Some of the "Jardín de Rosas" (Rose Garden) Association's businesses include making hand-sewn clothing, hand-knit sweaters, and hand-woven macramé handbags and blankets. The group currently consists of 14 members and works in the Los Andes Focal Center in the city of El Alto. They want to expand their sales so they need raw materials. They are confident that their sales will grow and generate greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Eleazar Rafael

texts.es: El joven Eleazar Bermúdez, tiene 25 años de edad,  es sastre oficio que hace desde hace nueve años realiza, el cual aprendió con su mama con fondos propios, los clientes que llegan hacer costura dejan el cincuenta por ciento de adelanto y eso es una ayuda para poder terminar el trabajo. Reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación, es soltero, este es el segundo ciclo en Afodenic el cual va invertir en la compra de un rollo de tela, hilos y otros que ayuden a elaborar su trabajo. Sus planes  es poder comprar equipo de trabajo industrial para crecer en su negocio y poder dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Young Eleazar Bermúdez is 25 years old. He has been a tailor for the past 9 years, he learned from his mother and started the business with his own money. The customers who bring sewing to him leave 50% down and this helps him to be able to finish the work. He lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood and is single. This is his second loan with Afodenic, which he will use to buy a bolt of fabric, thread and other things that will help him work. His plans are to buy an industrial sewing machine so he can grow his business and be able to provide good service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread and other supplies.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza es socia del Banco Comunal Señor D. Huanca.
Lorenza es casada, tiene 53 años y 11 hijos, Lorenza tiene un puesto en el mercado chorro en donD. venD. papa, arvejas. Además Lorenza viaja a las ferias en donD. compra animales menores y lo venD. en el camal.
Lorenza necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. oveja y cerdos.
Los sueños D. Lorenza son comprar una casa, tener casa y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Lorenza is a member of the Señor D. Huanca (Our Father of Huanca) Village Bank. She is 53, married, and has 11 children. She has a stand at the Chorro market, where she sells potatoes and peas. She also travels to the fairs to buy young animals, which she sells to the slaughterhouse. Lorenza is requesting a loan of 1000 soles which she plans to invest in sheep and pigs. Her dreams incluD. purchasing a home, and having her children finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and pigs.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Es casada y tiene 5 hijos.

El negocio comenzo por la necesidad de apoyar en el hogar ya que su esposo se quedo sin empleo en lo que encontraba otro, ella tuvo que empezar a buscar trabajo, pero decidio que vender en casa seria buena idea y asi  no descuidaria a su familia.

el negocio de las bolsas para dama, le parecio rentable, y aparte vende algo de cosmeticos, ahora  con la moda que pasa muy rapido desea, comprar nuevas bolsas, mas novedosas y asi tener mayor clientela y la que tiene ofrecerle lo mas reciente. 

ella hace demostraciones y la mayoria a quien vende son familares y vecinos.

va comenzando con su negocio, y ha tendio buenas ventas, con la compra de buena mercancia es seguro su exito.
texts.en:
Sara is married and has five children. She started her business out of the necessity to support the household when her husband lost his job and was looking for a new one. She needed to start looking for work, but she decided that doing sales from her house was a better idea, and then she wouldn't neglect her family. She thought selling ladies' handbags would be profitable, and she also sells cosmetics. Since the styles change so quickly, she wants to buy new, more fashionable handbags so she can win more customers and offer them the very latest. She does shows, and most of her products are bought by relatives and neighbors. She's just starting her business and sales have been good. She's sure she'll be successful if she buys quality merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY GOODS

loans.name: Ambrosia

texts.es:
Ambrosia es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca.
Ambrosia es casada, tiene 43 años y 4 hijos, Ambrosia tiene una panadería en su casa, elabora panes variados, sus ventas los realiza en las diferentes ferias de la región, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo e hijos.
Ambrosia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina.
Ambrosia sueña con comprar un carro para transportar sus productos y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Ambrosia is a member of the Señor de Huanca (Our Lord of Huanca) Village Bank. She is 43, married, and has 4 children. She has a bakery in her house and bakes a variety of breads, which she sells at the fairs in her region with the assistance of her husband and children. Ambrosia is requesting a loan of 1000 soles, which she'll use to buy flour. Her dreams include buying a car to transport her products, and having her children finish school.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour.

loans.name: Aditza Maria

texts.es: Doña Aditza es una mujer que trabaja desde su juventud, en la venta de ropa interior, tiene dieciséis años en las ventas, el cual inicio con ahorros y dinero que su esposo dio. Tiene 46 años de edad, reside en el barrio Enrique Smit, su esposo es guarda de seguridad, tiene dos hijos de 7 y 17 años los cuales estudian, sus planes es comprar ropa de vestir y mas ropa interior para fortalecer su inventario que espera con este crédito aumentar sus ganancias y captar mas clientes. Da las gracias a la institución por el apoyo para fortalecer su negocio, también espera poder ayudar a sus hijos para que estudien y tengan un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Aditza has been working since she was a young woman, selling undergarments. She started her business sixteen years ago with her savings and money from her husband. She is 46 and lives in the Enrique Smit neighborhood. Her husband is a security guard, and they have two children, 7 and 17, both of whom are in school. She plans to buy outerwear and more undergarments so she can build up her inventory. Aditza hopes that this loan will allow her to increase her profits and win more customers. She is grateful to AFODENIC for supporting the growth of her business. She also hopes to be able to help her children go to school so they can have a bright future.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing and undergarments.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Señor de Huanca.
Victoria es casada, tiene 39 años y 4 hijos, Victoria viaja una vez por semana a la costa como Ica, en donde vende cereales, y de allá compra maíz de gallina, pallar que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Victoria necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cebada, haba y trigo.
Los sueños de Victoria son tener capital propio para su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Señor de Huanca (Our Lord of Huanca) Village Bank. She is 39, married, and has 4 children. She travels weekly to the coast of Ica to sell cereals and buy Gallina (Hen) corn and butter beans to sell in the Ayacucho markets. Victoria is seeking a loan of 3000 soles to invest in the purchase of barley, broad beans, and wheat. She dreams of having her own capital for her business, and seeing her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy barley, broad beans, and wheat.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño.
Candelaria es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Candelaria es líder de una línea de ventad e cosméticos llamado Oriflame, a su cargo tiene a vendedoras y percibe un pago mensual por esta función, También vende los cosméticos. Candelaria junto a su esposo tienen un hospedaje.
Candelaria necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cosméticos.
Los sueños de Candelaria son mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Candelaria is a member of the Retoño Communal Bank. Candelaria lives with her partner, is 27 years old and has one child. Candelaria is a leader in the sale of a cosmetics line called Oriflame. She supervises other saleswoman and receives a monthly payment for this role. She also sells the cosmetics. Candelaria and her partner have a small hotel. Candelaria needs a loan for 1000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of cosmetics. Candelaria's dream is to improve her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of cosmetics.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
Faustina es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño.
Faustina es casada, tiene 43 años y 3 hijos, Faustina viaja a las ferias en donde compra cereales, papa, productos que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Faustina hace papa seca (papa sancochada y secado al sol, que es utilizado para la preparación de comida) que vende a intermediarios.
Faustina necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa.
Faustina sueña con mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Faustina is a member of the Retoño Communal Bank. Faustina is married, is 43 years old and has 3 children. Faustina travels to the markets where she buys cereals, potatoes and products that she sells in the supply markets in the city of Ayacucho. In addition, Faustina makes dehydrated potatoes (parboiled and sundried, which is used in food preparation) that she sells to intermediaries. Faustina needs a loan of 3000 soles, money which will be invested in the purchase of potatoes. Faustina dreams of improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potatoes.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Casado, tiene 47 años.

El es originario de la huasteca, donde los quesos son muy solicitados, el al llegar a mante y observa que casi no se venden mucho por ahi, decide poner su negocio de quesos y mas adelante tambien perfumes que observo que solicitaban mucho.

El pide el apoyo para un refrigerador para guardar los quesos y evitar que se echen a perder, le ha hido muy bien casi todo lo que vende es por pedidos.

Sus ganas de trabajar, lo han echo muy conocido en la zona donde vive, y tiene una gran demanda de queso, pero no tiene donde guardarlo. 

en tanto los perfumes fue un extra que tambien se le ha hido vendiendo muy bien.
texts.en:
Married, is 47 years old. He is from the Huasteca region, where cheeses are very popular. When he arrived to Mante and observed that they are not sold much there he decided to start her cheese business and in the future will also sell perfumes as they are requested a lot. He is requesting the support for a refrigerator to keep his cheeses to prevent them from going bad. It has gone well for him and almost everything that he sells is by special order. His desire to work has made him very well-known in the area where he lives. There is a great demand for cheese, but he does not have anywhere to keep it. In terms of the perfumes, it was an extra that has been selling very well.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Juan Gabriel

texts.es:
Tiene 36 años, Casado y 3 hijos.

vende ropa usada, como aqui le llamamos por " pacas" en los mercados rodantes.
empezo con la venta de la ropa en su hogar, probaron suerte fueras y les ha hido muy bien.

Ya tiene  5 años en el negocio.

ahora solicitan su apoyo para comprar un estante, para poder mostrar mejor la ropa, ya que no tiene donde ponerla.
estas ventas, son un ingreso fundamental para el y su familia, el sustento de cada dia.

apoyemos su negocio, el estante le es muy necesario, pero no tiene el suficiente dinero para adquiririlo.
texts.en:
He is 36 years old, married and has 3 children. He sells used clothing and here we call them “pacas" in the rotating markets. He started with the sale of clothing in his home and then tried his luck outside and it has gone very well for him. He has already worked in the business for 5 years and is now requesting support to buy a shelf to be able to better show the clothing as he now has nowhere to put it. These sales are an essential income for him and his family, the sustenance for each day. Let's support his business. The shelf is very necessary, but he does not have enough money to buy it.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a shelf for the clothes

loans.name: Xz's Group

texts.en: sadasdadsasd

loans.use: as

loans.name: Iris Teresa

texts.es:
IRIS TERESA A. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “SEÑOR DE LUREN” vive en el Jr Salaverry # 732, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 46 años de edad y 2 hijos.  Su pareja es transportista.

Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/ 300.00, inició su negocio de venta de joyas.

Gracias a los préstamos recibidos ha progresado junto a su familia y el negocio de la venta de joyas ha mejorado.  Con este préstamo  de S/.1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará más joyas para abastecerse con nuevos modelos.

“Manuela Ramos es una ONG que da apoyo no solo económico sino también nos ayuda a valorarnos, a tener autoestima y sentirnos bien.  Soy muy feliz con lo que tengo y lo que soy como persona”... refirió.
texts.en:
IRIS TERESA A. M. is a member of the “SEÑOR DE LUREN” Microfinance Institute. She is a 46-year-old mother of two who lives on Salaverry Street in the city of Pucallpa. Her spouse works as a driver.

With the first 300.00 PEN loan that she received from Manuela Ramos, she started her own jewelry business.

Thanks to the loans that she has obtained, she and her family have made progress, and her jewelry business has improved. With this 1,200.00 PEN loan, she will purchase more jewelry to restock her business with new designs.

“Manuela Ramos is a Non-Governmental Organization that not only gives financial support, but also helps us to have self-esteem and feel good. I am very happy with what I have and who I am as a person.”

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase jewelry

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es: El señor José Manuel A. Pérez tiene la edad de 47 años, habita en barrio el Edén ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposa la cual trabaja como comerciante de frutas en el mercado Oriental , ellos tiene a su cargo dos hijos un de 25 años que trabaja y les apoya y una hija de 18 años que actulamnte estudia y le poya con las cosas del hogar  los planes hacia su familia es poder apoyar a sus hijos siempre para que sigan estudiando y otros de sus planes es poder construir su casa , don José desde hace diez años trabaja como agricultor , el mayor problema que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento y las plagas que han afectado a su cultivo , el inicio el trabajo agrícola por si solo , con el financiamiento va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para tener una buena cosecha y poder vender a buen precio al mercado.
texts.en:
Mr. José Manuel A. Pérez is a 47-year-old man who lives in the Edén neighborhood of the Ticuantepe municipality with his wife, who works as a fruit vendor in the Oriental market. They have two children under their care; one who is 25 years old and works to help out the family, and an 18-year-old daughter who is currently in school and helps with the household chores. His family plans are to always be able to support his children to keep studying, and to be able to build his own house. Mr. A. has been working as a farmer for ten years. His biggest problems are the lack of financial resources and the pests that have affected his crops. He started working in agriculture on his own. With this loan, he will purchase fertilizer and supplies so that he can have a good harvest and sell his produce at a good price at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and fertilizers for crops

loans.name: Jesús Del Pilar

texts.es:
JESUS DEL PILAR H. T., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES PRODUCTIVAS” vive en la Av. Santa clara Mz.A Lt.a, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 27 años de edad y 1 hijo.  Su pareja es afilador (servicio).

Con el primer préstamo que recibió de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró gaseosas para vender.

Hoy en día, ella es quien trabaja para apoyar a  su familia.  Paralelamente está invirtiendo en la venta de curichis (Chupetes hecho de aguaje), este negocio es rentable dado que a mucha gente les gusta este producto.  Con este préstamo de S/. 1,200.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará insumos para elaborar estos curichis  para vender.

“Soy una mujer muy feliz que me siento realizada, aunque no tengo estudios superiores veo que cuando uno quiere salir adelante lo puede hacer y esto es lo que me dijeron en Manuela Ramos”.
texts.en:
JESUS DEL PILAR H. T. is a member of the “MUJERES PRODUCTIVAS” (Productive Women) Microfinance Institute. She lives on Santa Clara Avenue in the city of Pucallpa. She is a 27-year-old mother with 1 son. Her partner is an itinerant knife sharpener, providing knife sharpening services.

With her first 300.00 PEN loan, she purchased soft drinks to sell.

Today, she is the one who is working to support her family. She is also investing her money in selling curichis (frozen Moriche palm fruit bars). This business is profitable because many people like this product. With this 1,200.00 PEN loan, she will purchase the supplies she needs to make curichis and sell them.

“I am a very happy woman because I feel fulfilled. Even though I do not have a degree, I see that when one wants to get ahead, one can do it, and this is what they told me at Manuela Ramos.”

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks and supplies needed to make frozen fruit bars

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es: Amanda tiene 29 años, vive en casa de sus padres con sus hermanas y sus 3 hijos. Desde hace un año tiene una tienda, aprovechó la oportunidad de que su domicilio está ubicado en una zona muy transitada, en una carretera central y constantemente acuden a consumir sus productos los transportistas y viajeros. Sus vecinos también compran en su tienda, por ello, cada día se levanta temprano para atender a sus clientes, los fines de semana sale a comprar algunos productos de su mercadería para abastecerse con lo necesario de acuerdo a la demanda de sus clientes. Para más adelante Amanda desea implementar su tienda para ser tipo minimarket. Esta es la primera vez que Amanda está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y está muy  entusiasmada con el trabajo solidario en su banco comunal, ya que es su primera experiencia, pero tiene expectativas positivas. El dinero lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería en gaseosas, dulces y fideos para su tienda, de esa manera incrementará su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Amanda is a 29-year-old woman who lives in her parents’ home with her sisters and her 3 children. She has owned a general store for a year. She took advantage of the fact that her house is located in a very busy area by a central highway that travelers and truck drivers alike constantly frequent to purchase her products. Her neighbors also shop at her store, which is why she gets up very early everyday to attend to her customers. On weekends she goes out to purchase goods to restock her store with everything her customers need. In the future, Amanda would like to convert her store into a mini market. This is the first time that Amanda requests a loan from MFP, and she is very enthusiastic about working in a solidarity group in her microfinance institute. Because it is her first time in a group, she has high expectations. The money will be invested in purchasing goods such as soft drinks, candy, and noodles for her store, so that she can increase her business capital.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Aydee

texts.es: Aydee tiene 26 años, vive con su hijo de 7 años. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a vender productos de primera necesidad, en un inicio arrendaba un pequeño local, pero en la actualidad lo hace en su propia casa, donde atiende todo el día y a la vez puede estar pendiente de su hijo. Aydee tiene mucho cuidado de la cantidad y tipo de producto que va vendiendo para, según la demanda, comprar mercadería al por mayor. Para más adelante desea tener su tienda de comestibles en una zona más céntrica y comercial de su localidad para que pueda crecer en sus ventas. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy agradecida con su banco comunal que le ha enseñado la solidaridad que ahora promueve entre las personas que conoce. El dinero que viene solicitando es para la compra de víveres al por mayor como arroz, azúcar, dulces y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Aydee is 26 years old and lives with her son who is 7 years of age. For the last two years she has worked selling essential products. In the beginning she rented a small storefront, but currently she works out of her own home where she serves customers all day and at the same time cares for her son. Aydee is very careful about the amount and type of products she sells and, based on the demand, she buys merchandise wholesale. In the future her wish is to have a grocery store in an area that is more central and commercial than her current location to be able to increase her sales. It is her second loan with MFP and she is very thankful that her communal bank has taught her the solidarity that she now promotes among the people she meets. The money that she is requesting is for the purchase of products wholesale such as rice, sugar, sweets and soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase merchandise

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana tiene 30 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa arrendada. Desde hace más de 6 años se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, se inició con un torito, luego empezó a capitalizar, y actualmente tiene 3 toretes y varias ovejas. Junto a su esposo trabajan en el cuidado y transporte de sus animales hacia la feria ganadera de su zona los fines de semana, y es en esos días donde puede ver los frutos de su arduo trabajo. Hasta el momento este negocio ha resultado ser más rentable que cualquier otra actividad, por las ganancias que se generan en cada venta, por lo que Diana y su esposo se han propuesto aumentar su capital de trabajo adquiriendo más animales. Esta es la segunda vez que viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y está muy entusiasmada de continuar una temporada más con su banco comunal, comprometiéndose nuevamente con responsabilidad en sus pagos. Con el dinero requerido comprará 2 ovejas, además de sacos de abono y semillas para que empiece a cultivar algunos productos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Diana is 30 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in a rented house. For more than 6 years, she has dedicated herself to raising and selling animals. She started with a small bull, later she began to capitalize, and now has 3 bulls and various sheep. She works together with her husband tending to and transporting their animals to the livestock market in their area on weekends. It is on these days that they can see the fruits of their arduous labor. To date, this business has proven to be more profitable than any other activity, given the earnings they generate with each sale. For this reason, Diana and her husband propose to increase their working capital in order to acquire more animals. This is the second time she has requested a loan with MFP, and she is very enthusiastic about continuing another season with her cooperative bank, newly committing to be responsible with her payments. With the funds, she will buy 2 sheep as well as sacks of fertilizer and seed to start cultivating some agricultural products.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 2 sheep.

loans.name: Edinson

texts.es: Edinson tiene 25 años, vive con su hijo en casa de sus padres. Desde hace 4 años ofrece el servicio de transporte de pasajeros diariamente y durante todo el día recorriendo a las calles de la ciudad con su auto. Edinson sabe que como transportista corre muchos riesgos, sin embargo no se detiene porque es una buena fuente de trabajo que le genera los ingresos necesarios para vivir y sostener a sus hijos. Para el futuro le gustaría crear su propia empresa de transportes. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, tiene muchas expectativas de trabajar en su banco comunal y ser uno de los socios más comprometidos. El dinero que está solicitando es para la compra de repuestos para su carro y el mantenimiento del mismo.
texts.en:
Edinson is 25 years old and lives with his son in his parents’ house. For 4 years, he has been providing daily transportation services to passengers throughout the city’s streets with his car. Edinson knows that, as a driver, he runs many risks. He continues on regardless, because it is a good source of work that generates income for him to support his family. In the future, he would like to start his own transportation enterprise. This is the first time he has a loan with MFP, and he has great expectations of working with his cooperative bank and being one of the most responsible members. The funds he is requesting are to purchase replacement parts for his car, and for its maintenance.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase replacement parts and maintain his car.

loans.name: Everilda

texts.es: Everilda tiene 21 años, vive con su hijo, su madre y su hermano en una casa alquilada. Hace 3 años tomó la decisión de comprar animales y venderlos en las principales ferias ganaderas de su zona, para ello cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su madre y su hermano  para la atención y transporte de su ganado. Los animales que vende principalmente son vaquillonas y ovejas, en algunas ocasiones cerdos, las ventas se realizan generalmente los fines de semana, cuando Everilda dispone de todo el día hasta que termine todas las ventas. Gracias a los esfuerzos constantes en este negocio, ella puede sostener las necesidades de su casa y tiene planes de poder conseguir un terreno propio donde pueda hacer su casa y su establo para los animales que va a comprar y luego vender. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta y satisfecha de ser parte de este grupo humano porque es un buen espacio de amistad. El dinero que solicita es para invertirlo en la compra de dos toretes.
texts.en:
Everilda is 21 years old and lives with her son, mother and brother in a rented house. Three years ago, she decided to buy animals and sell them at the major livestock markets of her area. To do this, she counts on the unconditional support of her mother and brother who help her tend to and transport her game. The animals she sells are primarily cows and sheep and, on some occasions, pigs. She realizes her sales mostly on weekends, when Everilda sets out all day until she completes every sale. Thanks to her constant efforts toward the business she can sustain the household, and has plans to buy her own land to build a house and livestock stable. This is the second time she’s turned to MFP for a loan, and she is very happy to be part of this group that is such a support and filled with friendship. The funds that she requests are for the purchase of two young bulls.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase two young bulls.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa L. manages a small farm. She grows rice and sells her harvest in the market. Farming is her best source of income that she uses to feed and clothe her family. She admitted that she has to work hard to stretch their limited income. She and her husband, together, till the land that she inherited from her parents to provide all their needs.

In addition to rice, she also has a piggery business. She raises pigs at the back of her house. She also grows chickens to supplement their income.

Melissa is asking a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy rice seed for her farm. A portion of the loan will also used to buy three piglets for her small piggery.


CEVI provides Melissa with a loan to run her business. Aside from that, it also offers training and insurance coverage to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase seed for her rice farm and three piglets and pig feed for her piggery

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma A. owns a small rice field. She is 41 years old, a widow, and has seven children. She is the only one who works to win food and clothing for the family. She would like to buy another farm to increase her harvest. She dreamed that someday, all her children will graduate in college and have better jobs in the future.

The reason why Norma would like to loan from CEVI is that she wants to buy herbicides and fertilizers for her farm. The loan will also be used to venture into another line of business to supplement their income.


CEVI is reaching out to more people to help them start and have their own business. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and herbicides for her farm

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Kim S., 55, has been selected to be leader by the other two members of the group; they are all people who live in Phnom Penh City. Mr. S. is married with two single children who are employed, and are garment workers in a factory. His wife earns a living selling fresh fish in the local market.

In the last three years, S. has become skilled in the business of building houses, and is earning approximately $3 per day. The family's living conditions are not so comfortable because their house often cracks during the rainy season. Because of the obstacle, Mr. S. would like a loan from Kiva in order to repair their old house. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living.

The other two borrowers are:

Mr. B., 34, who is a local building worker, and is looking for a loan to decorate his house.

Mrs. S., 39, who works as a construction worker and she applies for a loan to repair her house.

loans.use: To repair their old house

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mally P. is a rice farmer. She started farming with her parents when she was just 8 years old, a distance away from their house. She is 47 years old, married to a farmer, and also has six loving children. She owns a 3-hectare (approximately 7.5 acre) farm. She would like to increase her yield to support the growing needs of her family.

The purpose of her loan is to buy fertilizers and seeds. She believes that by doing so, she will have the chance to improve her harvest.


CEVI is reaching out to more people to enable them to start and have their own livelihood. CEVI offers not just loans to all their clients but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and rice seed

loans.name: Zelita

texts.en:
Zelita is 34 years old and has three children. She resides in Deboloc, PlariD., Misamis Occidental. She asked for a loan amounting to Php20,000.00 for additional capital for her store. Her husband is a fisherman. The couple started their business with their own capital from what they were able to save from her husband's salary.

When she observed that her business was growing slowly, she realized that she needed to add to her capital in order to have more stock available for her customers. She decided to join Paglaum to borrow money for additional capital. She was very interested in other products and services that Paglaum offered. Zelita hopes that someday her business will become a mini-grocery store and her kids will be able to establish their own careers.

loans.use: To buy additional Ready To Wear clothing products

loans.name: 09 - Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Phố N. Thị (10) is a 61 year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Phố is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 9 Đông Hải (16.02.009).

Phố is married and has an adult son. To making a living, Phố owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising cattle for sale.  Phố has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 1.200.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Phố joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Phố has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1.626.900 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 3.079.800 VND (USD 850) which again will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell. The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Phố plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  N. Thị Vẹn  (44) is a 53 year-old female who is requesting a 3.079.800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  N. Thị Hiếu (76) is a 37 year-old female who is requesting a 2.442.600 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  N. Thị Tú (117) is a 40 year-old female who is requesting a 3.079.800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

4.  B. Thị Thấu (17) is a 59 year-old female who is requesting a 3.079.800 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.




About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.




*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Phố N. Thị (10) là 61 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoá.  Phố là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 09-Đông Hải (16.02.009).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Phố thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Phố kiếm được khoảng 1.200.000 VND.  Vào 2008, Phố đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Phố đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 1.626.900 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3.079.800 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 3nd khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:

1.  N. Thị Vẹn  (44) là 53 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

2.  N. Thị Hiếu (76) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.442.600 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

3.  N. Thị Tú (117) là 40 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

4.  B. Thị Thấu (17) là 59 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.

Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Posed in front of her Sari-sari store is Mrs. Thelma P.. Thelma, 48 years old, of Purok 2 Gango, Ozamiz City, is one of our active members of PAGLAUM MPC – Ozamiz Branch under PDP-LP Program. She is married to Clemente P., who is privately employed as delivery truck driver of Tanduay Distillers Inc. But her husband’s income is not enough to support their family, especially her children’s education. She decided to engage in business in the mid 90’s to help her husband. With a starting capital of a PHP 2,000 loan, she was able to open a little Sari-sari Store in her own house. Now her Sari-sari Store is located at her mother’s area, located a half kilometer away from her residence. This area is more accessible to all customers. Though this business, the couple is able to support their children’s education. Their two children are now in college. As an 8th cycle borrower, she is applying for an amount of ~PHP 20,000 (USD 425) to add to the capital in her Sari-sari Store and to assist her family in their daily needs.

loans.use: Additional Capital for her Sari-Sari Store.

location.town: P2 Gango, Ozamiz City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife B. grows corn. It is the second most commonly grown crop in the Philippines. She is 34 years old and has three children. Her husband, Allan B., is the one who manages their farm. They have been together for more than 10 years already. They work hard for the future of their children.

She is requesting a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI, a Kiva partner. She will use the loan to buy seeds and to pay for the labor for land preparation. Also, she'd like to start a business to augment their income.

CEVI is reaching out to people to help them sustain their livelihoods. CEVI offers not just loans but also training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and pay for land-preparation labor

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy S. owns 1.2 hectares of land in their village. Her main crop is rice and she sells all her harvest to her neighbor to earn a living. She is 34 years old, married to a farmer named Renato S. and has six children. School is quite expensive nowadays, so Joy and her husband do their best to provide for the needs of their children.

The purpose of Joy S.'s loan from CEVI is to buy fertilizers and seeds. This will help her whole family increase their crop's yield.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines. CEVI offers not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Melodina

texts.en:
Mrs. Melodina P., 39 years old, is married and blessed with seven children. They are still studying. 
Melodina is a member of good standing of PAGLAUM COOP under its PDP-LP program. She is a good member because she has never committed a default of her weekly payment obligation. Now she wishes to obtain a loan of PHP 7,000 as additional capital for her proposed project, which is raising pigs.
Melodina tries to keep up with her obligations like savings, CBU (Capital Build Up) and insurance, hoping that it will give the best return in the future for her business and also for their children.

loans.use: To buy Piglets.

location.town: Lao Sta. Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Monita

texts.en:
Monita C. grew up on a farm. Her parents, her siblings as well as her friends are farmers. She also married a farmer, Rosendo C.. Farming is a common livelihood in the Philippines. She is into this business to ensure food for the family.

The purpose of her loan is for fertilizers and seeds. She is also interested to look for some possible income areas to help more in the family earnings.

CEVI provides loans, training and insurance coverage to Monita and the rest of its clients.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and herbicides for farming.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en: Agustina T. and family live in Barangay Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is a mother of 4 children. Fishing is their primary activity and source of income. Fishing helps them to withstand business high and lows. In order to expand their business, Agustina and her husband request a Php 20,000.00 loan. Aside for their own capital to buy fishing boat and additional to their fish vending, Agustina also ventures new business which is snack vending. She cooks snacks variety mainly made of flour and also serves coffee for beverage. As shown in the picture, Agustina starts to cook "puto". They are trying hard to improve and expand their business for the future of their children.

loans.use: Additional capital for fish vending business and start up capital for snack vending

loans.name: Shokirjon

texts.ru: Шокиржон-молодой человек,неженат.Занимается продажей мужской одежды и обуви на вещевом рынке Спитаменского района уже более 5-ти лет.Его товары пользуются хорошим спросом,так как он провозит красивую модную одежду хорошего качества.Шокиржон 2 раза в месяц ездит за товаром в оптовый рынок города Истаравшан.На новый займ он расчитывает расширить свой ассортимент летних рубашек,футболок и сортивных костюмов.Шокиржон рад,что кредитуется у нас и благодарит наших кредиторов.
texts.en:
Shokirjon is a young man, not yet married. He has sold men's clothing and shoes at the Spitamen regional clothing market for more than five years. His goods are in high demand, since he carries good quality, attractive and fashionable merchandise. Twice a month, Shokirjon goes on a buying trip to the wholesale market in Istaravshan. With this new loan, he is thinking of expanding his selection of summer shirts, t-shirts and quality suits. Shokirjon is pleased to be a credit customer of MicroInvest, and thanks the lenders.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand selection of men's clothing

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
