Josephine A. is a rice grower. She has been a farmer for many years. Her harvest is mainly for family use. The surplus is sold in the market for additional income. Her husband, Andie A., is the one managing their farm. "Farming is a hard work, and it benefited a lot of families," she says.

The purpose of her loan is to buy fertilizers. She wants to improve the soil condition of her farm to improve her yield. The loan will help her provide for the growing needs of her family.

CEVI is reaching out to more people, especially the poor, to start their own businesses. It offers loans, training and insurance coverage to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Hursheda

texts.ru: Абдуджабборова Хуршеда- женщина 31 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Она занимается  продажей полотенец и скатерти. Хуршеда торгует а Торговом Центре «Авганбазар» находящийся в районе «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда. Она закупает товар с Китая. Она ездит за товаром 1 раз в месяц. Когда она уезжает за товаром место него торгует её сестра. Когда Хуршеда начинала бизнес, у неё были маленькие количество товара. Теперь у неё увеличился ассортимент.
texts.en:
Hursheda A. is a 31-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of three children. Hursheda sells towels and tablecloths at the Avganbazar trade center, which is located in Panchshanbe section of the city of Khujand. She buys her goods from China, and goes on a buying trip once a month. While she is away making purchases, her sister minds the shop. When Hursheda started the business, she only had a small selection of merchandise, but now her assortment of goods has increased.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase variety of merchandise

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita T. raises pigs at the back of her house. She is a 40-year-old mother of two children who has been raising pigs for quite a long time already. Her husband, Ranulfo T., works with his motorcycle. However, his earnings are not enough to cover their needs.

The purpose of her loan is to buy piglets. She already has a pig fence and she wants to make her small piggery grow. The loan will definitely help her family sustain their livelihood and increase the size of her business.

CEVI is reaching out to a lot of people to help them start their own businesses. CEVI offers not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional pigs

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано-женщина 44-х лет.Замужем имеет З-х детей.Рано более 6-ти лет занимается продажей продуктов питания в продовольственном рынке Спитаменского района.Рано хотела, бы расширить ассортимент своего товара, потому, что хороший ассортимент привлекает больше клиентов. Для этого она предпочла взять займ для расширения своего ассортимента.Её муж - водитель такси помогает ей с поставкой товара из города Худжанда,где Рано имеет своих поставщиков.
texts.en:
Rano is a 44 year old woman. She is married and has three children. Rano has been selling food at a food market of the Spitamen region for more than six years. Rano wants to increase the assortment of her merchandise because a good variety of products attracts more customers. She decided to take out a loan for this purpose. Her husband is a taxi driver and helps her with the delivery of goods from the town of Khudjand where Rano has suppliers.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna O. manages a small store. She is 39, married and has three children in school. She could hardly keep up with the family finances, which is why she engages herself in business to supplement their limited income. Her husband is earning from his motorcycle. They work together to send all their children to school.

The purpose of her loan is to buy additional merchandise for her store. In that way, she could attract more buyers and earn a bigger profit.

CEVI is helping her grow her business even more. Now she receives not just CEVI loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Maria Lina

texts.en:
Maria Lina C. is a pig grower. She is 44 and has two children. She was not content to just sit in the house. She wanted to help her husband, Nestor C., by earning money and contributing to the family income. Now she has five pigs and one sow. She sells the pigs for Php 8,000 to Php 9,000 each. This has been her business for the past five years.

The purpose of her loan is to buy additional piglets and pig feed. The loan will help her grow the size of her piggery and earn a bigger income in the future.

Maria Lina C. enjoys the services that CEVI offers. CEVI provides not just loans but also training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Zulfiniso

texts.ru: Хошимова Зулфинисо- женщина 52 лет. Замужем мать 4-х детей. Зулфинисо занимается переработкой пряжи и вышиванием разных шерстенных вещей. Ей помогает в этом невестка и дочка. Муж работает в колхозе она сама также колхозница. В сезон сбора хлопка они всей семьёю выходят на поле и от собранного урожая получают деньги. Зулфинисо также откормом скота у себя дома. Зулфинисо получив займ хочет оптом закупить пряжу с последующей переработкой . Зулфинисо свой товар реализует на рынках Оппон и Булок.
texts.en:
Zulfiniso H. is 52 years old, married and has four children. Zulfiniso is involved in yarn processing and embroidery of various wool items. Her daughter-in-law and daughter help her with the business. Zulfiniso’s husband works at a collective farm. Zulfiniso is also a farmer. During the cotton picking season, their whole family goes out to the field and makes money from the harvest. Zulfiniso is also involved in livestock feeding at home. She wants to use this loan in order to buy processed yarn at a wholesale price. Zulfiniso sells her goods at the Oppon and Bulok markets.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of yarn

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita C. has industriously nurtured her farm. She grows rice to support her needs and her five children. She started farming in 1990 using her own lot, which she inherited from her parents. She loves farming a lot. She enjoys working under the heat of the sun, touching the clay loam and wet soil in order to feed and clothe her family well.

The purpose of her loan from CEVI (KIVA partner in the Philippines) is to buy fertilizers for her farm. She believes that the soil has to be treated to have a better harvest. The loan will truly help Amelita increase her yield.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that was organized to respond to the needs of small entrepreneurs. CEVI has reached out to a lot of people to start their own businesses. It not only provides loans but also gives training and insurance coverage to all its clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila M. is a farmer. Her specialization is rice but she also grows vegetables at the back of her house. She is 45 years old and has two children. Her husband, Jose M., is working as a bus fare collector. They work together for the future of their children.

The purpose of Mila's loan is to buy fertilizers for her farm. She thinks that by using fertilizers, she will have bigger yield. In addition to fertilizers, she will use some of her loan to start a new business to augment their income.

Mila has been a CEVI client for two years already. She receives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and start a new business.

loans.name: Nuon's Group

texts.en:
The leader of this group is Mrs. C.. She is 33 and has been selling all kinds of vegetables in the local market for years. She buys her products in bulk from farmers and sells them from 7:00 am to 4:00 pm. To help meet the family's foods demands, her husband owns a car and uses it to pick up the passengers for income. He leaves his house in early morning to provide his service and comes back in late afternoon with much income. The couple lives with three single children, who are all local students. To earn additional income and accrue business capital, Mrs. C. has decided to seek a loan to buy more vegetables and fruits to sell.

This group also consists of four other borrowers. All the borrowers live in Siem Reap Province, in Cambodia. Mrs. S. sells souvenir gifts to tourists and seeks a loan to add to her savings in order to finish building her house. Mrs. S. sells fresh vegetables and is applying for a loan to add rice to the stocks for resale in order to gain income. Mrs. N. works as a staff member in a hotel and she would like a loan to replace her old motor so she can ride to work more easily. Mrs. M. is a souvenir seller who is requesting a loan to add to her savings in order to build house.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza L. is a rice farmer. She is 39 years old, married, and has no child yet. She want to earn more from her farm. In that way, she could help her parents and siblings out in their family finances. Her husband, Randy L., is the one managing the rice farm business. In addition to rice, the couple grows vegetables at the back of their house to supplement their income.

She is requesting a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy five bags of fertilizers, seeds and insecticides. The loan will help Riza manage her small farm.

CEVI provides their clients with not just loans. It also gives training and insurance coverage services to help small businesses grow.

loans.use: To purchase five bags of fertilizers, seeds, and insecticides.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma J. is 44 years old and has seven children. She is a rice grower and tills her 1-hectare farm along with her husband to feed and clothe her family. When her children are not in school, they help Gemma in the farm. She wants to teach her children the value of hard work, which is important not only in house-hold chores but also at work. She requests a loan to buy four sacks of urea, seeds and herbicides. She is also interested in looking at other possible activities to augment her income.

Gemma appreciates CEVI’s effort in reaching out to so many people to help them start their business. CEVI provides not just loans but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase four sacks of urea, seeds and herbicides

loans.name: Sawssan

texts.en: Sawssan, 39, lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with her husband and three children. She has owned a grocery store since 2001. When she first started her business, Sawssan didn’t have the startup capital. However, she continued with the business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. She requests a loan of US $1500 from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise for her store. This is her fourth cycle of loan, and she has always paid back on time. The previous loans helped her improve her store by diversifying her merchandise. Sawssan is a good business woman as she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients include her friends and neighbors. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Sae’D

texts.en: Sae’d A. is a young single man of 22 years of age. For two years, he has had a grocery store in Gaza City, Palestine. He would like to use this loan to increase trade by purchasing sacks of rice, canned goods, and other products for his shop. Doing so means he would be able to contribute to improving the standard of living for his family.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice, canned goods, and other products for his shop.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida Y. is a housewife. But, she was not content to just stay in the house and do all the chores. She wanted to help her husband, Hermenio Y.. She is now helping on the farm to contribute something to the family's income. Aida is 57 years old. She owns the 1 hectare of land that her husband is tilling. She started farming just recently,  although they have had a farm since 1968.

She is asking for a loan of PHP12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farming products. Some of the loan will also be used to start a new business. She is just trying to figure out what business to engage in aside from rice farming.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines. It provides not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and other farming products.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 42-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Imad has owned a sweets shop since 1990. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials and merchandise for his shop. This is his fourth loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his shop. His clients can be anybody from his region, as well as tourists. When he first started, he didn’t face any difficulty. Imad decided on doing his work because he wants to improve his family’s income. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by opening another sweets shop.

loans.use: purchase raw materials and merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is managing a rice field. She has had a rice farm since 1994. She inherited a 2-hectare farm from her parents and she and her husband, Rolan B., plant rice as a family source of income. "Farming needs patience," she said to CEVI. "When you farm, you need to wait for a long time before harvest," she added.

She is asking a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. The purpose of her loan is to buy fertilizer. She will have a better yield if only she can improve the soil on her farm. She wants to help her husband especially in land preparation before planting.

CEVI provides its clients the loan that they need to sustain their livelihood. It also gives training and insurance coverage services to help small business to grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза - молодая девушка 28 лет. Не замужем. Занимается продажей женской обуви, платков и женской одежды. Наргиза закупает товар на оптовом рынке города Истаравшан. Она ездит за товаром примерно два раза в неделю или когда в этом есть необходимость. Она торгует на рынке Фаровон города Гафурова. Наргиза старается самостоятельно сформировать свой бизнес. Она помогает родителям. Свой новый займ она потратит на закупку летней партии товара.
texts.en:
Nargiza is a young woman of 28. She is single, and sells women's shoes, shawls and clothing. Nargiza purchases her goods at the wholesale market in Istaravshan. She goes on a buying trip approximately twice a week, or whenever necessary. She trades at the Farovon market in the town of Gafurov. Nargiza is trying to develop the business independent of her parents, whom she assists. She will spend her new loan on the purchase of a batch of goods for summer.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes, shawls and women's clothing

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen D. C. is a pig grower. She is 50 years old, married and has 8 loving children. She wants to grow her business even more. She and her husband have worked very hard to feed and clothe their family. She started raising pigs back in 1990, and the income that she gets from her pigs is what she uses to pay for school fees, especially tuition and the books for her children. In addition to pigs, she also owns a rice field. Her husband tills the land that she inherited from her parents. She has been a CEVI client for a long time already.

The purpose of her loan is to purchase feed. Knowing that feed is quite expensive nowadays, she needs assistance to support her business. Presently, she has 5 pigs and the loan that she is requesting will truly help her to increase the size of her piggery.

CEVI is reaching out to more people, especially the poor, to start and maintain their own source of livelihood. CEVI provides not just loans to all their clients, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie C. is growing pigs for a living. She thinks that having a piggery is a very productive business. She started raising pigs in 2004. Her husband,Rogelio C., constructed a concrete pig fence at the back of their house. Annie is just 44 and has 3 children in school.

She is requesting a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional 2 piglets. Aside from that, she will also use the loan to buy feed to fatten her pigs. She is excited about the possible income she will earn from the pigs that she raises.

CEVI is a non-profit organization organized to respond to the needs of small entrepreneurs. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase feed and piglets

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen L. has a small piggery. She is 41 years old, married and has three children. She dreams of having a store someday. For now, she is happy to have all her pigs for her business. Her husband, Welfredo L., is a farmer. Her husband manages their small rice field to supplement their income. 

As a mother, Helen wants to help especially in the family finances. She wants to avail loans from CEVI to support her pig business. The purpose of her loan is to buy feed and piglets. The loan will truly help her increase the size of her business.

Helen L. has been a CEVI client for a long time already. She enjoys having easy access to CEVI credit assistance, training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Guilerma

texts.en:
Guilerma B.'s business is a piggery. She started it in 1990 using her small savings. At first, she only had two sows. Now she has more pigs and wants to make it grow in the future. She married a farmer, Adolfo B.. Her husband is very supportive of her and her business. The income from the piggery goes to pay the tuition and other school fees of her children. Education is important for Guilerma. She wants all her children to graduate from college.

She is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy pig feed. She will also construct another pig fence for additional pigs that she plans to raise. CEVI is helping her sustain and grow her business. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Aminatu

texts.en:
Aminatu A., 42, is married and blessed with six children, three sons and three daughters. Few of her children are in the junior high school, while others are in the primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works to support her husband financially to provide for the family and especially meet the children’s school demands. Her husband deals in diamonds.

Aminatu is a trader. She buys foodstuff and vegetables such as maize, yam, plantain from nearby smaller communities and sells to food vendors and retailers in her community. Aminatu has been at work for three years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. Aminatu hopes to expand her business and give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy foodstuff and vegetables to expand business

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena N., 50, is married and lives with her husband and four children (two sons and two daughters) in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. While few of her children are in the junior high school others are in the senior high school. Abena works to support her husband financially to provide for the family and especially meet the children’s school demands. Her husband is a farmer while she is a trader. 

She buys foodstuffs such as maize, yam, plantain, rice and vegetables from nearby smaller communities and sells to food vendors and retailers in her community. Abena has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs to expand business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet A., 38, is married and is blessed with four children: one son and three daughters. One is currently learning a trade while the rest are in primary and junior high schools. Janet lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana. She works to support her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband is a carpenter by profession, while Janet is a food vendor.

She cooks and sells rice and stew. She prepares and sells the food in the local government school compound. Janet procures bags of rice and other ingredients from the nearby supermarket. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to purchase bags of rice in bulk. Janet hopes to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas A., 40, is married and is the father of five children: three sons and two daughters. His children study in primary and junior high schools. The last born is yet to start school. His wife trades in provision to make some income to support him financially. Thomas lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Takorase, a farming and trading community in the eastern region of Ghana.

Thomas repairs and mends bicycles in his community. He works with bicycle spare parts such pedals, seat, etc., in a shed by the road side. Thomas has been in the business for four years and wants a loan to buy bicycle spare parts to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy bicycle spare parts

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia A. is 23 years old. She is single and lives with her mother in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana. She works very hard to support her mother financially and provide for her family.

Patricia is a food vendor. She cooks and sells sugary kenkey. She prepares the food in her house and hawks in the community and at the market square. She procures bags of maize and other ingredients from wholesalers in the nearby towns. Patricia has been in the business for five years and wants a loan to purchase bags of maize in bulk. She hopes to make some savings before she enters into marriage.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize

loans.name: Guilerma

texts.en:
Guilerma R. manages a small sari-sari store. She is 50 years old, married and has no children yet. She was tired of just staying in the house and earning nothing. She wanted to help her husband. That is why she started to establish a small store and sell various kinds of goods like rice, sardines, package goods, soaps and other items. Now, she her business is growing and well established.

She is asking for a loan of Php 5,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her business. The loan will truly help her increase her income.

CEVI is a non-profit organization that helps people start and have their own business. CEVI gives their clients not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose B. is a 52-year-old divorced mother of two children: a son and a daughter. Her son is into commercial driving, while her daughter studies in the senior high school. Rose lives with her two children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana.

Rose trades in second hand textiles—clothes for both genders as well as bed sheets. She procures bales of textiles from Accra and sells in her community by hawking. Rose says she also travels to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in the business for five years and desires to expand her business. She hopes to improve her standard of living and support her children’s further education.

loans.use: To procure second hand textiles

loans.name: Abdukarim

texts.ru: Абдукарим- мужчина 58-ми лет,женат имеет з-х детей.Занимается продажей продуктами питания такими как сахар,конфеты,макароны,печенье и другие.Cвой бизнес он начал с одного стола,постепенно расширил свой товарооборот.Сейчас он открыл маленький магазин возле своего дома.Его жена и дети помогают ему привозить товар из города Худжанда.Абдукарим рад сотрудничеству с нашей организацией.
texts.en:
Abdukarim is a 58 year old man with a wife and three children. He sells groceries such as sugar, candy, noodles, cookies, and more. He began his business from one table, and gradually expanded sales. Now he has opened a small store near his house. His wife and children help him drive goods in from the city of Khujand. Abdukarim is happy to work with our organization.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales expansion

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama M. is a 55-year-old married mother of six children: four sons and two daughters. While few of her children are in senior high school, others are in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the eastern region of Ghana. She works to support her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband is a security guard in a local company.

Mariama is a food vendor. She prepares and sells porridge in the mornings. She prepares the porridge from ingredients such as millet, maize, beans, etc and sells on the street. Mariama has been in the business for ten years and wants a loan to purchase goods in bulk to expand her business. She hopes to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy maize, millet and other goods to expand business

loans.name: Gnamba

texts.fr: Cette  est une résidente du quartier de KEGUE. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois, elle a commencé cette activité en 2006. Ce commerce marche bien pour elle car elle est la seule revendeuse de charbons de bois de son quartier. Le stock dont elle dispose actuellement ne lui permet pas de satisfaire ses clients, elle sollicite alors de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 20 sacs de charbons de bois.
texts.en:
This is a woman who lives in the KEGUE neighborhood. She's married and the mother of two children. To make money, she sells charcoal, a business she's been running since 2006. She's doing well, because she's the only charcoal reseller in her neighborhood. The stock she currently has does not enable her to meet customer demand, she's therefore seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy 20 sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en:
Augustina Y. is a twenty-two year old lady. She is single but has given birth to one child, a girl, who is currently in nursery school. Augustina says she and her daughter live with an aunt in a rented apartment in a town called Takorase. Takorase is farming and commercial community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Augustina runs a drugstore in the community. She sells drugs such as paracetamol, syrups and all other kinds of tablets. Her drugstore is located at the local market square. Augustina procures the drugs from nearby bigger towns. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure drugs in bulk. She is hopeful to give her child the best of education.

loans.use: To procure drugs for re-sale

loans.name: Fares

texts.en: Fares A. lives in Gaza city in Palestine. He is 32 years old, married, and has seven children. He is engaged in sheep-breeding which is the only source of income for Fares and his family. He believes such a business will provide his children a better life and the opportunity for a good education. He has applied for this loan to purchase more sheep and fodder.

loans.use: purchase more sheep and fodder

loans.name: Tong

texts.en:
Mrs. Tong H. was born in 1963 and is the mother of seven children; two of them are married and live independently and the other five are single and are working in different jobs. H. owns farmland that was inherited from her grandparents and uses it to run a farming business. She and her husband also grow rice and all kinds of vegetables; they sell their produce to their buyers every 2 months.

Because Mrs. H. saw that her neighbor's business raising pigs is a profitable one, she would like a loan from Kiva in order to purchase piglets to raise and to buy more fertilizer for planting crops.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua S. is thirty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, a son and a daughter. She says both of her children are in primary school. Akua says she lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Her husband is a tailor by profession. She works to assist her husband financially.

Akua is a petty trader. She sells costume jewelry of all kinds and ladies’ underwear. She sells at the local market and also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. Akua buys the merchandise from wholesalers in Accra. She has been in business for seven years now and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She is hopeful to give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy costume jewelry and ladies’ underwears

loans.name: Hakika Group

texts.en:
Naomi has owned a small grocery store in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 3 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 50. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more grocery items to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Naomi is married, and has four children: ages 22, 18, 15 and 11. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Ruth, who owns her own small business selling charcoal in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to expand her business.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa M. is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all of whom are girls. She says one of her daughters is currently married while the rest are in primary school. Yaa lives with her husband and two other children in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She is a petty trader. She sells second-hand textiles – clothes for both sexes and also bed sheets.

Yaa procures bales of textiles from Accra and sells in her community by hawking. She says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for five years and desires to expand her business. Yaa is hopeful to improve upon her standard of living and pay for her children to attain the higher levels of academia.

loans.use: To procure second-hand textiles for re-sale

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca A. is thirty-nine years old. She is married and has given birth to six children, three sons and three daughters, who are all currently in junior high or primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works to assist her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband is a carpenter by profession.

Rebecca is a baker. She bakes bread and supplies it to retailers, food vendors and hawks to sell the rest in her community. Rebecca procures her ingredients from nearby supermarkets. She has been in business for nine years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour, etc.

loans.name: Mrs. Seam Vann Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of nineteen members, is located in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province. They plan to use the loan that they obtain for different purposes. Mrs. SE. V. is the village bank president. She has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land used to cultivate rice. On this plantation, she faced an obstacle because her field is infertile. This has a bad effect on her crops. In order to deal this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her field and make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. H. Han, is a construction worker. Mrs. SE. V. has five children. One of her children is a construction worker while another is a laborer and the others are attending the local school. 

One member in this group has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en:
Kwabena A. is a fifty-year-old married man and the father of three daughters. The first is in senior high school, the second in primary and the last born has yet to start school. His wife is a hard-working woman. She is a petty trader. She runs a provision store and sells fish on a table top in front of the store. Kwabena lives with his family in a rented apartment in a town called Takorase. Takorase is farming and a trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. He is into palm oil production business.

Kwabena buys palm nuts from farmers in his community and other nearby towns. He says he distributes the oil to retailers who come from other towns to buy by the gallon. Kwabena has been in business for five years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk. He is hopeful to give his children the best of education he can afford.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk

loans.name: Hakika Group

texts.en:
Evodia has been a animal feed seller in the JNzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 3 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 25. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more animal feed to increase her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Evodia is 27 years old and single. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Agness, who owns her own small business selling bites (cakes) in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more animal feed to increase her current stock

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith has been a clothes seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 5 years. She belongs to Hakika group loan (Group code 2013). She currently earns an average monthly profit of US$ 25. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for re-sale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Judith is 37 years old, married, and has a 10-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for re-sale.

loans.name: Koffi Justin

texts.fr: A. est un électricien, il a sa propre boutique qu’il a appelé «  ELECTRO STAR ».pour gagner plus de revenu il a associé à cette activité le commerce des matériaux de construction. Son stock de marchandises est épuisé il veut se réapprovisionner  et  sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter des tuyaux, des barres de fer, des tôles, des clous et de ciments. Il est marié et a 02 enfants, c’est son commece qui lui permet de subvenir convenablement aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
A. is an electrician, he has his own shop that he called "ELECTRO STAR". To increase his income, he also sells construction supplies. His stock has run out, and he wants to resupply. He's therefore seeking his first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy pipes, iron bars, sheet metals, nails, and cement. He's married and the father of two children, and his business enables him to properly provide for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell construction supplies (pipes, nails, cement, ...)

loans.name: Mr. Ngi Top's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty people living in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province comprise this village bank, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mr. N. T. is a 57-year-old village bank president. He is a farmer who hires a 1-hectare field to cultivate rice on. In this plantation, he has a problem because he earns too little income to support his family. In order to improve his income, he decided to ask for a loan to hire a piece of land to cultivate rice on and he would use the rest of money to purchase fertilizer to support his field. His wife, Mrs. Van Ran, is a housewife. Mr. N. T. has twelve children, five of whom are employed in different positions while two others are fishermen and the remaining five are attending the local school. Mrs. Srey Tuch C. did not come to take her loan but her husband did, so he is present in the picture instead of his wife.

One member in this group is an end-of-term borrower and the rest have monthly payment loans. E-o-T borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to hire a piece of land to cultivate rice and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia  has sold eggs and chickens in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for the past 2 years. She belongs to the Maendeleo A  loan group (Group code 2015).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more chickens to increase her stock. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Lydia is 29  years old, married, and has three children: ages 10, 5 and 1.

loans.use: To buy more hens and eggs to increase her stock.

loans.name: Faoussa

texts.fr: Cette dame s’est lancée en 2007 dans la vente des matériaux de construction, elle exerce ce commerce dans sa propre boutique qu’elle a appelé « EST BON MARCHE ». Ce commerce marche bien pour elle, elle reçoit des commandes des entrepreneurs et réalise ainsi de bons chiffres d’affaire. Son stock est épuisé et voulant se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 02 WC, 01 groupe de sécurité, 02 bacs, 03 paquets de tôles et divers matériaux de construction.  Elle est mariée et a 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who started selling construction supplies in 2007. She runs her business in her own store, that she called "EST BON MARCHE". This business works well for her, she gets orders from builders and, therefore, her revenue is good. Her stock has run out and she's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to resupply. She wants to buy 2 toilets, one TPR valve, 2 tubs, 3 packs of sheet metal, and various other construction supplies. She's married and the mother of 2 children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction supplies (2 toilets, one TPR valve, 2 tubs, ...)

loans.name: Frola

texts.en:
Frola has sold chickens and eggs in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for 10 years. She belongs to the Maendeleo 'A'   loan group (Group code 2015).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $250. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more hens and eggs to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Frola is 45  years old, married, and has four  children: ages 25, 23, 18 and 15.

loans.use: To buy more hens and eggs to expand her business.

loans.name: Mr. Song Shem's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people living in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province comprise this village bank, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mr. Song S. is the 49-year-old village bank president. He is a farmer who hires a plot of land from the other people to cultivate rice on. In this plantation, he has an obstacle because his field is infertile which has a bad to affect on his crop. In order to solve this problem, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make his crop more productive. His wife, Mrs. Chum Srey Neang, is a pig breeder. Mr. Song S. has eight children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while five others are enrolled in the local school, and the remaining one is too young to work or study.

Four members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. End-of-term borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: buy fertilizer to make his crop more productive

loans.name: Dopé

texts.fr: Madame F. exerce depuis 1994 le commerce de pagnes, son ancienneté dans ce commerce fait qu’elle le maîtrise. Aussi elle a beaucoup de clients. Elle exerce son activité au marché local de Kégué  et s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé où le commerce de pagnes est très développé. Son stock de pagnes est épuisé, pour  se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 15 pièces de pagnes de grande qualité. Elle est mariée et a 02 enfants, avec ce qu’elle gagne de son commerce elle aide son époux dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en:
Mrs. F. has been selling "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) since 1994 and her experience in this business means that she knows it well. She also has a lot of customers. She sells her fabric in the local market of Kégué and buys her merchandise at the big open-air market of Lomé where a great deal of African print fabric is sold. Her stock of "pagnes" is expended and to replenish it, she is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy 15 bolts of high quality "pagnes". She is married and has 2 children; with the income from her little business, she assists her husband in paying household expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes" for re-sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. has worked as a trader at Kissi, near Elmina, since 2003. She sells such goods as plastic bowls, utensils and cloth. Mary is married with 4 children and has received an education through Junior High School. While Mary works as a trader, her husband is employed as a taxi driver.  Her loan will be used to purchase additional plastic bowls, utensils and cloth which she will then resell.  Mary hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a home for her family and also further her children's education.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to purchase additional plastic bowls, utensils and cloth which she will then resell.

loans.name: Asila

texts.ru: Асила Бобоева-женщина 31 года имеет 2-х детей.3 года назад Асила начала свой бизнес с маленькой суммы.Привозила из Худжанда и продавала продукты питания,постепенно расширив свой товарооборот,она начала ездить за товаром в соседние республики-Узбекистан и Казахстан.Оттуда она привозит конфеты,шоколад и печенье и сдаёт оптом в магазины и продовольственные рынки Спитаменского района.Eё товары пользуются хорошим спросом,так как она привозит товар хорошего качества.Она рада сотрудничеству с нашей организацией.
texts.en:
Asila B. is 31 years old and has two children. Three years ago, Asila started her own business with a small sum. She brought food products from Khujand and sold them. After gradually increasing her products turnover, she began traveling to the neighboring republics of Uzbekistan and Kazakhstan. She brings candy, chocolate and cookies from there and sells these products wholesale to stores and food markets of the Spitamen district. Her products are in good demand because she brings products of good quality. She is happy to be working with our organization.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing products turnover

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.ru: Мархамат - женщина 41 года. Замужем и имеет 3-х детей. Занимается продажей женской и мужской обуви и носков на рынке "Фаровон" города Гафурова. Закупает товар из оптового рынка г. Истаравшан. Её муж ездит за товаром раз в две недели. Привозит жене товар, а она сидит на рынке и продаёт их. Мархамат уже 1 год кредитуется у нас. Когда она начинала, у нее было маленькое количество товара. Но сейчас Мархамат расширилась, и за свой последний кредит, она планирует закупить партию летней обуви.
texts.en:
Marhamat is a 41-year-old woman. She is married and has three children. Marhamat sells women's and men's shoes and socks at the Farovon market in the town of Gafurov. She purchases her goods at the wholesale market in the town of Istaravshan. Her husband goes there on a buying trip once every two weeks. He delivers the goods to his wife, while she minds the stall and sells them. Marhamat has been a loan customer of MicroInvest for one year. When she began, she had only had a small inventory, but now Marhamat has expanded and with her latest loan she plans to purchase a selection of summer shoes.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of shoes and socks

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en:
Kwabena B. is a forty three year old married man and a father of three daughters. The eldest daughter is in senior high school, the second in primary school and the youngest has yet to start school. His wife is a hard working woman. She is a trader and trades in food stuffs. Kwabena lives with his family in a rented apartment in a town called Takorase. Takorase is a farming and a trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana. 

Kwabena deals in raw gold mined from the ground. He buys the gold from the young men who are into the mining activity in his community and sells it to refiners in other towns. He sometimes refines the gold himself to add value to it so as get a good selling price. Kwabena has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure the raw minerals in bulk. He hopes to give his children the best education he can afford.

loans.use: To buy gold mineral from local miners

loans.name: Oduro

texts.en:
Oduro G. is a forty-five-year-old man. He is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters, who are all currently in junior high or primary schools. Oduro says he lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Takorase. Takorase is farming and a trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Oduro runs a drugstore in the community. Oduro sells drugs such as paracetamol, syrups and all other kinds of tablets. His drugstore is located at the local market square. Oduro procures the drugs from big pharmacy shops in nearby towns. He has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure drugs in bulk. He is hopeful to give his children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure drugs

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred Y. is a fifty-five year old man. He is married and has six children, four sons and two daughters. Some are in senior high and junior high schools. Others are out of school and married. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a town called Takorase. Takorase is farming and a trading community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Alfred runs a drugstore in his community. He sells drugs such as paracetamol, syrups and all other kinds of tablets. His drugstore is located on one of the main streets in the community. He procures the drugs from big pharmacy shops in nearby towns. Alfred has been in business for fifteen years and wants a loan to procure drugs in bulk. He is hopeful to give his children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure drugs in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.ru: Хафиза - молодая женщина 39 лет. Замужем и имеет 4-х детей. Занимается выпечкой и продажей национальной лепешки. Её муж печет хлеб, а Хафиза сидит на рынке "Панчшанбе" и продает. Их пекарня находится дома. Они выделили комнату и посадили там тандыр, который вы можете увидеть на снимке. В этом тандыре пекут национальную таджикскую лепешку. Хафиза и её муж заранее закупают сырьё за несколько месяцев. За этот кредит Хафиза и её муж закупили несколько мешков муки.
texts.en:
Hafiza is a young woman of 39. She is married and has four children. She bakes and sells traditional bread, lepeshka. Her husband bakes the bread, while Hafiza minds the stall at the Panchshanbe marketplace and sells it. Their bread oven is located in their home. They set aside a room and installed a tandoor there, which you can see in the photograph. Traditional Tajik lepeshka is baked in this tandoor. In the past, Hafiza and her husband have purchased several months' worth of ingredients. With this loan, Hafiza and her husband purchased several bags of flour.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bread bakery

loans.name: Kwabena

texts.en:
Kwabena A. is a fifty-five year old married man and the father of six children, two daughters and four sons. The first daughter is married. Some are in senior high and primary schools while others are learning trades. His wife is a hard-working woman. She is a petty trader. She runs a provision store and sells fish on a table top in front of the store. Kwabena lives with his family in a rented apartment in a town called Takorase. Takorase is farming and a commercial community in the Eastern Region of Ghana.

Kwabena buys and sells palm nuts. He buys palm nuts from farmers in his community and other nearby towns and distributes them in a truck to retailers, food vendors and palm oil producers in other communities. Kwabena has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk. He is hopeful to give his children the best education he can afford.

loans.use: To procure palm nuts in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther A. is thirty-two years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, one son and three daughters. One is currently learning a trade while the rest are in junior high or primary schools. Esther lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works to assist her husband financially to provide for the family. Her husband is a carpenter by trade.

Esther is a food vendor. She cooks and sells rice and stew. She prepares and sells the food in the local government school compound. Esther procures bags of rice and other ingredients from nearby supermarkets. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to procure bags of rice in bulk. Esther is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of rice to make cooked food for sale

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en:
Nabil is a 27-year-old man who lives in Tyre, in southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Nabil has been working as a car painter for four years. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and an electric generator(because often there is no electricity) for his work. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 

His previous loan helped him improve his business. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he had difficulty purchasing his tools and building up networking. Nabil decided on doing his business because he wanted to have an independent job. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: purchase tools and an electric motor for his work

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is 29 years old and lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. He has been repairing cars for 13 years and went into this business because he wanted to have independence in his work. His customers are his friends, neighbors and other local people.

Jihad requested a loan of $1000 USD from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase car batteries and spare parts for his garage. He has been a microcredit client for five years now and has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his business, and in the future he plans on further improvements.

loans.use: To purchase car batteries and spare parts for his garage

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth Y. is forty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to four children, two sons and two daughters. She says some of her children are in junior high school while others are in senior high school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Elizabeth works to assist her husband financially to provide for the family and especially meet the children’s school demands. Her husband is a teacher by profession.

Elizabeth buys cereals such as maize, beans, groundnuts, etc. from nearby smaller communities and sells to food vendors and retailers in her community. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk for re-sale

loans.name: Radwan

texts.en:
Radwan is 34 years old and lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon. He has been selling chickens to friends and neighbors for eight years. Radwan went into this business because he wanted independence in his work, but when he first started he had difficulty purchasing tools. In the future, he plans on making improvements to his business.

Radwan requested a loan of $1000 USD from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase both supplies for his chickens and fish to sell. This is the first time that he has requested a loan.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for his chickens, and fish to sell

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate O. is forty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: two sons and two daughters. She says some of her children are in the junior high school while others are in the primary school. Kate lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She works to support her husband financially so as to provide for the family and especially to meet the children’s school needs. Kate’s husband is a commercial driver.

Kate is a trader. She trades in groundnut paste (peanut butter). She roasts the de-husked groundnuts, has them milled and then sells the resulting paste. Kate supplies to food vendors and retailers. She procures her goods from wholesalers in Oda and other nearby towns. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To buy fresh groundnuts for her business

loans.name: Tursunboy

texts.ru: Турсунбой - 59 лет. У него есть жена и 8 детей. Пятеро сына и три дочери. Старшие сыновья уехали в Россию для работы. Работая там, они высылают деньги родителям. Родители копят высланные деньги, чтобы потом потратить их на женитьбу сыновей и замужество дочерей. Дочери помогают по хозяйству. Жена занимается переработкой пряжи. Она сама ездит на рынок, чтобы продать их. Турсунбой пасет скот в горах и возвращается очень поздно. Он взял кредит в нашей организации, чтобы увеличить количество скота. Теперь он наш клиент.
texts.en:
Tursunboy is 59 years old. He has a wife and eight children, five sons and three daughters. The older sons went to Russia to work. Working there they send money to the parents. The parents save the sent money in order to spend it on the marriages of their sons and daughters. The daughters help around the house. The wife processes yarn. She travels to the market herself in order to sell it. Tursunboy takes the livestock out to pasture in the mountains and returns very late. He took out a loan in order to increase his livestock count. Now he is our client.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase livestock count

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana A. is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: two sons and two daughters. She says some of her children are in the junior high school while others are in the senior high school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Christiana works to support her husband financially to provide for the family and especially to meet the children’s school needs. Her husband is a cocoa farmer while she is a trader.

Christiana trades in foodstuffs. She buys foodstuffs such as maize, yam, cassava, plantain, etc. all the way from Techiman in the northern sector. She sells to food vendors and retailers in her community. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to expand her business. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best of education.

loans.use: To procure foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 39 years old and lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their two children. He has been working in electrical repairs for 23 years, mending electrical motors, agricultural tools and other electrical products. Ali went into this line of business because of his experience and his desire for independence in his work. At first, he had difficulty networking, but today he is successful because he does a good job for his customers, who are his friends, neighbors and other local people.

Ali requested a loan of $1000 USD from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Nadim

texts.en:
Nadim is a 34-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Nadim has been working in agriculture for fifteen years. He also owns a school van. He requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Nadim has requested a loan. 
His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Nadim decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on improving his work.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Kurbonali

texts.ru: Курбонали пожилой мужчина 54 лет. Женат. Отец 6-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей крупнорогатого и мелко рогатого скота.  Жена – домохозяйка. Курбонали закупает скот на рынке и откармливая 2-3 месяца продает. Рынок находится далеко от его дома, поэтому он должен нанимать машину, чтобы довезти скот до рынка. Пока у Курбонали нет машины. Но он надеется, что когда у него будет большой товарооборот и большая прибыль, он купит себе машину. Он надеется что кредит ему поможет в достижении его цели.
texts.en:
Kurbonali is an older man of 54 years old. He is married and is a father of six children. He feeds and sells large and small cattle. His wife is a housewife. Kurbonali buys cattle on the market and feeds it for about two to three months. The market is located far from his house and this is why has has to rent a vehicle to transport the cattle to the market. At this time Kurbonali does not have a car. He hopes that when he will have a larger turnaround and more profits he will buy himself a car. He hopes that the loan will assist him in achieving this goal.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and selling cattle

loans.name: Mouhamad

texts.en:
Mouhamad is a 55 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Mouhamad has owned a restaurant since 2005. He requested a loan of $2000 US from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his restaurant. This is his fourth loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his business, as well as his financiA. situation. His clients are his friends, neighbors and tourists. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulties. Mouhamad decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase restaurant merchandise

loans.name: Ahmadali

texts.ru: Ахмадали - мужчина лет 54 лет, женат и отец 7-х детей. У Ахмадали есть стадо мелко-рогатого скота, состояшее примерно из 50 овец и 30 козлов. Его жена домохозяйка, но в свободное время занимается переработкой шерсти, вяжет разные теплые вещи. Эти вещи она продаёт соседям или родственникам. Ахмадали каждое утро гонит своё стадо в горы, пасет их, и вечером отгоняет их обратно. У Ахмадали пока нет крупно-рогатого скота. Но Ахмадали за этот новый займ хочет купить двух средних быков. Откормив их 3-4 месяца, он может продать за очень хорошую цену. Ахмадали очень рад сотрудничеству с нами.
texts.en:
Ahmadali is 54 year old and is married with seven children. He has about 50 sheep and 30 goats. His wife is a homemaker but in her free time, she processes wool and knits warm clothing, which she sells to neighbors and relatives. Every morning Ahmadali take the cattle to the mountains, where they graze the whole day. Ahmadali has no cows but he is applying for a loan that would allow him to purchase two medium-sized bulls. After raising them for 3-4 months, he would be able to sell them at a good price. Ahmadali is happy to cooperate with us.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle farming

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 24 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Ali has been working as a mason since 2006. He requested a loan of US $500 from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his third loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his business, as well as his financiA. situation. Ali is speciA. in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, Ali didn’t have start up capitA.. In the future, he plans on expanding his work.

loans.use: To buy construction tools

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 34-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their six children. Youssef has owned a laundry since 2004. He requested a loan of US $1600 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is his fourth loan cycle and he has always paid on time.

His previous loan helped him improve his business, as well as his financial situation. Youssef is special in his work because he does it well and knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t have a lot of machines. He decided on doing his business because he bought the laundry form someone. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To buy tools for a laundry business

loans.name: Samir

texts.en:
Samir is a 25-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their child. Samer has owned a cleaning station since 2008. He requested a loan of US $1000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools and cleaning products for his work. This is the first time that Samer has requested a loan.

Samer is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulty. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: Tools and supplies for cleaning business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 38 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Ahmad has been working as a carpenter for twenty-three years. He requested a loan of US $2000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Ahmad has requested a loan.

Ahmad is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he didn’t face difficulty. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: Carpentry tools

loans.name: Adnan

texts.en:
Adnan is a 36 year old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Adnan has been selling aluminum. He also produces doors and windows. He requested a loan of US $2000 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase electrical tools for his work. This is the first time that Adnan has requested a loan.

Adnan is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building a network. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To buy power tools

loans.name: Bassem

texts.en:
Bassem is a 35-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife. Bassem has been working as a house painter. He also working as a home decorator. He requested a loan of US $500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase painting tools for his work and repair his car. This is the first time that Bassem has requested a loan.

Bassem is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building a network. Bassem decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his work and learning new decorating techniques.

loans.use: Painting tools and car repair

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 48-year-old man who lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife and their three children. Mahmoud has been working as a car painter. He requested a loan of US $1500 from Al Majmoua in order to purchase painting tools for his work. This is the first time that Mahmoud has requested a loan.

Mahmoud is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are his friends, neighbors and people from his region. When he first started his business, he had difficulty building a network. Mahmoud decided on doing his business because of his experience. In the future, he plans on improving his work and learning new decorating techniques.

loans.use: To purchase painting tools

loans.name: Hamad

texts.en:
Hamad is a 23 year old man who lives in Bekaa. Hamad has been working in agriculture for eight years. Hamad requested a loan of 600 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Hamad has requested a loan.

Hamad is special because he has experience. Hamad decided on doing his business because he wanted to improve his family’s income. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: Tools for agricultural work

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali has been working as a shaft digger for two years. Ali likes his work. He decided on this business to make use of his experience. He is a 33-year old man who lives in the Bekaa. Ali has requested a loan of $1500 US from Al Majmoua in order to purchase pipe and tools for his work. This is the first time that Ali has requested a loan. In the future, he plans on improving his business.

loans.use: To purchase pipe and tools for digging shafts

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia is a 30 year old woman who lives in the Bekaa with her husband and their two children. Alia has owned a fish shop for five years. She has requested a loan of 500 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her fish shop. This is the first time that Alia has requested a loan.

Alia is speciA. because she likes what she does. Alia decided on starting her business because she wanted to supplement her family’s income. In the future, she plans on expanding her business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her fish shop

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en: Herminia B., 40 years old, presently resides in Locuban Village, Dumalinao, Zambonaga Del Sur, where her sari-sari store is located. She has 2 sons with her first husband, but as their marriage is not working they are separated. She has a live-in partner now who supports their family needs. Since the income of her partner is not enough, she started engaging in a sari-sari store to help their daily needs. Herminia started her business with an initial capital of PHP 1,500 using a self rolling plan system. She applied for a loan worth PHP 5,000 (~USD 150) in Paglaum Coop as additional capital to purchase more inventory for her sari-sari store. Her business helps her family in their basic needs. She plans to purchase a videoke machine (video/karaoke) to attract more customers.

loans.use: addtional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: John

texts.en: John A. is single, has one child and has received schooling through senior high school. Since 2005, John has worked as a businessman in Elmina, doing jobs such as photocopying and typing. John uses his income to pay for his family’s bills and will use this loan to purchase new machines to expand and improve his business. With his newly gained profits, John plans to purchase additional items to aid in his future success and also to further expand his enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase business machines.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en: Mrs. Teresa P. is 32 years of age, married, and is a bona fide resident of Dipolog City. She is blessed with 3 children, all of whom are still studying. She has been an active member of Paglaum MPC for 3 years and already has had several loans that have financed her farming activities. She is busy with her banana plantation, corn, root crops, and vegetables. These crops are all in their yard, cultivated and managed both by Theresa and her husband. Now she has requested another loan from the Paglaum MPC intended for repair of their house to have comfortable shelter for the family. The loan shall be paid out from the yield income of their farm.

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials and labor to repair home.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 28 year old man who lives in the Bekaa. Ayman has been working as an agriculturalist since 2006. He owns a beekeeping business and also a tractor for working his field and cattle. Ayman requested a loan of 1500 U.S. dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase cattle. This is the first time that Ayman has requested a loan.

Ayman is special because he likes what he does. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started his business, he passed through some financial issues. Ayman decided on his business because he took after his father’s work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta O., a 55 yr old housewife, is married and mother to four children. She resides in Aloran, Mis Occ. Her business is hog raising. She has to applied to borrow from Paglaum MDC for additional capital for her business. With the loan, she plans to buy feed and supplements for the hogs. Her regular customers are her neighbors, relatives and friends. In the future she plans to buy a land for her piggery and she will renovate the family home someday.

loans.use: To buy hog feed and supplements.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a 34 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their five children. Salim has been working as a farmer.

Salim requested a loan of 1300 U.S. dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work. This is the first time that Salim has requested a loan.

Salim is speciA. because he has experience. His clients are people from his region. Salim decided on his business because he learned it since he was young. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en: Marianita L.,44 years old, is from La-o Santa Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 5 kids. The family works hard for a living. They are comfortable with their fish selling business. She seeks assistance from Paglaum Multi Purpose to finance her business.  Recently, she applied PHP 20,000.  She would like to maintain a record as a Member in Good Standing. She hopes to have her house repaired with savings from their fish selling livelihood.

loans.use: additional working capital for fish selling

location.town: Lao Sta. Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en: Ivan is married and has one child. He makes a living selling food at a small store in Nikopol city. His location is very good, and he serves many customers because he is willing to work late. Ivan has been in this business for 15 years, and knows a good deal about it. Ivan is also a very punctual and detail-oriented person, character traits that help him in his business. Ivan can always figure out how many supplies he needs so there is enough on hand to meet customer needs and it is always fresh. Ivan has applied for a loan to increase his inventory of items to sell. He will spend the additional income made possible by this loan to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to increase his supplies of items to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda S. is 46 years old and a member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has four children. She is very industrious, and runs a store where she sells food and household supplies while her husband is away working as a fisherman. Although her sales experience many ups and downs, business is doing well. 

Rosalinda believes this is a good time to expand her business, and is applying for this loan to buy new inventory to sell to her customers. Someday, she hopes to own a bigger store.

loans.use: To buy additional supplies such as canned goods, laundry and bath soap, shampoo, noodles, seasonings and beverages

location.town: Lao Sta. Cruz, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary N. is married, has three children and is a graduate of the local junior high school.  For the last 10 years, she has worked as a trader, selling maize at a heavily-trafficked area known as Shama Junction. She uses her income to help pay for her family’s expenses, mostly school fees. She has applied for a loan to buy maize to sell to her customers, and will use the increased income made possible by this loan to expand her business and support her children's education.

loans.use: To buy maize for resale

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en: Alexander is married and has one child. For the last 13 years, he has made a living running a grocery store that offers a large variety of foods. It's a great place to shop because customers can buy everything they need in one place. He also has good prices and a discounts that help him to attract new clients and retain existing ones. Alexander has applied for a loan to increase his inventory of items to sell. His goal is to continue to expand his business.

loans.use: to increase his supplies of items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane M. is 34 years old, married and has four children. She has been a member of the Paglaum MPC since 2005 and has already taken out and repaid several loans to expand her grocery store. She is applying for a new loan to expand her supply of items to sell. She will use this loan to buy additional inventory such as laundry soaps, seasonings, foods, toiletries and other household items. 

With her previous loans, Mary Jane demonstrated an outstanding loan repayment record. She aims to continue to build a successful business and send her children to college so that they have a good future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries and supplies to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Latipa

texts.en:
A 57-year-old member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative from Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Latipa S. industriously cares for her food-selling business. She is married to a farmer and they have six children, each of whom works for them as support. The business is doing well.

Latipa humbly taught her children how to enjoy the business and at the same time earn income from it. The ups and downs of the enterprise are nothing but a normal situation for her, with losses sometimes occurring and good returns accruing at other times. Lapita now sees a good opportunity to expand their business and is therefore requesting a loan of PHP 7,000 from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative to add to her working capital. She deeply hopes her children will achieve good educations so they will eventually have businesses of their own.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of meats, spices, etc.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.en: Esteban S. and his family live in Looc Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Esteban is fifty-eight years old and a widower with three children. He keeps himself busy with his pig-raising business, which helps him to withstand the highs and lows of everyday living. He is asking for $325 to buy additional piglets and animal feed. He deeply wishes for his business to survive and to simply live happily with his children around him.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets and feed.

loans.name: Syrena

texts.en:
