Syrena is married. She owns a retail business and sells souvenirs, gift sets and artificial flowers at the market in Beregovo. She has been in this business for five years. Her working capital is $1950 and her monthly profit is $325.

Syrena loves her business. She chooses her inventories personally and enjoys selling them. Syrena has a very open and kind personality that helps her sales. The large assortment helps her sales as well. 

Syrena would like to borrow $1025. She is going to increase the assortment of her inventories to attract more clients. In this way she can make more money to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: To increase inventory assortment.

loans.name: Casiana

texts.en: Casiana D. is fifty-seven years old and a hard-working mother with two children. She lives at Looc Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Casiana started her business by putting up a very small amount of capital, with neighbors as her potential customers. Casiana is looking forward to expanding her snack-vending business which will enable her to produce greater profits. She needs $425 in additional capital in order to buy all the ingredients needed to make and market her goods. Casiana believes that through her business, she will be able to raise her children well and to ensure their education.

loans.use: To buy needed ingredients.

loans.name: Bushenyi Tuhumurizane Group

texts.en: M. Naume is a very determined lady with a dream to achieve more in life. She is thirty-six years old and married with three children, aged six, ten and seventeen. All are in school with only the eldest in secondary school, while the others are in the primary section. Naume also helps to care for an orphan with responsibility for the child’s general upkeep. She has a grocery business which she started in 1998. From that time until 2002 she was sharing the stall premises with a friend, until she became independent. Some of the goods she sells at her stall are green bananas used for making local dishes, tomatoes, greens and other fresh produce. Although Naume is succeeding with her business, she is usually faced with a few challenges: she has to search for good produce from village to village; she needs to be aware of the variation in demand for her produce; she has to shop at night for produce because it has to be displayed in her stall very early for her customers. Naume is grateful that her stall is strategically positioned in Bushenyi main market because as a result, she is able to generate a weekly profit of $56. Her success also comes from the fact that she sells good quality produce. The loans have helped her always to have enough stock for her customers and still supply good quality. Naume needs a loan to help with introducing the sale of chicken and millet to her current business.

loans.use: To buy chicken and millet for business expansion.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita V. is a member in good standing from Katipa, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.  She is sixty-one years old and has eight children.  She is currently engaged in a fish-vending business and had only $10 for her start up capital.  Amazingly, she manages her business well. Teresita would like Paglaum, one of Kiva's field partners, to finance her needed capital.  She applied for a loan of $425 to buy more fish to sell and to help with the maintenance of her fishing boat. She wants to save for her old age and to live simply with her children around her.

loans.use: To buy more fish and to maintain her boat.

loans.name: Madeo Mawussi

texts.fr: E. est une femme mariée  et a trois enfants. Pour aider  son époux dans les charges du foyer elle a entamé la vente des articles de friperie en 2007, elle a aussi ouvert une cabine téléphonique dans sa boutique. ce commerce marche bien et elle a une manière très impressionnante d’attirer la clientèle. Le stock de marchandises dont elle dispose actuellement ne lui permet pas de faire face à la demande de ses clients. elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 05 balles de chemises, 05 balles de jupes, 03 balles de veste.
texts.en:
Mrs. E. is a married woman with 3 children. In order to help her spouse cover household expenses, she began selling used clothing in 2007. She also opened a phone booth in her little shop. This business is doing well and she has a very impressive manner of attracting clientele. Her present stock of merchandise does not allow her to respond to the demand of her customers, so she is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy 5 bales of shirts, 5 bales of skirts, and 3 bales of sweaters.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of bales of used clothing for re-sale

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
casado y tiene 3 hijos.

se dedica a la "albañileria"

cuando termino sus estudios, empezo como ayudante y tiempo despues, con lo que aprendio comenzo por su propia cuenta.

Es muy conocido por su vecindario y a tendio mucho trabajo, el detalle es que cuenta con muy poca herramienta y material, como palas, madera.

solicita el apoyo, para la compra de estos materiales para trabajar mas comodo, ya que, con lo que con lo que cuenta es prestado.

Apoyemos grandes personas como el, que necesitan de grandes personas que lo apoyen.
texts.en:
José is married and has 3 children. He is a brick layer. When he finished his studies, he started as a helper. With what he had learned, he was later able to start on his own. He is very well known in the neighborhood, and he has had a lot of work. The problem is that he has very few tools and materials like shovels and wood. He is asking for support to buy these materials and make his work easier. The tools he works with now are borrowed. We (Admic Nacional) support great people like José who need great people (like Kiva lenders) to support them.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material

loans.name: Eley Yamileth

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León la señora Eley M. se dedica arduamente a trabajar para lograr su sueño de reconstruir su vivienda el cual a raíz de los años se ha venido deteriorando y hoy en día necesita reconstrucción.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y así continuar con el mantenimiento de su vivienda y el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
In the Telica municipality, in León City, Mrs. Eley M. is working arduously to achieve her dream of reconstructing her home. With the passage of time her house has deteriorated. Now, it needs reconstruction. She is aking Ceprodel for a loan to buy construction materials. This way she can continue with her home maintenance and impact her family’s well being.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Mrs. Lanie B., 58, lives in Villaflor, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occiedental where she and her husband, a farmer, have two children. In order to help her husband while at home, she decided to raise pigs for an additional source of income. She also buys and sells goods such as root crops, vegetables and anything else just to earn a living.

Lanie became a micro entrepreneur because of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. This co-op teaches women how to develop their own businesses to support their spouses’ incomes. She has thus far been able to obtain several loans and now is requesting Php 20,000 to buy feed and piglets. Her husband is very supportive of her endeavours.

loans.use: To buy piglets & feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy handicrafts

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Mrs. Alejandra L. is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 29 years old and married with two children, ages 9 and 11 months. Her husband is a driver/mechanic. The compensation of her husband is not enough, especially as the children grow older.

Recently, she applied for a PHP 6,000 loan for additional working capital for her palay/rice trading business. She relates that a friend told her about Paglaum MPC giving financial assistance to those who need it. She became a member and applied for a loan for additional funds. As of now, she helps in one way or another in the augmentation of their household income. Hard work, patience and determination are the only things they have, believing then that they can send their children to college to finish a degree and have a decent life in the future.

loans.use: Additional capital for palay trading

loans.name: Adjoho

texts.fr: Cette femme est une boulangère, elle exerce cette activité  depuis 1994. Le stock de farine de blé et  d’autres matières nécessaires à la fabrication de pain étant épuisé, elle sollicite son troisième crédit pour acheter des  farines de blé, des sucres, des beurres et divers. Elle a déjà obtenu deux crédits de WAGES qu’elle a remboursé. Elle est mariée et a 04 enfants, avec ce qu’elle  gagne de son commerce elle aide son mari dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en:
This lady is a baker, a business she has been in since 1994. Her stocks of flour and other necessary ingredients for making bread being expended, she is requesting her third loan to buy wheat flour, sugar, butter, etc. She has already had two loans from WAGES and has reimbursed them. She is married and has 4 children; the income from her business allows her to help her husband support the family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of flour, sugar, butter, etc.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
soltera, tiene 2 hijos.

Se dedica a la venta de calzado, por catalogo.

como madre soltera en la busqueda de mayores ingresos comenzo con las ventas, gracias a una invitacion que le hicieron, empezo a ver que le dejaba ganacia, ya tiene sus clientes, los cuales le solicitan , ciertos modelos de zapato y necesita comprarlos en la distribuidora y asi poder ella venderlos.

ha salido adelante, como madre y padre que es en su hogar, apoyemos este caso, no paremos sus ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Soltera has 2 children. As a single mother who is trying to increase her income, she sells footwear by catalogue. She got into sales because of an invitation she received and she began to see that she was making money. She now has clients who place orders for different types of shoes that she buys from a distributor and then sells. She has been doing well. Since she is both mother and father in this home, we support her case. We will not stand in the way of her desire to get ahead

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy T., 28, lives with her husband, a carpenter, and their four children in Panaon, Mis Occ.  Life is hard for the family as her husband's income cannot meet the family's needs, so Nancy is venturing into hog-raising and is requesting a loan from Paglaum as  start up capital.  With it she will buy two pigs and some seedlings for her vegetable garden. She hopes her business will be successful.

loans.use: To buy two pigs and some seedlings.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Since 2000, Mary K. has worked as a petty trader who produces and sells gari (a flour made of cassava roots) at Shama Junction. She is married with four children and received an education through junior high school. Her husband vulcanizes car tires for work. She is responsible for supporting her family with housekeeping money.  Her loan will be used to purchase additional cassava for gari production and she hopes to use the new profits from her business to support her children’s secondary education.

loans.use: To purchase additional cassava for gari production

loans.name: Aurora Elena

texts.es:
La señora Aurora C. se dedica a laborar arduamente en su comunidad atendiendo su propia pulpería en Telica de la ciudad de León.

Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que en todo momento ha buscado la manera de cómo mantener suplida su pulpería. Hoy en día espera confiadamente en que Ceprodel le brindará un crédito para la compra de los productos y así saldrá adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aurora C. works arduously tending her own store in Telica in the the city of León. She is a very hard worker who has constantly looked for the way to keep her store supplied. Now she is confidently hoping that Ceprodel will give her a loan to buy products and get ahead in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is single. She lives in Melitopol and sells jewelry in one of the local markets. She offers a wide variety of merchandise for sale in her vending location. Marina developed her business with the assistance of her parents and Nadiya Ukraine financial services, one of Kiva's field partners. Her trade has grown a lot in the past four years. Presently, her gross income is $1275 Hryvnia. Monthly profit is about $520. 

Marina lives with her parents in a three-room apartment. Her fellow market vendors characterize her as an enterprising, sociable and hard-working person. Marina is seeking a loan of $1275 to increase the assortment of inventory she offers for retail sale. She is hoping to continue developing her trade in the future and to see it flourish even more.

loans.use: To increase assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Pernalin

texts.en: Pernalin M. is fifty-five years old and married with six children. She lives in Goleo, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She started her fishing venture in 2004. Her husband plays a big role in the business by operating one of the boats. Most of their income is derived from their fishing business. So far they are doing well, and they are planning to purchase another fishing boat. Pernalin is very optimistic that they can raise more income to support the family when she is granted the loan.

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat.

loans.name: María Catalina

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León la señora María J. se dedica a su negocio de pulpería que posee en su propia casa de habitación que a pesar que no presta las condiciones necesarias para el negocio ella busca la manera de cómo desarrollarse.

Actualmente la señora María ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los productos de la pulpería y de esta manera continuar con su negocio que tanto requiere de inversión inmediata.
texts.en:
In Telica, an area of Leon city, Señora María J. runs a business out of her home selling natural juices. It is difficult, because her home is not ideally suited to running a business, but Maria manages well enough. Currently, Maria is asking for a loan so that she can buy juicing equipment - her business badly needs an investment.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy equipment

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina has a fourteen-year-old daughter. She is an entrepreneur from Kamenka where she sells groceries in the local city market. Irina owns two vending facilities in good, busy locations. Ever since she assumed charge of this venture from her parents she has seen considerable growth of her trade. Currently, her business has grown up to the point where she has about 70,000 Hryvnia in inventory. Her income amounts to 7,000 Hryvnia a month. 

Irina is seeking a loan to purchase additional fresh merchandise and increase her stock. Moreover, she is planning to buy two refrigerated displays to store additional food inventory and keep it fresh. Irina has proved to be an entrepreneur of integrity and determination. She has promptly repaid eight previous loans without any delinquencies. Irina is hoping to generate additional income and be able to finish remodeling her apartment which turned out to be quite a costly endeavor.

loans.use: To buy refrigerated displays.

loans.name: Wenna

texts.en: Wenna C. is forty-six years old, married, and lives at San Vicente Alto, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She has two children. Her husband is a security guard. In order to help her husband from home, she decided to raise pigs for an additional source of income. Wenna also ventures into poultry raising or anything just to earn a living. She became a micro-entrepreneur because of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative, one of Kiva's field partners. This coop teaches women to have their own livelihood project to support their husband’s income. She has been granted loans several times. Now, she is applying for $325 to buy feed for her pigs and chickens. She also wants to purchase a franchise for using their motorcycle for hire. Everything is easy for her because she’s happy with what she’s doing and her husband is very supportive of her.

loans.use: To buy feed for pigs and chickens and a franchise for motorcycle

loans.name: Adriana Berenice

texts.es:
Casada, tiene 1 hijo de 9 meses.

Tiene 4 años con su negocio, ella empezo , cuando su tia se enfermo y la dejo a cargo de el y de sacarlo adelante. 

Tiene mucha varidad de productos, como aqui le llamamos se es tienda de abarrotes.

Ella quiere comprar un refrigerador, para la verdura ya que con las altas temperaturas que se sienten por su cuidad, provoca que la verdura se eche a perder.

Todo para ofrecer un mejor servicio.

Apoyemos, sus ganas de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Casada has a 9-month-old son. She has been in business for 4 years. She began when her aunt got sick and left her in charge of the store and its progress. She has a wide variety of products. In these parts, we call this type of store a grocery store. She wants to buy a refrigerator for the vegetables because the temperatures are very high in this city and cause the vegetables to go bad. We do all we can do to provide the best service. We support her desire to get ahead

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Ana Q. ha iniciado la labora de reconstrucción de su vivienda que por mucho tiempo había permanecido en mal estado y lo ha hecho con el propósito de mantener a su familia compuesta por sus dos hijos en edad escolar. 

Ella tiene la necesidad de adquirir a lo inmediato el dinero para la compra de los materiales de construcción y es por esta razón que espera confiadamente en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con dicho crédito y así saldrá adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Q. has begun the job of rebuilding her home. It has been in bad shape for a long time. She has done it for the purpose of supporting her family which is made up of two school-aged children.

She needs to get the money immediately to purchase the building materials. This is the reason she confidently puts her hopes in Ceprodel to benefit from this loan and therefore get ahead in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en: Leonisa C. is fifty-eight years old and lives in Navalan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur.  Her husband, Jesus C., works on the farm, but the income from their farm is not enough for their daily needs.  She started a sari-sari store so that she can generate income to help provide for their daily needs.  She realizes how helpful the profits generated from the sari-sari store are.  She decided to apply to one of Kiva's field partners, Paglaum Coop, for a loan of 10,000 PHP. This is her second loan cycle, payable in six months, and is for purchasing more stock requested by her customers.  Because of the progress of her sari-sari she plans to renovate the store and add a video player to attract more customers.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Mrs. Lucita E. is 56 years old, and a very hardworking and business-minded member of the Paglaum co-op. She is happily married with 3 children and resides at Katipunan, Zamboanga del Norte. Her husband is a farmer.  The couple started selling vegetables and fruits in 1993, which provided for their everyday needs. In order to expand her small business, Mrs. E. turned to Paglaum, where she has been an active member for 3 years. She has used its loan program 7 times.

     Mrs. E. is seeking a loan of  8,000 PHP to buy additional fruit and vegetables to sell. She aspires to have a fruit stand in the future.

loans.use: additional capital for buying and selling fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Candida M. es una dama muy trabajadora por la razón de que a diario comercializa los productos de artesanía como lo son las alcancías vendidas en su localidad en el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León. 

Hoy en día espera ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de las artesanías y así continuar ofreciéndolas y mantener su núcleo familiar que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Candida M. is a very hard-working woman. She sells craft products daily, like the piggy banks sold in her area, in the Telica municipality of the city of León.

Nowadays she hopes to benefit from a loan to purchase the crafts. This way she can continue to sell them and support her immediate family which really needs her support.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of crafts

loans.name: Maria Imelda

texts.es:
Casada y tiene 2 hijas que la apoyan en el negocio.

se dedica a la venta de " antojitos mexicanos". ella vendia solo los sabados y domingos y ahora y como le ha hido muy bien , tambien abre los lunes y miercoles.

Comenzo como ayudante en un negocio de comidas y observo que dejaba bunas ganancias y decidio poner su propio negocio.

es muy conocida en su localidad y tiene muchos clientes.

Ella quiere comprar mesas y sillas, para brindar un mejor servicio. Apoyemos esta compra.

Apoyemos este caso tan prometedor, casos de exito como este comenzaron de cero.
texts.en:
She is married and has two daughters that help her in the business.

She works selling Mexican snacks. She used to only sell on Saturdays and Sundays but since it has gone very well, now she also opens on Mondays and Wednesdays.

She began as helper in a food business. She saw that it earned a good profit and decided to start her own business.

She is very well known in her area and she has many customers.

She wants to buy tables and chairs to provide better service. Let’s support this purchase.

Let’s support this very promising case. Successful cases like these began from zero.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tables

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Mrs. Valentina Zaporojean, originally from the city of Chisinau, has worked as a trader in Central Square since 2006. She lives with her husband, a police officer, and their two-year-old daughter in the town of Riscani.

Valentina previously received a loan from Microinvest in order to launch her business selling soft toys, frills and hair accessories, the latter being especially popular. Because her goods are purchased wholesale from Ukraine and Chisinau, transportation costs are substantial. Valentina is now requesting a loan to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.use: To increase working capital.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Mrs. Jovita B., who resides in Lagag, Sindangan, Zamboanga Del Norte, is married with 3 children. Her main source of income is a sari-sari store, or small convenience shop. She started her business with a small amount of capital, and it is currently supported with the help of her husband, who is a farmer.

Her business caters to the basic needs of her neighbors.  She is applying for a loan of Php 5,000.00 in additional capital for her sari-sari store. Her plans are to improve the business and to improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: Additional capital for sari-sari store

loans.name: Cruz Delia

texts.es:
La señora Cruz L. se siente muy satisfecha de haber iniciado a reconstruir su casa de habitación ya que estaba en malas condiciones y al haber iniciado ha ido por procesos y hoy en día requiere poner un techo nuevo antes de que el invierno entre y caigan las lluvias.

Por este motivo es que la señora Cruz ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y así salir adelanten en el desarrollo de su familia que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Ms. Cruz L. is very happy to have again started rebuilding her home that has been in bad shape. They have been doing it in bits and now need a new roof before winter comes and the rains start to fall. This is why Ms. Cruz has come to Ceprodel to ask for a loan. She wants to buy construction materials and continue helping her family, who she loves so much, to advance.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materiales de construcción

loans.name: Diélika

texts.fr:
Diélika T.  a 47 ans, mariée et  mère d’un garçon. Elle réside avec son époux, sa coépouse et leurs enfants à Sanoubougou I (Kapel Kourou), un des  quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école, elle s’est initiée à l’activité d’achat et de  vente des légumes et tubercules (pomme de terre et igname) il y a plus de dix  ans. Elle mène son activité au niveau du marché des fruits et  légumes au pied de la colline Mamelon non loin du grand marché de Sikasso.
 Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant sept ans. Après plusieurs prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son 6ème prêt individuel et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 30 sacs de pomme de terre et 15 sacs d’igname. Elle achète ses marchandises en gros sur place auprès des  agriculteurs venant à la foire,  avant de les revendre en détail aux  non résidents  et aux forains.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 250 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Diélika T., age 47, is married and the mother of a boy. She resides with her husband, co-wife, and their children in Sanoubougou I (Kapel Kourou), an outlying district of Sikasso City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having had the chance to continue in school, she got introduced to the business of buying and selling vegetables and tubers (potatoes and yams) over ten years ago. She operates at the produce market located at the foot of Mamelon hill, not far from the grand market of Sikasso.

Concerned about doing better in satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso seven years ago. After several solidarity loans (group loans) with a women's association in her area, she is now on her sixth individual loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid.

She intends to use this loan to buy thirty sacks of potatoes and fifteen sacks of yams. She purchases her merchandise wholesale locally from growers coming to the fair. And then she resells it retail to non-residents and to fair vendors.

With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 250,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to augment her working capital, to help cover family expenses, to make loan interest payments, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tubers (potatoes, yams)

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia G. is 34 years old and lives in Navalan, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur.  With the assistance of her husband and mother, she makes bibingka (also known as bingka),  a famous Filipino delicacy made of ground rice.  These bingka are made of flour, sugar, coconut milk, baking powder and banana leaves.  

The family sells these bibingka on market day in the nearest town.  Mrs. G. needs more capital for the bibingka to fill her customers' orders.  She is seeking a loan of P 10,000.00 payable in 6 months.  She plans to renovate her snack store, which is located near a school in Pagadian City.  She plans to purchase an electric oven for the business.

loans.use: Renovate store, purchase electric oven

loans.name: Nicacio

texts.es:
El señor Nicacio M. se dedica a laborar fuertemente en el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de vivienda que posee debido a que en la comunidad donde vive no se cuenta con energía eléctrica y para esto ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de panel solar para su casa.

Al haber adquirido el panel requiere proceder al pago de este y es por esto que ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para que se le brinde un crédito para el pago del panel y de esta manera comenzar a utilizarlo satisfactoriamente.
texts.en:
Mr. Nicacio Martinez works hard in the municipality of Telica outside the city of Leon to improve the conditions of his house. Because of the fact that in the community where he lives there is no electricity, he has requested a loan from Ceprodel for the purchase of a solar panel for his home. Upon acquiring the panel, he needs to remit payment for it and therefore he has sought the support of Ceprodel to provide a loan for payment of the panel and thus begin to use it successfully.

Translated from Spanish by Kerrie Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a solar panel

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Alberto M. atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en su vivienda en el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León. La inversión que requiere hacer es de una compra de un panel solar porque en su comunidad no poseen energía eléctrica y para ello le urge la implementación de dicho panel. 

Ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para el pago del panel a lo inmediato y así iniciar a utilizarlo y a la vez garantizar que sus pequeños hijos logren estudiar por las noches por medio de las lámparas eléctricas que el panel permite conectar.
texts.en:
Alberto M. needs to invest in his house, which is in the Telica municipality in the city of León. The investment he requires is to buy a solar panel because his community does not have electricity. That is why he wants to install the solar panel. He has gone to Ceprodel to receive a loan to buy the panel immediately. That way they can start using it and guarantee that his small children can study at night. They can use the light of the electric lamps that the panel allows them to connect.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for solar panel

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Abdoulaye  Berthé a 40 ans, marié et père de cinq enfants dont 3 garçons et 2 filles. Il réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants au quartier Médine de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  Berthé  est un mécanicien de profession et travaille au garage de Compagnie Malienne de Développement Textile (C.M.D.T.) de Sikasso. En plus de cette activité, il mène  des activités d’embouche, de commercialisation de bétails et d’aviculture il y a environ six an. 
Dans le souci de mieux  satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante tout en augmentant son fonds de roulement  et  aménager son lieu d’embouche, il décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso.  Il est à son premier prêt individuel 
Il compte acheter du bétail dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso (Lobougoula, Kadiolo, Bougouni, etc.).. Il revend ses animaux et dérivés au marché à bétail et à la maison à une clientèle riche et variée. 
Monsieur Berthé gagne beaucoup en laiterie grâce à ses vaches de meilleure qualité.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye Berthé, age 40, is married and the father of five children (3 boys and 2 girls). He resides with his wife and their children in the Médine district of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He is a mechanic by trade and works at the garage of the Compagnie Malienne de Développement Textile (C.M.D.T.) de Sikasso. In addition to this work, he has had a business for about six years involving animal feed, marketing livestock, and poultry farming.

Concerned about doing better in satisfying his burgeoning customer base while augmenting his working capital and fixing up his place for fattening livestock, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. He is on his first individual loan. He intends to buy livestock in towns surrounding Sikasso (Lobougoula, Kadiolo, Bougouni, etc.) He resells his animals and resulting products at the livestock marketplace and at the house to a rich and varied clientele.

Mr. Berthé earns a lot from his dairy business, thanks to his better quality cows. With this loan, he envisions realizing a monthly profit of 300,000 francs CFA that will be used to augment his working capital, to help cover family expenses, to make loan interest payments, and to invest the rest in his work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis O. is married with four children and received an education through senior high school. Since 2008, Francis has worked as a trader selling foodstuffs and soft drinks at Aburanse in Elmina. His wife also works as a trader in the same area. Francis uses his income to pay for his family’s school fees and bills.

He will use the loan to purchase additional crates of soft drinks and other provisions for resale. With the new profits from his expanded business, Francis plans to save and further his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase additional crates of soft drinks and other provisions for resale

loans.name: Koura

texts.fr:
Koura Berthé a 62 ans, veuve et mère de 3 enfants (1 garçon et 2 filles), elle vit avec ses enfants dans la maison de son défunt époux à Médine, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso.
N’ayant pas été à l’école pour des raisons sociales, et après avoir mener plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle décida d’opter pour l’activité de vente de galette à base de farine de blé, il y a maintenant vingt  ans. L’insuffisance des ressources financières à bien mener cette activité constitue l’objet et la justification de sa demande de prêt  à Soro Yiriwaso.
Elle est en relation avec l’institution Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ quatre ans. Après deux ans en prêt solidaire (prêt du groupe), elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel et  tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter, 6 sacs de farine de blé, 2 sacs du sel, 6 bidons d’huile alimentaire et 2 sacs de sucre sur place. Elle vend ses galettes au grand marché de Sikasso et sa clientèle est composée des femmes et surtout des foraines. 
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour résoudre l’essentielle des dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Koura Berthé, age 62, is a widow and the mother of three children (1 boy and 2 girls). She lives with her children in her late husband's house in Médine, a working-class district in Sikasso City. Not have attended school for societal reasons, and after done several kinds of work unsuccessfully, she decided twenty years ago to opt for a business selling galettes made of wheat flour.

Lacking the financial resources for managing this business properly sums up the goal and justification for her loan request at the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso. She has had an association with Soro Yiriwaso for about four years. After two years in a solidarity loan (group loan), she is on her second individual loan. All the preceding loans were correctly repaid.

With this loan, she intends to buy six sacks of wheat flour, two sacks of salt, six drums of cooking oil, and two sacks of sugar, locally. She sells galettes at the grand marketplace of Sikasso, and her customers are composed of women and especially fair vendors. She envisions realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used to resolve most of the family expenses, to make loan interest payments, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, salt, and peanut oil

loans.name: Madougou

texts.fr:
Madougou Sangaré est une veuve de 62 ans qui réside avec sa coépouse et leurs enfants chez leur défunt époux  à Mancourani II, le centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle  s’initia aux activités de petit commerce, d’achat-vente des pagnes wax et des tissus brodés il y a plus de trente ans. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée surtout de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement des femmes) pour la qualité de ses produits. Elle reçoit beaucoup de commandes des localités environnantes.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ sept  ans. Après plusieurs prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, il est a son huitième prêt individuel et tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 37 complets de tissus brodés et 23 pièces de pagnes wax. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako ensuite elle les revend de façon ambulante à Sikasso et souvent dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Madougou Sangaré is a widow of 62 who lives with her co-spouse and their children in the house of their late husband in Mancourani II, in downtown Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

Not having had a chance to go to school for socio-economic reasons, she began petty trading, buying and selling lengths of high-quality colorful African cloth and embroidered fabrics, 30 years ago. She is much in demand with a clientele (composed essentially of women) drawn by the high quality of her merchandise. She gets lots of orders from the surrounding areas.

With the desire to better satisfy her ever growing clientele, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about 7 years ago. After several solidarity loans (group loans) with an association of women from her neighborhood, she is on her 8th individual loan and all her preceding loans were correctly reimbursed.

With this loan she intends to buy 37 outfits made of embroidered cloth and 23 lengths of high quality (wax) African print cloth. She does her buying in Bamako and then sells her merchandise door-to-door in Sikasso and frequently in the localities surrounding Sikasso. She expects to make, with this loan, a monthly profit of 150,000 F CFA which will be used essentially to grow her working capital, contribute to family expenses, pay the interest on her loan, and invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of African print cloth and embroidered fabrics

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
KARINA D. E., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las innovadoras II” vive en el Jr Englinton Mz.A:Lt.13  Yarinacocha, tiene 35 años de edad, 2 hijos, y su pareja es contador.

Recibió un primer préstamo de S/ 300.00, con este dinero inició su negocio de servicio de alquiler de cuartos para viviendal.

Gracias a este negocio ha sabido progresar junto a su familia y el negocio ha mejorado, tanto que ahora necesita hacer una ampliación del local.

Con este préstamo de S/.3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, que invertirá en la ampliación de su local, comprará materiales y pagará la mano de obra.

“Manuela Ramos me permitió tener mi propia casa y a su vez tener la oportunidad de alquilar algunos cuartos para aumentar mis ingresos, todos los ambientes son de madera que la región produce y son muy frescos y los clientes se sienten cómodos”. Gracias Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Karina D. E. belongs to the “Las Innovadoras II” (“Innovative Women II”) Communal Bank. She lives on Englinton Street in Yarinacocha. She is 35 years old, has 2 children, and her husband works as an accountant. She used her first loan of 300 soles to start her business of renting out rooms to tenants. Thanks to her business she knows how to get ahead in life with her family. Her business has improved, so much so that she now needs to enlarge her premises. Karina will use the current loan of 3,000 soles to invest in enlarging her premises, purchasing materials, and paying for labor. “[Kiva partner] Manuela Ramos made it possible for me to have my own home and gave me the opportunity to increase my income by renting out rooms. All of the rooms are made of wood that comes from the region. The rooms stay cool and the tenants are comfortable.” Thank you, Manuela Ramos!

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing materials for enlarging her commercial premises.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El señor Pablo A. vive en una comunidad de Telica en León y por mucho tiempo ha atravesado la problemática de que no posee energía eléctrica y para ello ha adquirido un panel solar para así sacarle el máximo provecho para alumbrarse y tener iluminación para hacer los quehaceres del hogar. 

Es por este motivo que el señor Pablo espera muy confiadamente en que Ceprodel le brindará el apoyo por medio de los créditos para el pago del panel solar y de esta forma iniciar con la utilización del panel para beneficio propio y de su familia.
texts.en:
Pablo A. lives in the Telica community of León. For a long time they have dealt with the problem of not having electricity. Because of this problem, he got a solar panel. He wants to take maximum advantage of the panel to illuminate the house and be able to do work around the house. For that reason, Pablo confidently hopes that Ceprodel will offer support via a loan to pay for the solar panel. Then he can start using the panel to benefit himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for solar panel

loans.name: Amy

texts.fr: Cette femme est  une femme qui est divorcé de son mari, elle a 01 enfant. L’activité qu’elle exerce et qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à celles de ses enfants est le commerce des produits pharmaceutiques et de produits cosmétiques, elle fait son activité dans sa propre boutique qu’elle a appelé « ETS LA GRACE ». Une partie de son stock est épuisé,  elle veut renouveler ce stock et sollicite de WAGES son deuxième crédit pour acheter des produits pharmaceutiques et des produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
This is a divorced woman who has one child. Her business, which enables her to provide for herself and for her child, consists in selling pharmaceutical products and cosmetics. She has her own shop, that she called "ETS LA GRACE". Some parts of her stock have run out, and to resupply, she's seeking her second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy pharmaceutical products and cosmetics.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell pharmaceutical products and cosmetics

loans.name: Leovina

texts.es:
LEOVINA R. I., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES PRODUCTIVAS” vive en el Jr Walter Mz.B Lt.34, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 31 años de edad y 1 hijo.

Se inició en el negocio de venta pescado y plátanos, con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles compró plátanos para vender, cuenta con clientes frecuentes y su negocio ha ido creciendo.

En la actualidad continua con la venta de Plátanos en su zona dado que no hay muchas bodegas por ese sector.  Con  este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará más pescado y racimos de plátanos.

“Cuando uno quiere salir adelante lo puede hacer, es cuestión de ganas y de aprovechar oportunidades, es lo que aprendí de Manuela Ramos que me  enseñaron en un taller que asistí y ahora puedo vender y así costear los gastos de mi hijo.
texts.en:
Leonina R. I. belongs to the “Mujeres Productivas” community bank. She lives at Jr. Walter Mz.B Lt.34 in the city of Pucallpa. She is 31 and has a son. She started her business selling fish and bananas. With her first loan of 300 PEN she bought bananas to sell. She can count on frequent customers, and her business has been growing. She continues selling bananas in her zone because there are not many stores in her area. With this loan for 1,500 PEN she will buy more fish and bunches of bananas. “When one wants to get ahead, you can do it. It is a question of desire and taking advantage of opportunities. This is what I learned from Manuela Ramos who taught me in a workshop that I attended. Now I can sell and that way pay for my son’s expenses."

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fish and bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Daniel R. es padre de tres hijos a los que tiene que mantener y brindarle todas las condiciones para que ellos se desarrollen.

La problemática que atraviesa en su vivienda es que en su localidad no hay acceso a la energía eléctrica y por esto muy confiadamente ha adquirido un panel solar para beneficio propio y de su familia. Al haber adquirido el panel requiere pagar esta deuda a lo inmediato y por este motivo ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito que le permita cubrir esta deuda y así seguir adelante manteniendo su hogar y sus hijos.
texts.en:
Daniel R. is the father of three children who he supports, providing the conditions needed for good child development. A problem he came across in his residence is that in their town there isn't access to electricity and for this reason he has trustingly purchased a solar panel for the benefit of himself and his family. Upon having bought the panel he needed to pay the debt immediately, which motivated him to go to Ceprodel to request a loan that will allow him to cover his debt while supporting his home and his children.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Solar panel payment

loans.name: Horacio

texts.es:
A sus 71 años de edad, el señor Horacio R. está comprometido con el bienestar de su familia y para ello busca la manera de cómo solucionar la problemática de ausencia de energía eléctrica en su localidad en el municipio de Telica en León.

Para ello ha adquirido un panel solar para iluminar su vivienda y así poder realizar sus quehaceres y llevar a cabo su trabajo. Para pagar el panel, el señor R. ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito y una vez pagado iniciar con su uso para beneficio propio y de su familia.
texts.en:
At 71 years of age, Horacio R. is committed to the well-being of his family. For this reason, he seeks a way to solve the problematic absence of electrical power in his locality in the Telica munipality of León. To help with this issue, he has acquired a solar panel to light his home so he can do his chores and finish his work. To pay for the panel, Mr. R. has turned to Ceprodel to request credit. Once paid for, he would start using the panel for himself as well for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for a solar panel.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
NINFA R. C. pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS MARGARITAS” vive en el Jr pachitea nº 785. del distrito de Calleria, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 57 años de edad y su pareja es ganadero

Se inició en el negocio de venta de comida y gaseosas, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles compró gaseosas y golosinas.

Actualmente se dedica a al venta de productos de la Región, tiene la oportunidad de ir a las chacras y trae los diferentes productos para venderlos a sus vecinos.  Con este préstamo de S/. 2,200.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará más productos como frutas para abastecer su negocio.  También hará arreglos del local.

“Muchas veces tenemos oportunidades pero no sabemos aprovecharlas, sin embargo Manuela Ramos nos da la oportunidad de obtener créditos para aumentar nuestro capital y así contar con mas ingreso en la casa”.
texts.en:
NINFA R. C. belongs to the “LAS MARGARITAS” cooperative bank. She lives in the Calleria district of the city of Pucallpa, is 57 years old, and her partner is a rancher. She started in the business of selling food and soft drinks with her first loan of 300.00 soles, which she used to buy sodas and sweets/snacks. Currently, she dedicates herself to selling regional products. She has the opportunity to go to the farms and bring back different products to sell to her neighbors. With this loan of 2,200.00 soles she will buy more product, such as fruit, with which to supply her business. “Many times we have opportunities, but don’t know how to take advantage of them. Regardless, Manuela Ramos gives us a chance to obtain loans to augment our capital allowing us to increase the income we bring to our households.”

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy regional food products (fruits).

loans.name: Olimpia Venesuela

texts.es: Doña Olimpia es originaria del departamento de Totonicapan conocido como tierra de las manzanas actualmente ella se dedica a la venta y compra  de ropa tipica abulante que visitas las ares rurales del departamento ofrenciendo su producto especialmente para damas. Con ese negocio que lo viene realizando desde hace mas de 25 años a fortalecido a su familia en darles un nivel de vida adecuada con todas la necesidades basicas hoy necesita un credito para incrementar su negocio con el objetivo de visitar otros municipios del departamento de Totonicapán
texts.en:
Olimpia is from the Totonicapán area, known as the land of apples. She currently dedicates herself to the sale and purchase of traditional clothing by visiting the rural areas offering her products, especially for women. With this business, which she has been carrying out for more than 25 years, she has strengthened her family and given them an adequate standard of living that includes all of the basic necessities. Today, she needs a loan to grow her business with the objective of visiting other municipalities of the Totonicapán department.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital.

loans.name: Indalecio

texts.es:
El señor Indalecio A. se dedica a trabajar arduamente con el fin de llevar a cabo el mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que desde hace mucho tiempo no tiene acceso a la energía eléctrica y para ello ha adquirido un panel solar para llevar a cabo sus quehaceres del hogar.

Es por este motivo que él espera ser beneficiado con un crédito en Ceprodel para el pago del panel solar y así iniciar en su respectivo uso para mejorar la condición de su vivienda y así beneficiar a toda su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Indalecio A. dedicates himself to working arduously with the aim of improving his home since, for a long time, he has not had access to electricity. For this reason, he has acquired a solar panel so he can complete his household chores. He hopes to be benefited by a loan with Ceprodel, so he can pay for the panel and begin to use it. This will improve his living conditions, and help his entire family who relies on him a great deal.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for a solar panel.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
El señor Oscar D. es un padre de familia con tres hijos a los cuales debe de mantener y brindarle las condiciones necesarias para sus estudios. A pesas de que es un padre soltero ha logrado mantener a sus pequeños y una de las necesidades que atraviesa es que requiere de un panel solar por la razón de que en su localidad no poseen energía eléctrica.

Por esto ha solicitado la instalación de un panel solar y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para el pago de dicho panel y así permitir que sus hijos tengan acceso a la iluminación para llevar a cabo sus estudios.
texts.en:
Oscar D. is a head of household with three children who he must support and provide adequate conditions for their studies. Despite the fact that he is a single father, he has managed to care for his young children. One of the issues he is experiencing, however, is that he needs a solar panel because his locality does not have electricity. For this reason, he has requested installation of a solar panel and turned to Ceprodel for a loan to pay for it. This will allow his children to have access to light so they can finish their homework.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for a solar panel.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Gloria pertenece al Banco Comunal “INDOAMERICA” vive en Asentamiento Humano Pedro portillo nº 484. del distrito de Callería, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 38 años de edad.  Su pareja es chofer (transportista).

Se inició en el negocio de venta de abarrotes, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles compró arroz, azúcar, huevos, etc. 
Hoy en día ella continúa con este negocio a pesar de muchas dificultades, pero sigue adelante.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará más productos de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche, etc.

“En la vida hay muchos tropiezos pero Manuela Ramos me enseñó a levantarme y no rendirme para seguir adelante, me siento fortalecida porque también mi familia entendió que juntos podemos crecer y lograr nuestros sueños.
texts.en:
Gloria belongs to the Communal Bank “INDOAMERICA”; she lives in the district of Calleria, in the city of Pucallpa, and is 38 years old. Her partner is a chaufer. Gloria runs a business were she sells groceries; with the first loan of 300 PEN she purchased rice, sugar, eggs, etc. Currently she continues with this business despite many difficulties, however, she still continuing to move forward. With this loan of 1,000 PEN, she will purchase more grocery products such as rice, sugar, milk, etc. “In life there are many setbacks but Manuela Ramos taught me to pick myself up and not give up to continue moving forward, I fell strengthen because my family also understands that together we can grow and fulfill our dreams.”

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various products such as rice, sugar, noodles, tuna, and sweets.

loans.name: Oscar Danilo

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León, el señor Oscar M. se dedica a laborar con mucho ahínco con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por lo que ha comenzado a mejorarla ya que había estado en malas condiciones desde hace mucho tiempo.

Hoy en día ha adquirido un panel solar porque en su vivienda no se cuenta con energía eléctrica y este panel le permitirá tener acceso a energía y logrará iluminarse y así beneficiar a su familia. Para esto ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para el pago del panel solar y de esta forma salir adelante en su labor.
texts.en:
In the Telica municipality in the city of León, Oscar M. very eagerly works to improve his living conditions. He has started to improve his house, which has been in bad condition for quite some time. He has acquired a solar panel for his house, which does not have electricity. The panel will give him access to energy and allow him to illuminate the house, which will be beneficial to his family. For this reason he has come to Ceprodel to get a loan to pay for the solar panel. This way he can get ahead in his task.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for solar panel

loans.name: Julio Constantino

texts.es:
El señor Julio D. en el municipio de Telica se dedica con gran esfuerzo a laborar en su actividad de ganadería para lograr mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia por medio de la adquisición de un panel solar para iluminarse en su vivienda por el motivo de que en la localidad donde él vive no se cuenta con energía eléctrica.

Es importante destacar que hoy en día el señor Julio ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para el pago del panel solar y de esta forma salir adelante brindándole mejores condiciones de vida a su familia que tanto ama y necesita de él.
texts.en:
Julio D. lives in the town of Telica and dedicates himself with great effort to working in livestock farming. He does this to improve living conditions for his family by acquiring a solar panel to light his home, since there is no electricity in the locale where he lives. It is important to highlight that, today, Julio has looked for Ceprodel’s support for a loan for the purchase of a solar panel. In this way, he will continue on, offering better living conditions to his family that loves and needs him so much.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a solar panel

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Delma Gertrudis

texts.es:
La señora Delma O. es propietaria de una moto taxi que circula en el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León transportando a los pasajeros de un lugar a otro siendo este el único ingreso que esta dama posee en su localidad.

Es de importancia destacar que actualmente ella requiere repara su moto taxi y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de repuestos y de esta manera proceder con la reparación del medio de transporte siendo esto de mucho beneficio para ella.
texts.en:
Delma O. is the owner of a motor taxi that runs throughout the district of Telica in the city of León, transporting passengers from one place to another. This is the only income that this woman has in her town. It is of importance to emphasize that Delma currently needs to repair her motor taxi. For this reason, she has come to Ceprodel to obtain a loan to buy spare parts, and in this manner, proceed with the repair of this means of transportation which is of such benefit to her.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair her motor taxi

loans.name: Marcelina  Josefa

texts.es: La señora Marcelina  es originaria de la aldea Nimasac pero hoy en dia esta arquilando casa en la comunidad de Vasquez ella desde hace 15 años viene ejerciendo la activida en la compra y venta de ropa Americana en el mercado municipal de la localidad los dias martes y Miercoles hoy necesita un credito para incrementar su negocio para los dias restantes de la semana ya  que se le autorizo otro  punto de venta en la plaza municiapl en la cual necesita de un nuevo capital,  para poder desarrollarse  y tener un nivel de vida adecuada de su familia
texts.en:
Marcelina is a native of the small village of Nimasac, but now she is renting a home in the community of Vasquez. For 15 years, Marcelina has bought and sold American clothing in the town market on Tuesdays and Wednesdays. Now she needs a loan to expand her business to the other days of the week, given that she was authorized to sell in another location in the town plaza. For this reason, she needs new capital to be able to develop and to have an adequate standard of living for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Giachina

texts.es: Giachina tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la venta de animales en las principales ferias ganaderas de su zona, principalmente los fines de semana y cuando sus vecinos le solicitan. Además de este negocio Giachina se da tiempo para vender comida al paso por las tardes, ya que por las mañanas su actividad es atender a sus animales y su casa. Lo bueno de su trabajo es que obtiene los ingresos necesarios para sostener la economía de su hogar. Para más adelante Giachina está  pensando en comprar un terreno donde pueda implementar un establo para sus animales. Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal porque le permite crecer económicamente y tener un espacio de amistad. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de más animales como ovejas y cerdos con los que  incrementará su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Giachina, 27, lives with her husband and son in a rented house. For 4 years she has sold animals in the principal livestock fairs in her zone. She sells primarily on the week ends and when her neighbors have requests. In addition to this business, Giachina sells food in the afternoons. In the mornings she tends to the animals and her house. The good thing about her work is that she gets the income needed to sustain her household. In the future, Giachina is thinking of buying a piece of land where she can put a stable for her animals. This is her second loan with MFP. She is very happy to belong to her community bank because it allows her to grow economically and be in a place filled with friendship. The loan is to buy more animals like sheep and pigs. With these animals she will increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep and pigs

loans.name: Juan Gerardo

texts.es: El Señor Juan Gerardo con residencia en el cantón Chotacaj del departamento de Totonicapan el comenta desde que tenia 5 años aprendio el arte con su querido padre cuando tenia 18 años  formo su propio negocio en su hogar cuando el decide casarse  su esposa tiene el mismo arte de la carpinteria  al poco tiempo decidieron  fortalecer su  negocio en la busca de un puesto de venta en el departamento y la cual lo consiguieron, trascurrieron los tiempos y su producto los vende en Huehuetenango y Quiche hoy necesita un credito para la compra de madera para poderlos utilizar en la epoca de invierno.

loans.use: Compra de Materiales

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr: Madame Maïmouna L. est une femme mariée enseignante à l’école Jules SAGNA 2000 et elle fait en même temps le commerce depuis 2004. Elle a démarré sur ses propres fonds  et est à son premier prêt pour renforcer son commerce. Bien expérimentée dans le commerce, elle gagne un bon bénéfice qui va l’aider à bien rembourser son crédit et augmenter ses revenus. Son activité consiste d'aller dans les pays limitrophes Gambie ou Mali) acheter les habits et venir les vendre au Sénégal.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maïmouna L. is married. She's a teacher at the Jules SAGNA 2000 school and, at the same time, she's been running a clothing business since 2004. She started on her own funds, and she's seeking her first loan to bolster her business. Well experienced, she turns a good profit, which will help her repay her loan and increase her income. Her business consists in traveling to neighboring countries, Gambia or Mali, to buy clothes and to resell them in Senegal.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell clothes, and to pay the customs duties

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny tiene 31 años, vive con su bebé en casa de sus padres. Trabaja en la venta de balones de gas licuado en un local que ha dispuesto en su casa, donde no sólo los exhibe, sino también reparte a domicilio cuando se lo solicitan. Cuenta con el apoyo de una persona que ha contratado para la atención al público y para llevar el balón de gas en una moto hasta la vivienda del cliente, de ese modo, ella se queda permanenteme en su local. Para el futuro le gustaría expander su negocio, implementando sucursales en otros lugares. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y da su compromiso de ser una de las socias más activas de su banco comunal para el bienestar de todos. El dinero que viene solicitando es para adquirir más mercadería en balones de gas y de esa manera incrementar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Jenny, 31, lives with her baby in her parents’ house. She sells tanks of liquefied gas in an area that she has arranged in her house. She not only displays them, but she also delivers them to homes when people ask for them. She has one helper to wait on customers and deliver the gas tank to their homes. This way she can always be on the premises. In the future, she would like to expand her business by setting up branches in other places. This is her first loan with MFP. She promises to be one of the most active members of her community bank for the well being of everyone. The loan will be used to buy more gas tanks in order to increase her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur Ibrahima N. est un jeune célibataire, photographe de profession.  Il est aussi enseignant dans son métier de photographe et de la langue l'arabe dans les écoles.  En plus, il fait des reportages dans les cérémonies. Il est à son premier prêt avec lequel il veut acheter des appareils photo pour renforcer son activité. Les bénéfices lui permettront de bien rembourser son prêt et de mieux se soutenir.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima N. is a young unmarried man and a photographer by profession. He is also a teacher of this profession and of the Arabic language in schools. In addition, he does reporting on special events. He is on his first loan, with which he wants to buy photographic equipment in order to enhance his business. The profits will enable him to repay his loan and to do better in supporting himself.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy photographic equipment

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El Grupo Solidario Renacer esta integrado por tres personas las cuales se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo y todas se dedican al comercio.
la Sra. Arlis N. tiene 33 años de edad y esta casada con el Sr. Gesler Philips quien labora en la compañia nacional Pepsi y Co., con el han procreado 3 hijos de los cuales dos estan en la escuela, ella se dedica a la vena de carne de res, cerdo y pollo, tambien vende lacteos. ella necesita el credito pra comprar al por mayor la carne y los lacteos, ya que asi son mas baratos y se tienen mejores ganancias.
La Sra. Eyla montalvan tiene 24 años de edad, esta casada con el Sr. Julio N. quien se dedica a la albañeleria, no tienen hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos, charamuscas y agua en bolsas, ella necesita el credito para comprar mas refrescos y agua al por mayor.
La Sra. Francis B. tiene 33 años de edad y vive en union libre con el Sr. robin Martirez el se dedica a la albañileria y ella vende donas, refrescos y charamuscas, esta actividad tiene de realizarla desde hace 3 años, ella necesita el credito para comprar harina, leña, azucar y refrescos.
todos ellos son personas muy responsables y unidas, tienen muchas ganas de salir adelante con sus negocios y sus familias.
texts.en:
The Solidario Renacer group is made up of three people who have known each other for a long time, and all are business people. Mrs. Arlis N., 33, is married to Mr. Gesler Philips. He works for the national Pepsi and Co. They have 3 children; two are in school. She sells beef, pork and chicken. She also sells dairy products. She needs a loan to buy wholesale meat and dairy products. They are cheaper that way, and she can have better earnings. Mrs. Eyla Montalvan, 24, is married to Mr. Julio N.. He is a brick layer. They do not have children. She sells soft drinks, popsicles and bagged water. She needs a loan to buy more soft drinks and water wholesale. Mrs. Francis B., 33, lives in a common law marriage with Mr. Robin Martirez. He is a brick layer. She sells doughnuts, soft drinks, and popsicles. She has been doing this for three years. She needs a loan to buy flour, wood, sugar and soft drinks. All of them are very responsible and united. They have great desires to get ahead with their businesses and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, soft drinks, bundles of bagged water, flour.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es: Lilia tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo y su hija de 5 años en casa de sus suegros. Desde hace más de 3 años se dedica al bordado de fustanes artesanales que son usados en las  danzas típicas de su ciudad, de esta manera aporta en la economía de su hogar y para la atención de su pequeña hija que está en edad escolar. Es por ello que Lilia realiza este trabajo en su misma casa, en los horarios que dispone de tiempo; y aprovechando la época festiva de su localidad quier incrementar su producción para aumentar sus ganancias. Es la primera vez que Lilia viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y está contenta por pertenecer a su banco comunal, el cual le permitirá crecer ella y los demás integrantes. Ahora Lilia planea comprar telas e hilos a seguir bordando e incrementando su producción.
texts.en:
Lilia, 26, lives with her husband and her 5 year old daughter in her in-laws’ house. For over 3 years she has been embroidering skirts that are used in the typical dances of her city. This way she contributes to the economy of her home and her little school aged daughter’s needs. Lilia works in her home in her free time. Taking advantage of the season for festivities in her area, she wants to increase her production to raise her income. This is the first time that Lilia has asked for a loan from MFP. She is happy to belong to her community bank, which has allowed her and the other members to grow. Lilia plans to buy fabric and thread to continue embroidering and increasing her production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for her embroidery

loans.name: Greta Doris

texts.es:
La señora Greta pertenece al Banco Comunal “INDOAMERICA” vive en el jr Fizcarral nº 246, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 58 años de edad.

Desde hace varios años se dedica al alquiler de cuartos.  Con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró golosinas para vender en su casa, y así generarse otros ingresos.

Hoy en día continúa con el negocio de la venta de golosinas y el negocio del alquiler de cuartos ha mejorado.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la compra de materiales para mejorar los ambientes de sus cuartos.

“Me encuentro un poco mal de salud pero emocionalmente me siento fortalecida para vencer todas las dificultades y seguir adelante en bien de toda mi familia....... esto gracias a Manuela Ramos”.
texts.en:
Greta belongs to the INDOAMERICA Communal Bank. She is 58 years old and lives in Pucallpa.

She has rented out rooms for several years. With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles, she purchased sweets to sell from her home to generate additional income. Nowadays she continues to sell sweets and her room rental business has improved.

She will invest this loan of 3000 nuevos soles in the purchase of materials that will improve the ambiance in her rooms.

“I’m a little unwell but I feel emotionally strong to overcome difficulties and move forward for the good of my family…all thanks to Manuela Ramos.”

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for housing maintenance

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: Lucy tiene 24 años, vive en una casa arrendada con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Desde hace un año se dedica a la venta de comida en una calle principal de su localidad, actividad que realiza todos los días, y de esta manera genera más recursos para su familia que recién está cimentándose. Por las mañanas cocina y atiende a sus pequeños y antes del medio día sale a vender su comida en tiempo de almuerzo, por la tarde limpia y ordena todos sus platos y cubiertos y los alista para la venta del día siguiente. Lucy trabaja todos los días para lograr la meta que se ha propuesto, que es tener un restaurante. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, tiene muchos deseos de seguir trabajando por el bienestar de todos sus compañeros, para que de esa manera siga mejorando su calidad de vida. El dinero que viene solicitando es para invertirlo en la compra de los abarrotes e ingredientes básicos para la preparación de sus platos, comprará sacos de arroz, azúcar y menestras.
texts.en:
Lucy is 24 years old and lives in a leased home with her husband and 2 children. She has been selling food from a major street in her locality for one year, an activity she carries out on a daily basis to generate income for her family. During the mornings, she cooks and takes care of her kids. After noon, she goes out to sell food for lunch. In the afternoons, she cleans and organizes her plates and utensils and gets things ready for the following day. Lucy works each and every day in order to fulfill the goal she has set for herself, to one day have her own restaurant. This is the second time she seeks a loan with MFP, and she has a great desire to continue working for the well-being of all her associates and to continue improving her standard of living. The funds that she requests would be invested into the purchase of supplies and basic ingredients to prepare her foods, including sacks of rice, sugar, and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies and ingredients for her foods.

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa de su tía. Hace más de 18 años viene trabajando en la venta de materiales de construcción, compra directamente la arena en la orilla del río y luego la vende donde la requieran. Hace varios meses compró un terreno que es el depósito de su mercadería. Para ella, la mejor época de venta comienza en el mes de mayo hasta noviembre, los demás meses por ser época de lluvia dificulta la obtención de arena en los ríos, pese a esto Maritza continuará trabajando en esta actividad porque es rentable. Para el futuro, desea tener su propio camión de carga para transportar ella misma su mercadería, sin tener que pagar por este servicio. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, está contenta por haber sido invitada a formar parte de su grupo, y tiene muchos deseos de continuar participando en su banco comunal en los demás ciclos de crédito. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de mayor cantidad de arena gruesa y fina que son su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Maritza is 35 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children at her aunt’s house. She has been selling construction materials for more than 18 years, buying sand directly from the shores of the river and then selling it at sites where it’s needed. For her, the best season for sales is from May to November. The rest of the months, which are the rainy season, she has a hard time obtaining sand at the rivers. Despite this, Maritza continues this activity because it is profitable. In the future, she would like to have her own truck to transport her product and not have to pay someone else for this service. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is happy to have been invited to join this group. She has a great desire to continue to participate in her cooperative bank in other credit cycles. The funds she is requesting are to purchase a greater quantity of sand, both coarse and fine, as this is the source of her working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 24 años, vive con su esposo y su hijo en una casa arrendada. Se dedica a las tareas de la agricultura y ganadería en algunos terrenos que sus padres le han heredado y cultiva los principales productos de su tierra. Cada día está atenta de cómo están creciendo las plantas para que no entre ninguna plaga o se presente alguna dificultad, así garantiza que tenga una buena cosecha. Sus productos los lleva a vender en los principales mercados de abastos. Hasta el momento Olga ha visto que su trabajo le ha generado buenos ingresos, y para más adelante está pensando incrementar su producción, así como dedicarse a la venta de animales con mayor énfasis. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y acerca del trabajo en un banco comunal tiene muy buenas referencias, sobre todo que es un buen espacio de aprendizaje. El dinero que solicita es para invertirlo en la compra de ganado, de esa manera complementará su actividad agrícola.
texts.en:
Olga is a 24-year-old woman who lives with her husband and son in a rented home. She works in agriculture and cattle farming on fields that she inherited from her parents. Everyday, she pays close attention to the growth of her crops so that pests or any other problems will not affect them, thus ensuring a good harvest. She sells her products at the main wholesale markets in the area. So far, Olga has seen her work generate good profits. In the future, she plans on increasing production and focusing more on selling livestock. This is the first time that she requests a loan from MFP, and she has heard so many good things about working with a microfinance institute, particularly that it is a good learning environment. The money that she is now requesting will be invested in purchasing livestock so that she can supplement her agricultural activities.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock to sell

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
El señor Ramón Sánchez vive en la colonia central de piedras negras, Coahuila.
El es soltero y pensionado por incapacidad de trabajar por un accidente que tuvo trabajando en los Estados Unidos.
Tiene ya un proyecto realizándose pero le esta haciendo falta la compra y colocación de lamina en una estructura de un techo en la parte de atrás de su casita, motivo por el cual Don Ramón esta solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Ramón Sánchez lives in the central district of Piedras Negras, in the state of Coahuila. He is single and he receives a work disability pension due to an accident that he had while working in the United States. He already has a construction project underway, but he requires the purchase and installation of roofing material in order to continue with it. He would install this metal as roofing atop the structure he has built in the back part of his home. Completing this construction is the purpose for which Don Ramón is applying for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de lamina para estructura de techo

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Maria C.
