B. ella es Originaria de la Comunidad de Juchanep actualmete ellas de dedica a la confeccion de playeras, Blusas y otros y la cual los entraga en diferentes puntos de ventas, la cual nesecita hoy en dia de un credito para poder compra algunas piezas de las maquinas y telas para poder producir un poco mas y con la idea de buscar otros nuevos mercados con el objetivo de mejor el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Maria C. B. is originally from the community of Juchanep. She currently makes T-shirts, blouses and other items, which she delivers to different retail locations. Now she needs a loan to purchase machine parts and materials to increase her production. She is looking to find new markets in order to improve her family’s quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina tiene 26 años, vive con su hijos y su esposo en una casa arrendada. Desde hace 9 años se dedica a la venta de papa que cosecha de las tierras de cultivo de su padre, y la vende en las principales ferias de su localidad, ofreciendo de manera ambulante su producto. De preferencia trabaja los fines de semana para que los demás días pueda atender a su pequeño hijo, en estas tareas cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres y sus hermanas. Hasta el momento sus ingresos son rentables y Rosalina está planeando para el futuro, producir más cantidad de papas para incrementar sus ventas. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy entusiasmada para seguir adelante con el trabajo solidario de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos para empaquetar la papa y el pago del transporte de la chacra a la ciudad.
texts.en:
Rosalina is a 26-year-old woman who lives with her husband and children in a rented home. For 9 years, she has been selling the potatoes that she grows in her father’s crop fields. She sells the produce as a street vendor at the main markets in her region. She preferably works on weekends so that she can look after her young son during the week. Fortunately, her parents and sisters help her out with taking care of her son. So far, Rosalina’s business has been lucrative, and she is planning to produce a greater amount of potatoes to boost sales in the future. This is the second time that she requests a loan from MFP, and she is motivated to move forward by working in a solidarity group at her microfinance institute. The money that she is requesting will be invested in purchasing potato sacks and paying for transporting the crops from the farm to the city.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase potato sacks and pay transportation fees

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es: Santiago tiene 30 años, vive con sus padres y sus hermanos en casa de sus padres. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a la fabricación de muebles trabajando en su propio taller de carpintería con la ayuda de su hermano menor que es su mano derecha, gracias a ello puede cumplir a tiempo con los pedidos que le solicitan. Trabaja en su taller todos los días excepto los domingos y por la constancia y buena calidad que ofrece está creciendo en la demanda de sus servicios, esto lo llena de satisfacción, ya que le permite disponer libremente de ganancias para apoyar a sus padres y hermanos. El deseo de Santiago es producir mayor cantidad de muebles que le permitan mayores ganancias y expandir sus horizontes de ventas para forjar una empresa sólida. Esta es la primera vez que viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, fue invitado a pertenecer a  su actual banco comunal, además tiene un buen concepto de la ayuda solidaria y del trabajo que se realiza, por su parte, se compromete a ser uno de los socios más activos de su grupo. El dinero que requiere lo usará en la compra de madera y telas para el tapizado de los muebles, así como más instrumentos y herramientas para implementar su taller.
texts.en:
Santiago is 30 years old. He lives with his parents and siblings at his parents' house. He's been manufacturing furniture for four years at his own carpentry shop with the help of his younger brother. Thanks to his brother, who is his right hand, he is able to complete the clients' requests on time. Santiago works at his shop every day except Sunday. The consistency and quality of his work has attracted more demand for his services. This increase in demand fills him with satisfaction because he can use his income to help his parents and siblings. Santiago wishes to produce a larger quantity of furniture in order to increment his earnings and expand his sales horizon to forge a solid enterprise. This is the first time Santiago asks for a a loan with MFP. He was invited to belong to his current communal bank and he has a good concept of solidarity. He also knows a lot about his work and is committed to be one of the most active members of his group. He is requesting the loan to purchase wood and fabric for the furniture's tapestry. He also wants to acquire more tools for use at his shop.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for manufacturing furniture

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
La señora María de Jesús es casada con el señor Juan Pablo Cárdenas y viven en la colonia Gobernadores casas donadas por el gobierno de Coahuila por la fuerte tragedia que sucedió el día de la inundación en Villa de Fuente. Ella es empleada domestica de una residencia desde hace un año, su esposo trabaja en el área de mantenimiento de una promotora ambiental también desde hace un año. 
A pesar de haber pasado por esta tragedia donde perdieron todo, lo que los hace más fuertes es el deseo de superarse, deseo que les transmiten a sus tres hijos en edad de escuela, ellos están solicitando este crédito para la realización de los acabados interiores de su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. María de Jesús is married to Mr. Juan Pablo Cárdenas and they live in the Gobernadores neighborhood, at houses that were donated by the Coahuilan government because of the strong tragedy that happened on the day of the Villa de Fuente flooding. Mrs. María has been a domestic helper at a residence for a year. Her husband has also been working for a year at the maintenance area of an environmental promoter agency. In spite of going through a tragedy where they lost everything, their desire to overcome this is what makes them stronger. They communicate this desire with their three children, who are all in schooling age. They are requesting this loan to finish building the interiors of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finishing the walls of her home

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba I. is married with 2 children and received an education through primary school. Since 2007, she has worked as a trader selling shoes at Kissi in Elmina. While Habiba works as a trader, her husband is employed as a fisherman. Habiba will use the loan to purchase additional footwear for resale and she plans to save some of her newly gained profits and also reinvest some into the business to ensure her continued success.

loans.use: To purchase additional footwear for resale.

loans.name: Moulai Hassan

texts.fr: Monsieur Moulai Hassan D. est tailleur marié et a son propre atelier depuis plus de 15 ans. Il a l’âge de 39 ans. Il confectionne des habits pour les revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires. Avec ce crédit il veut renforcer son activité par acheter des tissus qu’il confectionne pour les revendre.  Avec les bénéfices il compte rembourser son crédit et améliorer sa qualité de vivre.  Monsieur D. a reçu 4 crédits auprès de l’IMCEC et il les a bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Mr. Moulai Hassan D. is a married tailor and has had his own workshop for over fifteen years. He is 39 years old. He makes clothing that he sells in the weekly marketplaces. With this loan, he wants to bolster his business by buying fabrics for making clothing for resale. With the profits, he intends to repay his loan and to improve his quality of life. Mr. D. has had four loans from IMCEC, and he has repaid them.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Saliful

texts.en: Saliful D. is married with 4 children and received an education through senior high school. Since 2007, Saliful has worked as a taxi driver and also as a trader, selling wood, at Abrobeano in Elmina. Saliful’s wife also works as a trader in the area. He uses his income to pay for school fees and bills. Saliful will use the loan to purchase more wood for selling and he plans to save the new profits from his expanded business towards buying a car.

loans.use: To purchase more wood for selling.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou G. est  une femme mariée qui a une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans  et habite  Bayal de Thiès. Elle fait le commerce des parfums et divers marchandises de femmes, elle est à son deuxième prêt et avec ce prêt elle veut diversifier son commerce  c'est-à-dire elle veut acheter des tissus ( thioub , khartoume, chaussures…) pour les revendre. Elle réalise un bénéfice avec lequel  elle rembourse les intérêts de son prêt et compte investir le reste dans son commerce.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatou G. is a married woman who is about 37 years old. She lives Bayal, in Thiès. She does commerce in perfumes and in various women’s merchandise. She is on her second loan, which she wants to use to diversify her business. That is, she wants to buy some fabrics (thioub, khartoume) and shoes to resell them. She earns a profit, with which she repays the interest on the loan. She intends to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth and shoes

loans.name: Clairol Magaly

texts.es: La neñora Clairol  Es originario  de la comunidad del Canton Chiyax es una persona muy reconocida en su comunidad actualmente es propietaria de un taxi rotativo en el departamento de Totonicapan y sus alrededores ella manifiesta que necesita un credito para solventar pagos de estudios ya que esta finalizando una etapa de estudios  en la universidad y por el momento no tiene esos recurso y se ve la necesidad  de este credito. que al trascurrir de los tiempos ella lo ve no como un gasto si no una inversion que le permite ser competitivo en el mercado con la preparacion academica.
texts.en:
Mrs. Clairol is originally from the Canton Chiyax community. She is a very well known person in her community and she currently owns a taxi at the department of Totonicapan. She needs a loan in order to cover her college payments because she is trying to finish college and she currently doesn't have enough resources to cover these costs. She does not see this loan as an expense but as an investment on academic preparation that will allow her to be competitive in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Education Expenses

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. is married with 3 children and received an education through primary school. Since 2004, Ekua has worked as a trader, selling various items such as books, pens, tomatoes and oil at Abrobeano in Elmina. While Ekua works as a trader, her husband is employed as a fisherman. She uses her income to pay for her family’s expenses such as school fees and housekeeping money. Ekua will use the loan to purchase more goods for selling and she plans to reinvest her newly gained profits into her business to ensure her continued success.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for selling.

loans.name: Fadhima

texts.fr: Madame  Fadima T. est une femme mariée qui a l’âge de 36 ans. Elle est enseignante depuis octobre 1995 et habite au quartier Sampathé de Thiès. Elle a commencé l’enseignement dans une autre ville, mais depuis 1998 elle enseigne à l’école Mayoro T. à Thiès. Elle fait le commerce des tissus en provenance du Mali et de la Mauritanie. Elle a décidé d’intégrer l’IMCEC dans cette activité, et avec premier prêt avec laquelle elle envisage d’acheter des tissus pour les revendre. Les bénéfices qu’elle réalise lui permettent de rembourser les intérêts de son prêt et d’investir le reste dans son commerce.
texts.en:
Ms. Fadima T. is a married woman who is 36 years old. She has been a teacher since October 1995 and lives in Sampathé district of Thiès. She started teaching in another city, but since 1998, she has been teaching at the Mayoro T. school in Thiès. She does commerce in fabrics that come from Mali and from Mauritania. She decided to join IMCEC for this business, and with her first loan, she envisions buying fabrics to resell. The profits she earns will enable her to make loan interest payments and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas C. is married with 7 dependents and received an education through Junior High School. Since 1980, Dorcas has worked as a trader selling cooked rice at Kissi in Elmina. While Dorcas works as a trader, her husband is employed as a businessman. She uses her income to pay for her family’s school fees and bills. Dorcas will use the loan to purchase more rice in bags, which she will then cook and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Dorcas plans to continue working on the house that she has started building.

loans.use: To purchase more rice in bags to cook and sell.

loans.name: Mapendo Plus Group

texts.fr: Weloli E. vend de l’eau purifiée dans son quartier qui est située à l’ouest de Kinshasa. Elle aime son activité qu’elle a commencée à exercer depuis 2001. Son affaire a beaucoup soutenu financièrement son foyer  surtout à payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants quand son mari a perdu son travail en 2003. Le nombre de clients de Weloli ne cesse d’augmenter à cause de ses bons services qui leur offre. C’est pourquoi le crédit qu’elle a obtenu lui a permit d’acheter une grande quantité d’eau pour satisfaire le besoin de ses clients. Weloli a aussi diversifié son affaire en achetant des emballages en vue d’accroitre son revenu. Dans le but de lutter contre les maladies causées par l’eau non potable, son ambition est de construire une petite usine de fabrication d’eau purifiée afin de desservir la population de son milieu qui en a grandement besoin. Elle a 37 ans, mariée et mère de trois enfants âgés de 9 à 15 ans qui vont tous à l’école.
texts.en:
Weloli E. sells purified water in her district, which is located west of Kinshasa. She likes her business, which she started in 2001. It has financially supported her household, especially in paying the schooling costs for the children when her husband lost his job in 2003. The number of customers that she has is growing continuously due to the good service she provides them. This is the reason behind the obtained loan, which enabled her to buy a large quantity of water to satisfy the needs of her customers.

Weloli has also diversified her business by buying packaging material in order to grow her revenues. In the goal of fighting against illnesses caused by non-potable water, her ambition is to build a small factory to produce purified water, so as to serve the people of her area, which is in heavy need of it.

Weloli is 37 years old, married, and the mother of three children, ages 9 to 15, who all go to school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of purified water… and also packaging

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos D. es casado, y tiene 2 dependientes económicos, viven en la colonia Gobernadores de nuestra ciudad, el trabaja para una empresa como operador de maquinaria pesada con una antigüedad de 3 años.
Esta solicitando este crédito para realizar los acabados interiores de su casa, ya que el gobierno les dono estas casitas cuando sucedió la tragedia de la inundación de  Villa de Fuente y perdieron todo su patrimonio.
texts.en:
Mr. Carlos D. is married and has two dependents. They live in the Gobernadores (Governors) section of the city of Piedras Negras, Mexico. Carlos works for a business as a heavy machinery operator with three years of experience. He is requesting this credit in order to complete the interior finishing for his house. The government donated these small homes after the tragic flooding of Villa de Fuente, in which Carlos and his family lost all their personal assets.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Interior home finishing (plaster interior walls)

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco O. es residente de la vecina ciudad de Nava, Coahuila, es casado con la señora Blanca Valdez y son padres de tres hijos, el es empleado del municipio de la ciudad de Piedras Negras Coahuila. 
Son personas muy responsables, la señora trabaja como secretaria en la supervisión de de la zona escolar. Tienen  un proyecto para la comodidad de la familia  que es cambiar el techo de madera dañado por una losa de concreto e ir reparando poco a poco este cuarto de la parte trasera del hogar. Y por esto solicitan este préstamo.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco O. is a resident of Nava, Coahila, a neighboring city of Piedras Negras, Mexico. He is married to Mrs. Blanca Valdez and they have three children. Francisco works for the city government of Piedras Negras Coahuila. Both husband and wife are very responsible people. Blanca works as a secretary for the superintendent’s office of the school district. Their project aims for the betterment of family life by replacing their damaged wooden roof with a concrete slab. They also plan to finish the room at the rear of the house little by little. For this reason they seek a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a concrete roof slab

loans.name: Thilo

texts.fr: Madame Thilo B. est une femme mariée qui travaille au service nettoiement de l’hôpital régionale de Thiès.  Elle a 40 ans et elle habite au quartier Darou Salam de Thiès.  En plus de son travail, elle a ouvert une petite alimentation chez elle qu’elle a confiée à sa fille. Elle vend les petites marchandises. Elle est à son renouvellement de prêt et a bien remboursé le précédent.  Avec ce crédit, elle va acheter des cigarettes, Omo (du savon en poudre), eau de javel, cube Maggi (un condiment Senegalais), et divers.  En vendant cette marchandise elle espère d’avoir un bénéfice de 20 000CFA ($40) qui vont servir à rembourser les intérêts de son prêt et payer les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
Ms. Thilo B. is a married woman who works in the cleaning service of a region hospital in Thiès. She is 40 years old and lives in the Darou Salam district of Thiès. In addition to her work, she opened a small grocery store in her home that she has entrusted to her daughter. She sells sundry items. She is on her loan renewal, having repaid the preceding one. With this loan, she’s going to buy cigarettes, some Omo (a powdered soap), bleach, Maggi bouillon cubes (a condiment in Senegal), and various goods. Through selling these goods, she hopes to have a profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used to make loan interest payments and to cover day-to-day expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cigarettes, soap, and various goods

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
Don Jesús A. V. y la señora María del Carmen, son casados y viven en la colonia Acoros, de la ciudad de Piedras Negras; son padres de tres hijos.
El tiene su propio negocio llamado “3 hermanos “donde realiza proyectos relacionados  a la herrería tales como portones, puertas y ventanas, etc. 
Desde hace 7 años, teniendo ya una  cartera de clientes  extensa; pero en estos momentos esta requiriendo de la compra de una maquina de soldar, porque la anterior que tenía se descompuso y tiene ya empezados algunos pedidos,por esto es que esta tramitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Jesús A. V. lives with his wife María del Carmen in the Acoros neighborhood in the city of Piedras Negras. They have three children. He has his own blacksmith business called “3 Hermanos” (“3 Brothers”), where he makes products such as gates, doors, windows, etc. Jesús has had an extensive client list for the past 7 years. Right now he needs to purchase a new welding machine, since his old machine broke and he currently has some orders to complete. That is why he’s applying for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a welding machine

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Sra. Francisca tiene 50 años, es viuda y tiene un hijo mayor de edad con quien trabaja. Ella tiene un terreno en el cual cultiva distintas plantas ya sean hornamentales, como de estacion, para luego comercializarlas en el Mercado municipal de Itaugua.  Tambien las vende casa por casa con su hijo en una carreta a traccion animal y a hogares particulares en la cual ademas de vender sus plantas realiza trabajos de jardinerìa (Siempre en compañía de su hijo).  El credito será de ayuda para la compra de semillas de estaciòn, pues las mismas se agotan en poco tiempo.

El anhelo de Doña Francisca es poder adquirir un puesto fijo en el Mercado de Itaugua para la ubicación en el mismo de un vivero permanente.
texts.en:
Ms. Francisca V. is a 50-year-old widow with a grown-up son with whom she works. She owns a field on which she grows different types of plants—both ornamental and seasonal—which she then sells at the Itaugua Municipal Market. She also sells the plants door-to-door alongside her son on a horse-drawn cart. Additionally, she and her son provide gardening services for private homes. This loan will help her purchase seeds for plants that are in season because they tend to run out quickly.

Ms. V. wishes to be able to obtain a fixed stand in the Itaugua Market so that she can set up a permanent garden center.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur  Mamadou D. est  un  jeune marié boulanger  qui habite au quartier Keur Serigne Ablaye. Il travaille  comme livreur de pain à la boulangerie  ABAK mais depuis 1991 il fait  l’embouche ovine parallèlement à son travail. Il a soldé son premier prêt sans difficulté. Avec ce prêt il veut renforcer son activité c'est-à-dire il achète des moutons qu’il élève quelques temps pour les revendre. Par exemple s’il achète 8 moutons et leur nourriture à 470 000 FCFA ($100) il peut les revendre à 720000 FCFA ($150). Il a un bon bénéfice qui pourra rembourser normalement son prêt et le reste il l’investit dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou D. is a young married baker who lives in the district of Keur Serigne Ablaye. He works as a delivery man at the ABAK bakery, but since 1991, he has been fattening sheep concurrently. He has settled his first loan without difficulty. With the current loan loan, he wants to bolster his business, that is, buying sheep to raise for a time and then selling them. For example, if he buys eight sheep plus feed for 470,000 francs CFA, he can resell them at 720,000 francs. He makes a good profit for repaying his loan regularly, and he's investing the rest in his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep and food for them

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en: Adiza M. is divorced with 2 children and received an education through Junior High School . Since 1989 she has worked as a petty trader selling provisions at Essaman Junction in Elmina.  Adiza uses her income to pay for school fees and light and water bills. Adiza will use the loan to purchase provisions such as milk, sugar, rice, soap, and canned foods. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adiza plans to continue working on the building she has started.

loans.use: purchase provisions such as milk, sugar, rice, soap, and canned foods

loans.name: Abdou

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdou B. est un jeune tailleur marié qui est âgé de 32 ans et a deux femmes et des enfants. Il habite au quartier Grand Thiès et a son propre atelier de tailleur depuis 6 ans. Son activité consiste à travailler sur commande  et a des clients à l’extérieur (France et USA). Avec ce prêt il veut acheter des tissus qu’il confectionne pour les revendre. Après la vente il espère d’avoir un bénéfice de 90,250 CFA ($180) avec lequel il pourra rembourser les intérêts de son prêt et le reste il va l’investir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdou B. is a young married tailor who is 32 years old. He has a wife and children and lives in the Grand Thiès district. He has had his own workshop for six years. His work involves working by special order, and he has foreign customers (France and U.S.A.). With this loan, he wants to buy fabrics for making clothing to sell. He then hopes to earn a profit of 90,250 francs CFA, which he will be able to use to make loan interest payments and to invest the rest in his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Winner Plus Group

texts.fr: Faty B. a été initiée dans son affaire par son mari depuis 1996. Elle vend des pièces de rechange auto qu’elle achète au port de Matadi dans la province du Bas-Congo au sud-ouest de la RDC. Elle a acquit une expérience solide en vente et en bonne gestion de son activité. Elle est connue par des chauffeurs et mécaniciens de Kinshasa qui lui font beaucoup de confiance à cause de la qualité de ses services et surtout des pièces d'une meilleure qualité qu’elle leur vend. Son affaire a connu une baisse en 1997 à cause de l’instabilité politique. Elle a reprit et prospéré de 2000 jusqu’à ce jour. Faty totalise aujourd’hui un capital propre de plus de $500. Elle vend à Matonge qui est le milieu le plus connu et fréquenté de Kinshasa. Elle aime son affaire car elle est rentable et lui donne l’occasion faire beaucoup de connaissances. Elle a 31 ans, mariée et mère de trois enfants dont leurs âges varient de 4 à 8 ans et deux seulement vont à l’école. Faty rêve devenir un jour une importatrice des pièces d’auto directement de l’occident.
texts.en:
Faty B. was introduced to her work by her husband in 1996. She sells automobile parts that she buys as the Matadi port in the province of Bas-Congo in the southwest of the DRC. She acquired solid experience in sales and in the good managing of her business. She is known by drivers and mechanics of Kinshasa who trust her a great deal for quality service and especially for the better quality goods she sells them.

Faty experienced a drop in business in 1997 due to political instability. She began again in 2000 and has prospered through today. She now has capital amounting to over $500. She makes her sales in Matonge, which is the best known and busiest place in Kinshasa. She likes her business because it's profitable and provides the chance for her to meet a lot of people.

She is 31 years old, married, and the mother of three children, who vary in age from 4 to 8. Only two of them go to school. Faty dreams one day of becoming an importer of auto parts directly from the West.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy automobile parts

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Hipólito

texts.es:
El Sr. Hipólito Q. tiene 62 años, está casado y tiene dos  hijos mayores. El cliente se dedica a la  venta de frutas cítricas como naranjas, pomelos, y mandarinas.  El negocio funciona desde 1999 y esta ubicada en la Compañía Caacupemi de la ciudad de Atyra, a unos siete kilometros del centro de Caacupe.

El cliente realiza sus ventas tres veces por semana lo lleva al mercado de abasto de Asunción y al mercado de San Lorenzo.  Estas  compras de  frutas de naranja, mandarina y pomelo las realiza antes de que sean  cosechadas en la chacha misma para luego realizar su venta. 

El cliente dice que con los prestamos que le otorgo la fundación el pudo salir adelante con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. Su objetivo a muy corto plazo es de tener su propio local en el mercado.
texts.en:
Mr. Hipólito Q. is 62 years old and has two grown-up children. Our client sells citrus—oranges, grapefruit, and tangerines—for a living. He has been in business since 1999. His business space is located in the Caacupemi neighborhood of the city of Atyra, located some 7 kilometers from downtown Caacupe.

Our client purchases fruit three times a week, taking his produce to the Asunción Wholesale Market and to the San Lorenzo Market. He buys citrus fruits on the farm itself before they are picked, then sells them.

Our client states that after much effort and sacrifice, he has been able to get ahead in life with the loans that he received from our foundation. His short-term goal is to have his own business space at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oranges, tangerines, and grapefruit

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida T. is married with two children and has received an education through Vocational School. Since 1999, she has worked as a trader selling provisions at Ankwanda near Elmina.  Her husband is also a trader. Vida uses her income to pay for school fees, her family’s light bill and rent. She will use the loan to purchase additional provisions such as sugar, milk, rice and soap which she will sell in her shop. With the new profits from her expanded business, Vida plans to purchase land and build a home for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional provisions for her shop.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El señor José Luis es casado con la señora María del carmen y residentes de la ciudad de Allende, Coahuila. 
El es empleado del hospital general como chofer de ambulancia; su esposa trabaja en Diconsa como supervisora operativa. 
Son padres de 4 hijos en edad escolar. 
Como familia tiene el proyecto de una casa más cómoda, motivo por el cual tramitan este crédito, ya que requieren de la compra de varilla para la realización de un portal en el frente de su casa.
texts.en:
José Luis is married to Maria del Carmen, they live in the city of Allende, Coahuila. He works as an ambulance driver for the general hospital; his wife works in Diconsa as an operational supervisor. They are the parents of 4 school-age children. His plan is to build a more comfortable home for his family -- they are applying for this loan to purchase rods and build a front door for their house.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials for a front door to their family home

loans.name: Afde N° 13 Group

texts.fr:
Numero 13
Le groupe Association Femme Développement Entreprise Numéro 13 est constitué de cinq femmes, dont la plus jeune a 25 ans et la plus âgée a 64 ans.  Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies à Thiès, une ville de 70 kilomètres de Dakar, la capital de Sénégal.  Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Elles exercent presque la même activité de vente de produits alimentaire comme du jus, de la glace, et des fruits.  Elles sont bien expérimentées et très sollicitées dans ces activités. Dans le cadre de l’amélioration de la qualité de leurs services et l’agrandissement de la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance l’IMCEC.  Elles ont déjà reçu un prêt de groupement auprès de l’IMCEC, et elles l’ont bien remboursé. Elles comptent utiliser ce prêt pour reconstituer leur stock de marchandises pour mieux servir leurs clients.  Les marchandises du groupe sont vendues en détail, au comptant au marché grand Thiès.  Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 40,000CFA ($80) au cours de ce cycle qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt, subvenir au besoin de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
The group "Association Femme Développement Entreprise Numéro 13" is composed of five women, age 25 to 64. They live in large extended traditional families in Thiès, a city located 70 kilometers from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. They got acquainted through bonds of neighborhood and kinship. They run very similar businesses, selling food products such as juice, ice cream, and fruits. The group is well experienced and very much sought-after in their businesses. In the course of improving the quality of their service and expanding their businesses, the group members decided to join Kiva's partner, the microfinance organization IMCEC. They already benefited from one group loan from IMCEC, and they repaid it without problems. They intend to use this loan to rebuild their food products stock, in order to better serve their customers. The products are retailed, for cash, at the grand market in Thiès. During this loan cycle, they hope to turn an average profit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 80), to be used to repay the loan and to provide for their families. The remainder will be invested in their businesses.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell juice, ice cream, and fruits

loans.name: Ada

texts.es:
La Sra. Ada tiene 36 anos, es  soltera y tiene dos hijos.  Ella posee una despensa y carnicería con mas de 3 años de antigüedad.  Ada es muy responsable y dedicada a la actividad que realiza ya que ella lo administra y organiza todo.  Su negocio esta ubicado en un barrio no muy lejos de la ciudad de Caacupe la cual lo beneficia por la cantidad de clientes con que cuenta.

La inversión del préstamo lo destino para la compra de embutidos, carnes, bebidas, también algunos productos básicos de la canasta familiar para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.  Ella comenta que esta muy conforme con sus ingresos de las ventas porque gracias a ella cada día puede cubrir las necesidades del hogar.

En este emprendimiento que realiza en todo momento le apoya un hermano que constantemente lo visita a pesar de sus estudios y de su trabajo.  Ada agradece por el apoyo constante y dice que espera tener siempre, ya que es una herramienta muy importante para ella poder seguir adelante y con mucho éxito en su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Señora Ada is 36, is single, and has 2 children. She has owned a grocery store and butcher shop for more than 3 years. Ada is very responsible and dedicated to her work since she manages and organizes everything. Her business is located in a neighborhood not very far from the city of Caacupe, which benefits her because of the number of customers she has. She will invest this loan in the purchase of sausages, meat, drinks, and other basic goods to satisfy the needs of her customers. She tells us that she is very satisfied with the income from her sales because thanks to it, she can cover her home's needs. In this enterprise, her brother always supports her and visits her even though he works and goes to school. Ada is grateful for his constant support and tells us that she hopes to always have it, since it is a very important tool to get ahead and to be successful with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise, sausage, meat, flour, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Julian Antonio

texts.es: Don  Julian Antonio P. P. es originario de la aldea de ChiP. Hoy en dia el es tejedor el aprendio el arte en la epoca del guerra en Guatemala  cuando la tejeduria en Guatemala era muy reconocido internacionalmente su producto anteriormente los entregava en Guatemal. Chichicastenango y Panajachel hoy en dia este producto ha disminuido su nemanda en nuestro departamento. pero por la calidad de trabajo que el realiza tiene algunos clientes que le compra su producto hoy necesita de un credito porque tiene un pedido que entregar, ya que hoy es muy dificil de encontrar un tejedor de estas caracteristicas.
texts.en:
Don Julian Antonio P. P. is a native of the town ChiP. Hoy. He is a weaver who learned the art during the time of war in Guatemala when Guatamalan weaving was very well-known internationally. He used to sell his products in Chichicastenango and Panajachel. Now the demand for his products has decreased in this area. But because of the quality of work that he does, he has some customers who buy his products. He needs a credit because he has an order to fill, since it is very difficult to find a weaver with his skills.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase his capital

loans.name: Alvino

texts.es:
El Sr  Albino V. es una persona joven con espíritu emprendedor y tiene deseos de sobresalir.  El es de una de las compañías denominada Ndavaru de la ciudad de Carapegua. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de sobrecamas varios. Junto con su madre elaboran sus propios productos tejiendo en su propia casa, de esa manera día a día se sacrifican para tratar de salir adelante.

El negocio con que cuenta le es muy rentable gracias al empeño que demuestra hacia su trabajo. Fabrican al  por mayor y tienen clientela formada tambien se dedica a  vender casa  por  casa  otro  tipo de mercaderìas. 

El crédito solicitado fue utilizado para la compra de  Frazadas y otros productos atendiendo que esta por entrar la temporada de frió.
texts.en:
Mr. Albino V. is a young person with an entrepreneurial spirit and he has a great desire to succeed. He is one of the designated Ndavaru companies in Carapegua city. Today he sells a variety of bedspreads. Along with his mother, they sew their own products in their own home, and in this way day after day they sacrifice everything to be able to get ahead. The business is very profitable thanks to the determination he demonstrates toward his work. They make these items wholesale and they have an established clientele and he also sells other merchandise house to house. The loan he seeks will be used to buy blankets and other products because they are coming up on the cold season.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy blankets

loans.name: Fad Plus Group

texts.fr: José D. est dépositaire des pains et gère aussi sa propre boutique. Il est achète des pains en grande quantité dans une grande boulangerie de Kinshasa et les livre à ses clients. José a travaillé pendant 15 ans comme boulanger. Il a commencé son premier commerce en 1985 en ouvrant une boutique qui a bien évolué jusqu’en 1990. Avec les évènements qui se sont succédés dans le pays tels que les instabilités politiques et les guerres, il a du changer plusieurs fois les activités selon les circonstances. C’est en 2004 après la fermeture de leur société (boulangerie), qu’il a décidé de débuter l’affaire des pains en s’abonnant comme client dans une autre grande boulangerie de la ville avec un capital initial de $50. José a aujourd'hui beaucoup de clients et son affaire ne cesse de prospérer. Le crédit qu’il a recu lui a permit d’augmenter la quantité de commande des pains afin de satisfaire le besoin des clients chaque matin et soir. Son activité lui procure un bénéfice dà peu près $300 par mois qui l’aident à supporter les charges de sa famille. Actuellement, son capital propre est de $560. José est âgé de 45 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants dont leurs âges sont 8 et 12 ans. Ils vont tous deux à l’école. Son ambition est d’ouvrir sa propre boulangerie.
texts.en:
José D. is a bread representative and also manages his own shop. He buys bread in large quantities from a large Kinshasa bakery and makes deliveries to customers. He has worked fifteen years as a baker. He started his first business in 1985 by opening his shop, which developed through 1990. With the events that followed, such as the political instability and the wars, he had to change his business several times according to the circumstances. It was in 2004, after closing their company (a bakery), that he decided to start a bread business by becoming a member client in another large bakery in the city with an initial $50 in capital.

Today, José has many customers and his business continues to prosper. The loan he received enabled him to increase the number of orders for bread, so as to satisfy customer needs each morning and evening. His business brings in a profit of about $300 a month which helps him to support his family. Currently, his capital amounts to $650.

José is 45 years old, married, and the father of two children who are 8 and 12 years old, and both attend school. His ambition is to open his own bakery.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a large amount of bread for delivery to customers in the morning and evenings

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes E. works as a trader selling foodstuffs at Ankwanda near Elmina.  She is single with three children and has received an education through Junior High School. She is responsible for paying for her children’s school fees and her family’s housekeeping money. Her loan will be used to purchase additional oil, tomatoes, charcoal, and kenkey. She hopes to use her profit invest in her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase additional oil, tomatoes, charcoal, and kenkey.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
El Sr.Pablo B. tiene 59 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Carapeguà, compañia Tajy Loma.  El es macatero (vendedor ambulante) con una antigüedad importante  el el ramo (20años).  El es separado, pero tiene una hija ya mayor de edad que es de profesiòn  docente y  viven en casa  propia. 

Sus lugares de ventas son las ciudades de San Bernardino, Itaugua e Ypacaraì, donde menciona que tiene bastante clientes, y que sus productos brindan mucha satisfaciòn.

Solicita un prèstamo con nuestra entidad para la compra de sobrecamas.
texts.en:
Mr. Pablo B. is 59 years old and lives in the Tajy Loma neighborhood of Carapegua city. He has been a street vendor for 20 years. He is separated, but he has a grown daughter who is a teacher and they live in their own house. He sells in San Bernardino, Itaugua and Ypacarai cities, where he says he has many clients and his products provide much satisfaction. He is seeking a loan with our organization to buy bedspreads.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bedspreads

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Since 2007 Jemimah E. has worked as a fishmonger selling fresh and smoked fish at Ankwanda near Elmina. She is married with 2 children and received an education through Junior High School. While Jemimah works as a petty trader, her husband is employed as a farmer. Her loan will be used to purchase additional fish for sale and she hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house for her family.

In the picture, she is standing where she smokes the fish.

loans.use: purchase additional fish for sale

loans.name: Jennypher Carolina

texts.es: La Señora  Jennypher  Carolina R. es originario de la zona 4 del departamento de Totonicapan ella su activid principal es la elaboracion de Canastos manueales  dicha actividad lo aprendio en las manualidades que realizaba en la escuela  recibio un curso en el Intecap para fortalecer sus conocimientos  y se contacto con un cliente para hacer un pedido y la cual le fue muy bien. Al mismo tiempo le sugio iniciar su propio negocio que tambien le esta funcionando, hoy necesita de un credito para ampliar su negocio ya que los materiales que utiliza son muy caros al compralos por unidad y con el credito estara  comprar por mayor le resulta muy favorable el precio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jennypher Carolina R. is originally from zone 4 of Totonicapan state. Her principle activity is making baskets. She learned this craft in school and took a course in Intecap to strengthen her knowledge and a customer contacted her to place an order, and that went well. At that time it was suggested to her that she start her own business that she is now also running. Today she needs a loan to expand her business as the materials she uses are very expensive to buy individually and with this loan she can buy at wholesale which will result in a more favorable price.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials for making crafts

loans.name: Christina

texts.en: Christina E. is a petty trader selling foodstuffs at Ankwanda near Elmina which she has done since 2004. She is married with 5 dependents and has received an education through Primary School.  While she works as a petty trader, her husband is employed as a farmer.  She is responsible for paying her children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase additional goods such as "gari" (cassava grits), maize, pineapples, cassava and plantains for re-sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to purchase land and build a house for her family.

loans.use: purchase additional goods such as gari, maize, pineapples, cassava and plantains for re-sale

loans.name: James Ben

texts.en: James Ben A. works as a pharmacist, selling over-the-counter drugs at Ankwanda near Elmina. He has done this since 2003.  He is married with two children and received an education through the University level. While James works as a pharmacist, his wife is employed as a trader. He is responsible for paying school fees, water and light bills, rent and also housekeeping money. His loan will be used to purchase additional pharmaceutical products to sell and he hopes to use the new profits from his business to continue his building project.

loans.use: To purchase additional pharmaceutical products to sell

loans.name: Ekuwa

texts.en:
Ekuwa T. is married with 6 dependents and has received no formal education. Since 2001 she has worked as a trader, selling foodstuffs in Ankwanda near Elmina. While Ekuwa works as a trader, her husband is employed as a fisherman. Ekuwa uses her income to pay for her family’s school fees and light bill.

She will use the loan to purchase maize, gari and fish for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekuwa plans to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase food for resale

loans.name: Jorge Emilio

texts.es: El Señor Jorge Emilio A. R. tiene la edad de 49 años, su estado civil es casado. La actividad económica de Jorge es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, ya que dio inicio con pocos productos, y con los pocos ingresos que obtuvo de su antiguo trabajo logro establecerse en su vivienda, y con los financiamientos recibidos ha realizado las mejoras a su negocio. Don Jorge es un Hombre muy amable y trabajador es por esto que el propósito de Jorge para su negocio es aumentar cada di en sus ventas garantizándoles a sus clientes sus productos. Con el dinero que solicita compraría más productos necesarios para su pulpería como granos básicos, golosinas, jabón, sal y otros productos. El mayor sueño de Juan es incrementar al máximo su negocio con los productos necesarios y predominar con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Jorge Emilio A. R. is 49-years-old and married. He has owned a small grocery store for more than 5 years. He started with few products, and with the little income he made from his old job, he was able to start his business in his home. With the financing he has received, he has been able to make improvements to his business. Don Jorge is a very friendly and hard-working man, and this is why his goal is to expand his sales every day and guarantee his products to his customers. With the money he is requesting, he will buy more products that he needs for his store like basic grains, candy, soap, etc. His biggest dream is to expand his business as much as he can with the products he needs to ensure his clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Silvia Maria

texts.es: La Señora Silvia María T. P. tiene la edad de 58 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Silvia tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña Silvia es una pulpería. Hace más de 17 años que se dedica a este negocio ya que por medio de su familia fue que obtuvo este negocio y ahora su interés es seguir con este medio de supervivencia. Silvia es una mujer muy luchadora a pesar de la edad que posee, es una mujer que le gusta este tipo renegocio. Sus propósitos para su negocio son de invertir lo suficiente para que mantener a sus clientes ya que es la única que posee pulpería en su comarca. Este el motivo por el cual solicita financiamiento destinado para capital de trabajo y comprar los productos que solicita como golosinas, pan, refrescos naturales, gaseosas y granos básicos. El sueño de Doña Silvia es que todos sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Señora Silvia María T. P. is 58 and married. She has 3 children, all of whom are in school. She has owned a small grocery store for more than 17 years. She obtained it through her family, and now she wants to continue it as her means of making a living. Silvia is a hard-working woman who likes this type of business in spite of her age. Her goals for her business are to invest enough to keep her customers supplied since this is the only grocery store in her area. This is why she is requesting financing that will go towards working capital and buying the products she needs like candy, bread, juice, soft drinks, and basic grains. Doña Silvia's dream is that her children complete their education.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Amparo Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Amparo del Socorro C. Jarquín tiene la edad de 60 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Amparo tiene 4 hijos y todos trabajan. Su actividad económica es la comercialización de mercadería en general. Hace más de 11 años que se dedica a este negocio. Ya que cuando inicio fue con muy pocos productos, como pinturas y ropa para niños. La ubicación del negocio de Amparo es de manera ambulante, y con el tiempo decidió incrementar su mercadería. Por lo que recurre a Fundación León 2000 y las organizaciones amigas ya que solicita es para capital de trabajo y así realizar la compra de los productos como pantalones, camisas, faldas, bolsos y cosméticos. El sueño de Amparo es establecer un negocio en su casa de habitación para ofrecer a sus clientes un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Señora Amparo del Socorro C. Jarquín is 60 and married. She has 4 children, all of whom are working. She has sold general merchandise for more than 11 years. When she started, she had very few products like paintings and children's clothing. She works as a street vendor and has increased her amount of merchandise over time. She is turning to Fundación León 2000 so she can increase her working capital and purchase products like pants, shirts, skirts, bags, and cosmetics. Amparo's dream is to establish her business in her home so she can offer her customers better service.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria Magdalena B. M. tiene 40 años de edad. Ella vive en su casa propia donde tiene una despensa la cual adquirio gracias a un pequeño ahorro que logro juntar.

Inicio su negocio en el año 2002 y está llevando el negocio adelante gracias a la dedicación y la buena atención que le brindan a sus clientes.

Doña Maria M.B. es una señora muy sacrificada por que se tiene que levantar muy temprano para viajar hasta el mercado de Abasto de donde compra las mercaderías para su despensa y así tenerla bien surtida.

Empezo a trabajar con la Fundacion Paraguaya en el año 2006 y comenta la misma que gracias a los préstamos su negocio va creciendo.

El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de mas variedad mercaderías ya que crece la clientela.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Magdalena B. M is 40 years old. She lives in her own home where she has a convenience store that she acquired thanks to some small savings that she was able to put together. She began her business in 2002 and she is growing her business thanks to her dedication and good customer service. Maria Magdalena B. M is very hard working as she has to get up very early to travel to the Abasto market where she buys merchandise for her store and in this way have it well-stocked. She began her businesses through the Fundacion Paraguaya in 2006 and she says that she is grateful for the loans to grow her business. The loan she seeks will be used to buy a variety of merchandise as her clientele is growing.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store: sugar, rice, noodles, oil, milk, general merchandise

loans.name: Ebenezer Group 3

texts.en:
The members of this group of entrepreneurs live in a community inside Los Alcarrizos named Eduardo Brito. This is located around 22 km north of the capital city, Santo Domingo. This community does not have nearby facilities like schools or hospitals and is quite isolated, which means the members of this group must travel long distances to restock their inventories and sometimes must sell outside their communities to make better profits. 
Many of them knew each other from before, as some of them go to the same church. Fatima F., who happens to be the group coordinator, is also the leader of the Ladies' Group at church. She is married and has 3 children. Fatima sells bedding items like quilts, sheets, and pillowcases. She sells them either individually or by sets. The sets, because they have more pieces, can be sold for a higher price. Sometimes, when she sells a set, she must do so on credit and the customer will pay her back in two or three payments. This presents a challenge for her: she must make sure her customers pay on time so she's not late with her loan repayments. 
Fatima was not able to complete primary education. She wants to give her 3 children the chance to go to school and study everything they want. 
Please help us support these entrepreneurs through this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: purchasing new bedding items, some bedding ensembles for sale

loans.name: Ana Victoria

texts.es: Ana Victoria R. L. tiene la edad de 30 años, su estado civil es casada. Ana tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. Ella es una mujer bastante entusiasta para los negocios. La actividad económica de Doña Ana es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio, poco a poco a crecido su negocio, por que tenia que buscar el medio de mejorar su calidad de vida. El financiamiento es destinado para capital de trabajo en la compra de ropa, camisas, faldas, pantalones, calzado, cosméticos y ropa interior. Los sueños de Ana son de proporcionarle a sus hijos la mejor educación para que el día de mañana tengan un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
Ana Victoria R. L. is 30 years old and married. She has 3 children, all of them in school. Ana is a woman who is very enthusiastic about business. Her economic activity is selling general merchandise. She has made a living in this business for more than 10 years, and her business has been growing little by little; she originally went into business because she wanted to improve her quality of life. The current loan will be used as working capital for purchasing clothing such as shirts, skirts, trousers, footwear, and undergarments as well as cosmetics. Ana’s dream is to provide her children with a better education so that they can have a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El señor Julio M. tiene 28 años de edad y vive con su esposa la Sra Paola Irala de 28 años de edad.  Ellos viven en su casa propia.

Don Julio tiene un transporte escolar, lo cual adquirio gracias a un ahorro que pudo juntar trabajando como mozo en el exterior

En la actualidad cuenta con mas de 50 alumnos a quienes traslada todos los dias a sus respectivos colegios.

Son personas sacrificadas ya que tienen que levantarse a muy temprana hora de la mañana para recoger a los alumnos para trasladarle de una Ciudad a otra.

Empezaron a trabajar con la Fundacion Paraguaya en el año 2008, y comentan que gracias al apoyo recibido con los préstamos este año tienen mas clientes.

El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de cubiertas para su transporte escolar.
texts.en:
Julio M. lives with his wife, Mrs. Paola Irala. They are both 28, and they live in their own house. Julio has a vehicle for school transportation, which he acquired thanks to savings that he put together working as a waiter in the exterior. Now he has more than 50 students he transports every day to their respective schools. They are people who make lots of sacrifices because they have to get up very early in the morning to pick up all of the students to transport them to one city to another. They started working with the Fundación Paraguaya in 2008. Thanks to the support received from the loans this year, they have more customers. The loan is to buy tires for his school transportation vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires

loans.name: Santos Daniel

texts.es: Santos Daniel es de la comunidad de Poxlajuj del departamento de Totonicapan desde niño aprendio el arte de la tejeduria siendo operario, hace diez años puso su propio Negocio  con su pequeño taller y con dos operarios  en la elaboracion de manteles y chalinas  que las entregava en la ciudad de Guatemala, hoy en dia esta  elaborando cortes tipicos especialemte para damas ya que la entrega en Salcaja Quetzaltenango y otros pueblos hoy necesita de un credito para surtir sus materiales.
texts.en:
Santos Daniel is from the Poxlajuj community in the state of Totonicapan. When he was a child he learned how to weave, operating a weaving machine. 10 years ago he opened his own business with a small shop and two employees, making tablecloths and shawls that he delivers to Guatemala City. Today he is making traditional skirts for women for delivery in Salcaja Quetzaltenango and other towns. Today he needs a loan to stock his supplies.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Olmit

texts.es:
S. P. OLMIT, pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SHIPIBAS” vive en la Av. Yarina entrando por la casa blanca, tiene 48 años de edad y 2 hijos.  Su pareja es mecánico.

Con el primer crédito que recibió de S/. 300.00 inició el negocio de venta de comida.

Actualmente cuenta con otro negocio de servicio de reparación de carros (vulcanizadota y mecánica), el mismo que ha mejorado.  
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, piensa invertirlo en  su local dándole mantenimiento, además comprará algunas herramientas necesarias para el taller.

“En un principio me fue muy mal pero gracias al apoyo de Manuela Ramos que fue confiando mas en mi pude salir de algunas dificultades, por otro lado me siento contenta por que siento  que mi esposo me valora mas como mujer y juntos trabajamos.
texts.en:
S. P. Olmit belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres Shipibas” and lives on Yarina Avenue near the white house. She is 48 years old and has 2 children. Her husband is a mechanic. With the first loan she received for S/.300,00 she began her business selling food. Today she has another business repairing cars (tires and repairs) and has expanded it. With this loan for S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, she will invest in maintenance of her locale, in addition she will buy some tools needed for the shop. “In the beginning it was bad but thanks to the support by Manuela Ramos that was given to me I was able to overcome some difficulties. I feel content because I fell that my husband values me as a woman and in our work together.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintain her commercial locale and buy tools

loans.name: Yamilet Del Rosario

texts.es: Yamilet del Rosario P. Rodríguez tiene la edad de 29 años, su estado civil es casada. Esta Joven tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio. Yamilet es una joven luchadora y trabajadora y es por eso que sus motivos son de mantener su negocio activo. Yamilet ha modificado su vivienda ya que sus productos no alcanzan y no posee una bodega para guardarlos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, golosinas, jabón, detergentes y gaseosas. El deseo de Yamilet es que sus hijos puedan continuar con este negocio para y además logren finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Yamilet del Rosario P. Rodríguez is 29 years old and married. She is young and has 2 school-aged children. She has had a small convenience store for more than 3 years. Yamilet is a hard-working young woman and she wants to maintain her business. Yamilet has modified her home as her products don’t last and doesn’t have a place to store them. She seeks financing for working capital to buy products such as rice, sugar, oil, candy, soap, detergent and soda pop. Yamilet hopes her children can continue with this business and also finish their schooling.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital to buy items for her store

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es: La señora Maria Antonieta es originaria del cantón Patzarajmac del departamento de Totonican ella cuenta con un pequeño taller  de bordados y cuenta con tres operario que son mujeres en la elaboracion de blusas bordados ha mano dicho actividad necesita de mucha concentracion y pasiencia ya que les lleva dias en estar realizando para finalizar un producto hoy necesita de un credito para la compra de accesorio  para diseñar nuevos productos dicha mercaderia las vende en el municipio de San Cristobal y Salcaja los dia Jueves y domingos en la plaza.
texts.en:
Maria Antonieta is from Patzarajmac canton in the department of Totonicapán. She has a small embroidery workshop and employs three women who help her make embroidered blouses. She says that making blouses by hand requires much concentration and patience, since it takes her days to produce a finished product. At present she needs a loan to purchase accessories for designing new products. Maria Antonieta sells her merchandise in the plaza of the town of San Cristobal y Salcaja on Thursdays and Sundays.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her capital

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.es: Doña Rebeca es originaria de Retahuleu con residencia en el paraje Coxomo del Cantón Patzarajman del Municipio de Totonicapan ella se deica a  satreria en diferentes tipos de costuras, delantales, pantalones, cortes tipicos ella aprenio el oficio en la ciudad de Guatemala  en las maquilas cunado contrajo matrimonio su esposo es sastre hoy en dia necesita un credito para la compra de una maquina de coseher, y sus materiales para una su operaria ya que se acerca la fiesta de la comunidad en dodnde tiene un pedido para las niñas de un uniforme.
texts.en:
Ms. Rebeca is originally from Retahuleu, but she resides in Coxomo, in the Patzarajman canton of the Totonicapan municipality. She is involved in dressmaking, sewing different types of aprons, pants, and traditional clothing. She learned this skill in the factories of Guatemala City when she got married. Her husband is a tailor. She now needs a loan in order to purchase a sewing machine and materials because the community festival is approaching, and she has to fill an order for girls’ uniforms.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sewing machine and materials

loans.name: Alba Nidia

texts.es: Alba Nidia C. S. tiene la edad de 51 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Alba tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan. Su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio. Alba inicio este negocio por que no tenía trabajo y ella que una mujer trabajadora decidió establecer este negocio en su vivienda. Alba tiene 3 financiamientos con Fundación León 2000 y estos han sido de apoyo para sacar adelante a su negocio. Por lo que sus propósitos son de incrementar sus ventas para su negocio. El financiamiento es par capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, gaseosas, pan, jabón y granos básicos. El sueño de Alba es trabajar con capital propio.
texts.en:
Alba Nidia C. S. is a 51-year-old single mother with 3 children who all work. She has been running a general store for over 7 years. She started this business because she was unemployed at the time, and being the hardworking woman that she is, she decided to set up a general store in her home. Alba has obtained 3 loans, which have helped her business grow, from Fundación León 2000. Her goal is to boost sales. This loan will be used as business capital so that she can purchase candy, soft drinks, bread, soap, and staple grains. Alba dreams of working with her own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Candelaria Odilia

texts.es: La señora Candelaria Odilia A. es originaria del departamento de Totonicapan con residencia  el cantón Coxomo que se localiza a 5 kilometros de Cuatro caminos  carretera que conduce a la ciudad de Guatemal su activida principal es la venta de ropa y confeccion ser una persona muy sencilla y responsable en su comunidad hoy necesita de un credito para comprar materiales  de techado de su vivienda, para no tener problemas en el invierno.
texts.en:
Ms. Candelaria Odilia A. is from the department of Totonicapan. She resides in the Coxomo canton, which is located 5 kilometers from Cuatro Caminos, the highway that leads Guatemala City. She makes and sells clothing for a living. She is a down-to-earth and responsible person in her community. She now needs a loan so that she can purchase roofing materials for her house in order to keep from having problems during winter.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase roofing materials

loans.name: Chester Danilo

texts.es: El señor Chester Danilo H. tiene la edad de 36 años, habita en el barrio Hialeah en Managua, junto a sus padres, don Chester se dedica a la agricultura y trabaja como guarda de seguridad para apoyar a sus padres ya que están a cargo de él, desde hace veinte años trabaja con la agricultura, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento, ya que esto a ocasionado que las matas de piña no estén bien coloridas y no se reproduzca al tamaño normal , el inicio a trabajar las tierras  con el apoyo de sus padres ya que cuando el trabaja sus padres quedan a cargo del cultivo , el financiamiento obtenido lo va invertir en la compra de de insumos y fertilizantes para lograr una buena producción y vender a buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Chester Danilo H. is 36 years old. He lives with his parents in the Hialeah neighborhood in Managua. Chester is a farmer and also works as a security guard to help support his parents. For the past 20 years he has worked in agriculture. The greatest difficulty for him is lack of financing, which has resulted in his pineapple trees not being healthy and not producing normal size fruit. He tends his fields with help from his parents, as when he is working his parents take care of the crops. This loan will be used to buy supplies and fertilizers so that he has a good harvest which he can sell to the market at a good price.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Johanna Lucía

texts.es: La joven Johana Lucia G. M., tiene la edad de 23 años, habita en el barrio San Juan, junto a su esposo, el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen  dos hijos , los cuales estudian , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida, ella desde hace 12 años trabaja como agricultora , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta son las plagas que invaden el cultivo , ella inicio esta actividad agrícola con sus propios esfuerzos y el apoyo de sus padres . El financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes. Para lograr una buena producción y poder obtener mejores beneficios en esta cosecha, da las gracia a la institución por los logros adquiridos.
texts.en:
This young woman, Johanna Lucía G. M., is 23 years old. She lives in the San Juan neighborhood with her husband and she helps him with the household expenses. They have two children who are still in school. Their plans for their family are to improve their living conditions. Johanna has been working in agriculture for the last twelve years and the biggest problem she has are the infestations that get into the fields. She started out in this field with her own efforts and the support of her parents. The financing that she wants is for the purchase of supplies and fertilizer, in order to obtain a good crop and get better profits when it is harvested. She gives thanks to AFODENIC for the successes she has achieved.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies and fertilizer to improve the crop.

loans.name: Tomasa Virginia

texts.es: La Señorita Tomasa Virginia es originaria del la comunidad del Canton Paqui del departamento de Totonicapan, ella es operario en una tejeduria en donde se fabrican cortes, manteles, y otros los patrones se han dado cuenta que es una persona muy trabajador, le digieron que consiguiera capital que hiciera su propio negocio. Y que ellos lo estarian llevando con los clientes, para entregar su producto ella muy ilucionada necesita el apoyo de la institucion en un credito para la compra de materiales y herramientas.
texts.en:
Ms. Tomasa Virginia is a native of the Canton Paqui community, in the department of Totonicapan. She works in a textile factory, where she makes traditional skirts and tablecloths. Some of her supervisors noticed that she is a hardworking person, so they advised her to obtain capital so that she can start her own business. They said that they would sell her merchandise to the customers. She is very excited about this business, but she needs support in the form of a loan from this institution so that she can purchase work tools and materials.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Sara Giovanna

texts.es:
SARA GIOVANNA SEPULVADA O., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SHIPIBAS, tiene 35 años de edad, 4 hijos, y su pareja es maderero.

Con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, se inició en el negocio de venta de frutas.  Compró diversas frutas para vender y poder solventar los gastos familiares.

Hoy, ella ha progresado con su familia y el negocio de su esposo ha mejorado.  Con este préstamo de S/. 1,800.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará más mercaderías para vender (frutas de la zona al por mayor).

“Manuela Ramos es una ONG que apoya a una gran cantidad de familias, con pequeños préstamos que permite a las mujeres de esta zona a iniciar o a mejorar sus negocios.  Estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
Sara Giovanna Sepulvada O. belongs to the "Mujeres Shipibas" Communal Bank. She is 35 years old and has four children. Her husband sells lumber. With her first loan for S/.300, she started a business selling fruit. She bought a variety of fruit to offer and was able to cover family expenses. Since then her family has made progress, and her husband's business has improved. With this loan for S/.1,800, she will buy more fruit (from the wholesale market). "The Manuela Ramos NGO supports many families through small loans that allow women in this region to start businesses or improve them. I am happy with their help," she says.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of wholesale fruit

loans.name: Patricia Mabeth

texts.es: La Joven Patricia Mabeth C. M. tiene la edad de 29 años, su estado civil es casada. Doña Patricia tiene 2 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Patricia es la venta de mercadería en general. Como todo negocio inicio con pequeños encargos, hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Por lo que anteriormente no tenia el capital suficiente, y con el paso del tiempo ha logrado incrementar con su clientela. Patricia tiene los propósitos de mantener a sus clientes para que su negocio siempre este activo y ofrecer una variedad de productos. Patricia solicita el financiamiento destinado específicamente para capital de trabajo y así realizar la compra de perfumes, calzado, ropa, bolsos ya que el viaje lo realiza en Managua. El sueño de Patricia es obtener una tienda ubicada en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Patricia Mabeth C. M., 29, is married and has two children who go to school. Patricia sells general merchandise. Like all businesses, she started out with small orders. She has been in this business for more than 6 years. Previously she did not have enough working capital. In time she was able to get more customers. Patricia plans to keep her customers in order to maintain an active business and offer a variety of products. She is asking for a loan for working capital to buy perfume, footwear, clothes and purses. Since she travels to Managua, Patricia’s dream is to have a store located in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: María Teresa B. T. tiene la edad de 44 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña María tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Doña María es la venta de ropa nueva y usada. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación del negocio de María es en las afueras del mercado, y desde muy pequeña comenzó a vender por su propia cuenta y con muchos sacrificios ha salido adelante con su negocio.  Debido a la difícil situación económica su propósito es de invertir cada día en productos que sus clientes solicitan. María  tiene 7 financiamientos con Fundación León 2000 y es por medio de esta microfinancieras que recibe el apoyo de las organizaciones amigas y el record crediticio es muy bueno. El financiamiento es solicitado solamente para capital de trabajo para comprar ropa nueva y usada. María sueña con proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda y el día de mañana sus hijos tengan un lugar humilde para vivir.
texts.en:
María Teresa B. T. is 44, single, and has 3 children who attend school. For over 20 years María has been selling new and used clothes. Her business is located outside the market. She started selling on her own when she was very little. Through much sacrifice she has gotten ahead in her business. Due to difficult economic times, she plans to invest every day in the products her customers ask for. María has had 7 loans with Fundación León 200. She has received support from friendly organizations via this micro financier. Her credit history is very good. The loan is solely for working capital to buy new and used clothes. María dreams of making improvements on her home so that in the future her children will have a humble place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Augusto Cesar

texts.es: El señor Augusto A., reside en un barrio que se llama Memorial Sandino en la ciudad de Managua, tiene 58 años de edad, casado, y con un hijo de 10 años de edad. Trabaja como vigilante desde hace 19 años el cual ha adquirido experiencia. Con este crédito quiere invertir en comprar  materiales de construcción para hacer las mejoras a su vivienda y poder dar a su familia una mejor comodidad y seguridad. Sus planes es pode seguir construyendo su casa, a si como apoyar a su hijo a que estudie.
texts.en:
Mr. Augusto A. lives in a neighborhood called Memorial Sandino in the city of Managua, is 58 years old, is married, and has a ten-year old son. He has worked as a guard for 19 years and has acquired a lot of experience. He wants to invest this loan in the purchase of construction materials for improvements to his home and to be able to give his family more comfort and security. His plans are to be able to continue constructing his house and thereby support his son who studies.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to make improvements to his house

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El Sr. Julio tiene 45 años, es soltero y posee un taller mecànico en su domicilio. Ademàs de esta actividad cuenta con un omnibus de transporte publico, el cual opera dentro de una empresa dedicada a este rubro.  El credito será de ayuda para la reparacion del omnibus, pues presenta algunos inconvenientes mecanicos que requieren su reparacion inmediata para seguir funcionando normalmente. Teniendo en cuenta que este es el medio de subsistencia de Don Julio. Pues el taller mecanico es muy modesto y no genera ingresos considerables.

El Sr. V. anhela poder adquirir otro omnibus asi como tambièn ampliar su taller mecanico y de esta manera seguir progresando en la vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Julio Vasquez, 45, is single and owns a repair shop out of his home. In addition to this, he has a public omnibus, which he operates for a business dedicated to this area. The loan will help him repair his bus, since it is presenting some inconvenient mechanical issues that require immediate repair to continue normal operation (keeping in mind that this is Mr. V.'s means of living). His repair shop is quite modest and doesn't generate considerable income alone. He hopes to be able to acquire another omnibus as well as grow his repair shop, and so keep progressing in life.

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bus repair

loans.name: Segunda Maria

texts.es:
SEGUNDA MARIA T. I., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES PRODUCTIVAS” vive en Av. Santa clara Mz.A.Lt.1, distrito de manantay, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 58 años de edad, 6 hijos, su pareja es maderero.

Se inició en el negocio de venta de abarrotes.  Con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró gaseosas y chupetes para vender y poder generarse otros ingresos.

Actualmente vende chupetes de diferentes sabores hechos con las frutas de la región como aguaje, cocona, coco, etc.  Ella ha progresado con su familia y el negocio de la venta de chupetes ha mejorado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,300.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará diferentes frutas de la región así como insumos como azúcar, bolsitas, etc.

“Manuela Ramos es una institución que apoya bastante a las mujeres, estoy agradecida por darme esta oportunidad y así poder invertir en un negocio que me permita aumentar mis ingresos”.
texts.en:
Segunda Maria T. I. belongs to the "Productive Women" Communal Bank. She lives in a district of Manantay, in the city of Pucallpa. She's 58 with 6 kids, and her partner is a timber merchant. She began a business selling groceries. With the first loan of 300 nuevos soles, she bought soda and popsicles to sell in order to earn additional income. Currently, she sells popsicles made of different flavors of fruits from the region, such as coconut, etc. She's progressed with her family, and her business selling popsicles has improved. With this loan of 1,300 nuevos soles, she'll buy different fruits from the region, as well as sugar, bags, etc. "Manuel Ramos is an institution that greatly helps women.
