I am thankful to be given this opportunity and to be able to invest in a business that allows me to grow my income."

Translated from Spanish by Todd Schmid, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and sugar

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: El señor José Antonio B., es un hombre que trabaja  desde muy joven para apoyar a su familia, tiene 38 años de edad, reside en el barrio Hialeah IV etapa en la ciudad de Managua, su esposa le tiene un hijo de 9 años de edad que estudia. El se desempeña como recamarero desde hace cinco años, su trabajo anterior era de vigilante y también trabajaba de albañil por que todo ingreso es útil para su familia. Ya que su anhelo es poder darle una casa digna. Con este crédito va  a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer un cuarto. Da las gracias a la institución por hacer sus proyecciones realidad, a futuro espera poder seguir haciendo mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
José Antonio B. has worked since very young to support his family. He is 38 years old and lives in stage 4 of the Hialeah neighborhood in the city of Managua. His wife has a 9-year old child that is in school. He has gotten by as a housekeeper for five years. His previous work was in security, and he also was working in construction because any income helps his family. His desire is to be able to give them a decent home. With this loan, he is going to buy construction materials to build a room. He gives thanks to the institution for making his projections a reality. In the future he hopes to continue making improvements to his home.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to construct a room

loans.name: Estela Benita

texts.es: Estela Benita Martínez tiene la edad de 49 años, su estado civil es soltera. Doña Estela tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan de forma independiente. La actividad económica de Doña Estela es una pulpería. Hace más de 9 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, ya que inicio para generar ingresos para su familia ya que no trabajaba y como toda madre necesitaba darles a sus hijos la alimentación necesaria. Los propósitos de Estela para con su negocio son de darle al cliente lo que solicita ya que muchas veces, no posee los productos que sus clientes piden. Estela tiene 12 financiamientos con Fundación León 2000 y todos han sido invertidos en capital de trabajo. Y así comprar productos como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, jabón, café, detergente, gaseosas y refrescos naturales. El sueño de Estela es convertir su pequeño establecimiento en una distribuidora y proporcionarle una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Estela Benita M. is 49 years old, her marital status is single. Estela has three children who are working and independent. A general store is the way that Doña Estela makes a living. She has this business for the last 9 years. The business is located at her home, she started it to generate income for her family since she did not work and like all mothers wanted to provide food for her children. Estela's intentions are to give the customers what they request, many times she does not have the products that her customers are asking for. Estela has had 12 loans with Fundacion Leon 2000, all of which have been invested in working capital. She is able to buy products such as rice, sugar, beans, oil, soap, coffee, detergent, sodas and fresh juices. Estela's dream is to turn her small establishment into a distributorship and give her customers better service.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
El señor Eduardo B. Díaz es propietario de un negocio de abarrotes de nombre “Williams” negocio establecido desde hace 8 años, perseverando para lograr sus objetivos y dedicándole el tiempo suficiente a su tiendita.
Don Eduardo le ha ido realizando mejoras a su hogar (lugar donde tiene su negocio), pero la necesidad que ahora presenta es la colocación del vitropiso en su tienda,para darle una nueva imagen,y por esto solicita este crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Eduardo B. D. is the owners of a grocery store called "Williams". He started this business 8 years ago, persevering to attain his goals and dedicating his time to his store. Don Eduardo has made improvements to his house (the place where he has his business). His current need is to install a tile floor in his store to give it a new look, for this he is requesting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of a tile floor in his store.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco A. tiene 48 años y esta casada con la Sra. Irma Nidia Orrego.  Ellos tienen tres hijos. El cliente es propietario de una despensa  bien surtida con articulos de primera necesidad (azúcar, arroz, mandioca, leche .huevos fideos, panificados, harina etc.) El negocio esta ubicado en un punto estratégico del Barrio Santa Ana a unos tres kilómetros de centro de Caacupe. 

El negocio funciona desde 1998 en donde trabajan toda la familia y ponen el mayor esfuerzo, para  que sus hijos puedan estudiar y ser profesionales.  El cliente realiza sus ventas todos los días en su domicilio en especial los días sábados y domingos.

El  dice que con los préstamos que le otorgo la Fundación pudo comprar mercaderías (arroz, azúcar almidón), así pudo aumentar su stock y brindar mayor calidad a su clientela. Su objetivo a muy corto plazo es de seguir comprando más mercaderías y agrandar más el negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Francisco A. is 48 years old and is married to Mrs. Irma Nidia Orrego. They have three children. The client is owner of a store well stocked with essential items (sugar, rice, mandioca ( a type of squash), milk, eggs, noodles, breads, flour, etc.) The business is located in a good space of the Santa Maria neighborhood, a few kilometers from the Caacupe center. The business is functioning since 1998, the whole family works it and put all their efforts in making their children able to study and become professionals. The client sells every day especially Saturdays and Sundays. He says that with the loans he received from the Foundation he has been able to buy merchandise (rice, sugar, starch) and increase his inventory providing better service for his customers. His short term objectives are to continue acquiring merchandise and increasing the size of his business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, starch.

loans.name: Mirtha Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Mirtha tiene 42 años de edad, reside en un barrio la primavera en la ciudad de Managua, su esposo trabaja en Agricorp, tiene un hijo de 7 años de edad, su negocio es una pulpería que administra desde hace siete años que inicio con prestamos, este es su segundo ciclo en Afodenic el cual va invertir en la compra de granos básicos, productos de consumo diario y otros que sastifagan a sus clientes. Sus planes a futuro es poder invertir más en la pulpería, poder hacer mejoras a su casa, a si como ayudar a su hijo a que sea un profesional.
texts.en:
Doña Mirtha is 42 years of age and lives in the Primavera neighborhood in the city of Managua. Her husband works for Agri-Corp. She has a seven-year-old son. Her business is a grocery store which she got started with loans and has been managing for seven years. This is her second loan cycle with AFODENIC and she is going to use it to buy basic grains, products of daily consumption and other things to meet the needs of her customers. Her plans for the future are to be able to continue to invest in her business and to be able to fix up her house, so as to help her son become a professional person.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La  Sra. Maria V.  tiene 46 años, está casada, y tiene un hijo.  El cliente es propietario de una mercería bien surtida con artículos escolares ropas en general.  El negocio esta ubicada en un punto estratégico para la venta, en un  barrio de la ciudad de San Bernardino a unos tres Kilómetros del centro.
 
El negocio funciona desde 1998 en donde Maria trabaja con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y que su hijo pueda estudiar y ser profesional en la vida. El cliente realiza sus ventas todos los días en su domicilio.

Cuenta que con los prestamos que le otorgo la Fundación pudo comprar mercaderías (artículos escolares, ropas para niños y adultos). Hoy día su negocio esta creciendo poco a poco con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio. Su objetivo a muy corto plazo es de seguir comprando mercaderías y agrandar el negocio así poder mejor y mayor atención a su clientela.
texts.en:
Maria V. is 46 years old: she is married and has one son. This client is the owner of a haberdashery well-stocked with school equipment and clothes in general. The business is strategically located for sale, in a suburb of San Bernardino town some three kilometre from the centre. The business has been operating since 1998, and Maria works hard and makes many sacrifices in order to provide her family with a better quality of life and so that her son can study and become a professional. This client makes sales everyday from her home. She recounts that with the loans which the Foundation have authorised, she has been able to buy merchandise (school equipment, adult and child clothing). Today her business is growing little by little thanks to her efforts and sacrifices. Her short-term objective is to continue buying merchandise and expand the business, in order to improve the services offered to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase child and adult clothing

loans.name: Videla

texts.es:
VIDELA S. D. SALDAÑA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas D. Pucallpa” vive en Asentamiento Humano 4 D. junio del distrito D. Manantay, en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene 59 años D. edad.

Con su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, inició su negocio D. venta D. alimentos, compró víveres para elaborar platos típicos, los mismos que ofrece a sus amigos y moradores D. la zona.

En la actualidad se dedica a preparar platos propios D. la región como juanes hechos en hoja D. bijao (planta regional) además hace tamales con productos D. la región, D. esta manera está  progresando y el negocio ha mejorado.  Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará más víveres, gas (combustibles), vajilla y otros insumos como arroz, azúcar.

“Me da mucho gusto D. trabajar con Manuela Ramos porque me permite tener un negocio y además me hace sentir que puedo lograr muchas sueños y confía en mi capacidad”.
texts.en:
VIDELA S. D. SALDAÑA belongs to the community bank "Small stars of Pucallpa" and lives in the "4th of June" settlement in the district of Manantay, in the town of Pucallpa. She is 59 years old. With her first loan of 300 soles, she started-up her business selling food: she bought provisions for making typical dishes which she offered to her friends and local inhabitants. Currently, she makes typical dishes from her own region such as "juanes" wrapped in a bijao leaf (from a regional plant). She also makes tamales with regional products and in this way she's the business is importing and she's progressing. With this loan of 1000 new soles, she will buy more provisions, such as gas (combustible), dishes, and other ingredients such as rice and sugar. She says "it gives me a lot of pleasure to work with Mauela Ramos because it has allowed me to have a business and also has given me the feeling that I can realise my dreams and have confidence in my own abilities".

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making food. Purchase of gas and dishes.

loans.name: Argentina Azucena

texts.es: Doña Argentina Azucena V., reside en un barrio de la capital Laureles Sur en la capital de Managua,  mujer trabajadora que desde horas temprana sale a ofrecer su acarreo en los diferentes mercado. El medio que usa es un carretón con caballos, lleva muchos años en el negocio y ha sido el sustento para su familia, tiene 46 años de edad, con seis hijos cuatro mayores y dos menores que estudian. Este es su octavo crédito en Afodenic y da las gracias por el apoyo que se le ha brindado con este préstamo va a comprar caballo chucaros para domesticarlo y luego venderlos a buen precio. Sus planes es poder hacer mejoras a  su casa, ampliar el negocio de acarreo.
texts.en:
Doña Argentina Azucena V. lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood of the capital city of Manaugua. She is an industrious women who goes out in the early morning to offer her transport services in the various markets. She uses a large horse-drawn wagon for this. She's been engaged in this business for many years and it has sustained her family. She is 46 years of age with six children, four adults and two younger ones who are still in school. This is her eighth loan with AFODENIC and she is grateful for the assistance which they have provided. With this loan she is going to buy untamed horses in order to domesticate them and later sell them for a good price. Her plans are to be able to make improvements to her house and to build up her transport business.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wild horses.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Victor Manuel vive con su esposa la señora Adelita Mata y tienen a un hijo pequeño, el trabaja para un empresa como chofer desde hace 5 años, contando con la confianza de la organización ya que demuestra lealtad para ellos; la señora Adelita  esta a cargo de de la familia y del hogar. Anteriormente tenían una tiendita de abarrotes pero por motivos de salud decidieron cerrarla, ahora que la están reiniciando requieren para comprar mas mercancía de acuerdo a lo que sus propios clientes le han ido solicitando, ya que se encuentran en un muy buen sector comercial dentro de su colonia.  
Este es el motivo por el cual tramitan este crédito.
texts.en:
Victor Manuel lives with his wife, Adelita Mata, and they have a small son. He has worked for a company as a driver for the last 5 years, having the company's confidence as he has already demonstrated loyalty towards them. Adelita is in charge of the family and the home. Previously they had a small grocery shop but for health reasons they decided to close it. Now they are re-starting it up and need a loan in order to buy more merchandise to match those things which their own customers have already been requesting, as they are located in a very good commercial sector in their suburb. This is the reason for arranging this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase stock in order to re-establish their grocery store

loans.name: Carolina Del Carmen

texts.es:
En las cercanías del Mercado Mayoreo en la ciudad de Managua, la señora Carolina G. se dedica a atender su negocio de joyería donde vende todo tipo de joyas para damas y caballeros y también brinda el servicio de reparación de joyas siendo apoyada por sus familiares y su hijo que tiene que mantener.

Actualmente ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las joyas y ya que requiere adquirirlas para su respectiva comercialización. Es por esta razón que muy confiadamente espera ser beneficiada con dicho crédito para proceder en el negocio y así beneficiar a toda su familia.
texts.en:
On the outskirts of the wholesale market in the town of Managua, Carolina Garnero runs her jewellery business where she sells all sorts of jewellery for men and women and also offers a repair service, being helped by her relatives and her son who she has to care for. She has now approached Ceprodel in order to ask for a loan in order to purchase jewellery she needs to acquire for sale. It is for this reason that she confidently hopes to be a beneficiary of the aforementioned loan so she can proceed with her business and thus provide for her whole family.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase jewellery

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: La señora Reyna Isabel Ponce, tiene la edad de 39 años, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, tiene tres hijos de 15,17 y 20 años, los tres estudian, su negocio es la venta de comida ambulante tiene once años en las venta que inicio con capital propio y prestamos en micro financieras, sus metas es terminar de hacer su casa y apoyar a sus hijos para que tengan un mejor futuro. Con este préstamo lo quiere para invertir en el negocio de la venta de comida, en la compra de granos básicos, verduras, carnes y así poder aumentar sus ventas y poder ofertar a sus clientes un mejor servicio es por eso que a futuro desea un local fijo donde pueda a tender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Reyna Isabel Ponce, 39, lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She has three children ages 15, 17, and 20. They go to school. She has worked as a traveling food seller for eleven years. She started her business with her own money and micro finance loans. Her goals are to finish her house and support her children so that they have a better future. With this loan she wants to invest in her food selling business by purchasing basic grains, vegetables, and meat. She will then be able to increase her sales and offer better service to her customers. In the future, she would like to have a fixed location where she can tend to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, meat and vegetables

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora María M. se dedica con mucho entusiasmo a su actividad de venta de verduras y frutas y en especial, venta de tamarindo los cuales son ofertados en su establecimiento donde a diario le visitan sus clientes.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra de las frutas para continuar con su negocio en el mercado y así abastecer a su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
In Managua's wholesale market, María M. works with considerable enthusiasm selling vegetables and fruits and especially tamarind, which she offers from stall where customers visit daily. Today, she has approached Ceprodel with the aim of being the recipient of a loan which would permit her to purchase fruits in order to continue with her business in the market and in this way supply her family with everything they need her support for.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo tiene 25  años, es soltero y  vive con su madre quien es viuda.  Su negocio cuenta con más de 4 años. El vende ropas de todas las edades y de todas las épocas. La inversión del préstamo lo destinó a la compra de ropas para la temporada de otoño e invierno, ya que en esta época es lo que presenta mayor demanda por los cambios climáticos.  Los ingresos que le genera este negocio le permiten cubrir los gastos propios de su familia (su madre) además de los gastos de su facultad (veterinaria). 

En este emprendimiento Rodrigo también cuenta con el apoyo de su madre que los días que acude a la facultad es la encargada del negocio y que lo hace con gran responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is 25 years old, single and lives with his widowed mother. He has had his business for more than 4 years. He sells clothing that fits all ages and all seasons. He is investing his loan proceeds in the purchase of clothing for the fall and winter seasons, since this is what is in great demand due to the weather changes. The income from this business allows him to cover the expenses of his family (his mother) in addition to the expenses of his studies in veterinary medicine. He also counts on the support from his mother in this undertaking, who on the days that he attends the university very responsibly takes care of the business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing for the fall and winter seasons.

loans.name: Elvira Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Elvira G. es una madre casada y con dos hijos que mantener el cual se dedica a su negocio de salón de belleza atendido por ella misma en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua.

La razón por la cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los materiales de trabajo del salón y así continuar adelante buscando la manera de cómo mejorar su negocio y lograr la satisfacción de todos y cada uno de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elvira Gonzalez is a married mother of two children. She supports them by running a beauty shop in the Mayareo market of the city of Managua. She is coming to Ceprodel to request a loan for the purchase of materials for her salon, this way she can continue to find ways to improve her business and achieve the satisfactions of each and every one of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for her business.

loans.name: Mirsa Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Mirsa Elizabeth Gutiérrez, su negocio es la venta de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos, desde hace siete años, el cual inicio con ayuda de su mama, tiene 30 años, reside en el barrio Sabana Grande, tiene dos hijos de de 6 años que estudian la primaria, con este crédito quiere invertir en la compra de perfumenes y cosméticos, para agrandar su inventario y aumentar sus ventas, este es su quinto ciclo en Afodenic que se ha beneficiado para mantener su familia, su negocio y espera seguir mejorando económicamente para el bienestar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mirsa Elizabeth Gutiérrez has been selling clothes, shoes, and cosmetics for seven years. She started her business with her mother’s help. She is 30, and she lives in the Sabana Grande neighborhood. She has two children, 6 years old, who attend primary school. She wants to use this loan to purchase perfume and cosmetics to have more inventory and increase sales. This is her fifth loan cycle with Afodenic, which has been beneficial in providing for her family and sustaining her business. She hopes to keep improving economically for the well being of her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfume and cosmetics

loans.name: Odily Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Odily C. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de ropa interior ofertada todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana en su propio tramo que tanto le ha costado brindarle las condiciones necesarias para trabajar.

Actualmente ella ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la ropa ya que al írsele gastando requiere invertir más en ella y para ello espera ser beneficiada con un crédito para continuar con su venta en su localidad.
texts.en:
In a wholesale market place located in the city if Managua, Mrs.Odily C. makes a living by running her business of selling lingerie. She wakes up really early every day to go and work at her store. She has her own space in the marketplace and she has worked hard to make it a nice place. Right now she is asking for a loan through Ceprodel so that she will be able to buy more pieces to sell so that she can increase her profits. She hopes that she can receive a loan so that she can continue selling in her store.

(Translated by Sonia of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase undergarments to sell

loans.name: Elias Ernesto

texts.es: El señor Elías Ernesto R., tiene la edad de 48 años, reside en el bario Villa Reconciliación en la ciudad de Managua, su esposa le tiene tres hijos de 3,16 y 17 años de edad, el se desempeña de albañil y destace de cerdo. El inicio con ayuda de su papa ya que le enseño el oficio para sobresalir adelante, el destace de cerdo ha sido otro ingreso para ayudar  a su familia. Con este crédito va a comprar llantas para su vehiculo ya que las que tiene están en mal estado, este vehiculo es de importancia para su negocio, por el acarreo de la compra de cerdo. Es te es su quinto ciclo en Afodenic el cual es de mucho beneficios ya que gracias a estos prestamos ha podido hacer mejoras  a su casa, con el préstamo anterior pudo hacer el sumidero para instalar el inodoro y estar en mejores condiciones de higiene. Da las gracias a la institución por sus metas alcanzadas.
texts.en:
Elías Ernesto R., 48, lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in Managua. He and his wife have three children ages 3, 16, and 17. He is a bricklayer and a pork butcher. He started with his father’s help. His father taught him the trade so that he could get ahead. Butchering pork has been another investment to help his family. With this loan he will buy tires for his vehicle. The ones he has now are in bad condition. This vehicle is important to his business in order to transport the pigs he buys. This is his fifth loan cycle with Afodenic, which is very beneficial. Thanks to these loans he has been able to make improvements to his house. With the last loan he was able to put in the drain to install the toilet and provide better hygienic conditions. He is grateful to the institution for the achievement of his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tires for his vehicle because the old tires are in bad shape

loans.name: Lino

texts.es:
El Señor Lino tiene 40 anos, con dos hijos, y esta casado con la señora Feliciana, la que le ayuda constantemente para la elaboración de las chipas. Actualmente fabrican 500 chipas por día y ellos empiezan su trabajo diario desde las 4am, por que antes de preparar los ingredientes deben ordenar su vaca la que le provee leche para su uso y también para la venta. El crédito recibido lo utilizo para la compra de materias primas y para reparar su horno que actualmente tiene y que ya esta un poco deteriorado.

Los ingresos que le genera este negocio le permite cubrir los gastos dentro del hogar.

El señor comenta que desde que recibió la ayuda de la Fundación Paraguaya y que soluciono el inconveniente con su horno, su trabajo lo esta realizando en forma mas ligera y buena. También ponen a conocimiento que varias personas de otras ciudades les hacen pedido de su producto para volver a venderlos. Ellos están muy conformes con su trabajo que gracias a la  calidad de sus productos cada día tienen mas clientes.

El señor Lino y su señora esposa están muy contentos por la ayuda recibida y da las gracias a la institución.
texts.en:
Lino is 40 years old, has two sons and is married to Feliciana, who is always helping him with making the "chipas", Paraguayan-style baked bread rolls. At present they are making 500 chipas a day, and they start their work each day at 4 am. Before they prepare the ingredients they have to milk the cow, for their own use and also for sale. The loan is for the purchase of raw materials and to repair his current oven which has some deterioration. The earnings that are generated by this business are able to cover all of his household expenses. Lino says that since he received the help of Fundación Paraguaya, and solved the problem with his oven, his products have been coming out lighter and better. Also they have begun to realize that people from other cities are buying up their products in order to re-sell them. They are very satisfied with their work, which is gaining customers every day, thanks to the quality of their products. Lino and his Lady are very content with the help they have received and express their appreciation to the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the raw materials to produce their product.

loans.name: Soledad Regina

texts.es: doña Regina es originaria de la aldea ChiP. del Municipio de Totonicapán su activida principalmente es la tejeduria que lo viene realizando desde las epocas del noventa hasta la fecha incico en esa época con telas laboriadas de diferentes colores, mateles hace unos cinco años este tipo de trabjo se fué desapareciendo ella decidio  cambiar de producto y la cual se dedico hacer cortes tipicos,para damas y la cual las entrega en el deaprtamento de Chimaltengo y Salcaja Quetzaltenango. Vista las oficina de la sucursal de ASDIR en un credito para aumentar su produccion.
texts.en:
Reginia is from the ChiP. village in the Totonicapán municipality. Her business is knitting, which she has been doing since the nineties. She started with fabric made in different colors. She made tablecloths, but for about the last five years this type of work has been disappearing. She decided to change products and make traditional clothes for women. She delivers them to Chimaltengo and the Salcaja Quetzaltenango department. She is asking ASDIR for a loan to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Keyling Liduvine

texts.es: La joven Keyling M. Hernández, tiene la edad de 24 años de edad, reside en Villa Reconciliación en la ciudad de Managua,  sus padre tiene un negocio desde hace treinta y un año de pintura y enderezado el cual ella también ha ido invirtiendo, ella trabaja de gestor aduanero, es casada y tiene un hijo de un años. Este es su tercer ciclo en Afodenic que se ha beneficiado mucho para su desarrollo en el negocio, con este crédito va  a comprar materiales de construcción para enverjar su casa para tener un poco de seguridad para su familia. Sus metas a corto plazo es poder mejorar condiciones del local de pintura,  en la construcción de un bajarete, para cubrirse un poco mas del sol como de las lluvias.
texts.en:
Keyling M. Hernández is a young women. She is 24 years old and lives in Villa Reconciliación in the city of Managua. Her parents have had a painting business for 31 years in which she has also been investing. She works as a customs officer . She is married and has a one-year-old son. This is her third loan cycle at Afodenic. She has benefited a lot from them to develop the business. She is going to buy building materials with this loan to put grating on her house for a little more security for her family. Her short-term goals are to improve the paint business premises by building a wall to protect them a little more from the sun as well as the rains.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase building materials to put grating on her house

loans.name: María Haydee

texts.es:
Actualmente, en el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora María S. se dedica a atender su tienda de abarrotes donde a diario lleva a cabo sus ventas desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el anochecer.

Es importante destacar que la señora S. es digna de imitar por ser muy trabajadora y muy entregada a su actividad. Como todo negocio en desarrollo requiere de inversión, el negocio de la venta de abarrotes requiere de la inversión en los productos y por esta razón es que ella espera en Ceprodel para obtener un crédito para la compra de los productos y así seguir mejorando su negocio.
texts.en:
In the biggest market in the city of Managua, Mrs. María S. tends her grocery store. Every day she sees to her sales from very early in the morning until nightfall. It’s important to point out that Mrs. Sequerira is worthy of emulation because she is such a hard worker and devoted to her business. Like all developing businesses, her grocery selling business needs an investment to buy products. She hopes to get a loan from Ceprodel to buy products and keep improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products

loans.name: Wilma

texts.es:
WILMA R. H., pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las estrellitas de Pucallpa” vive en Asentamiento Humano 4 de junio del distrito de Manantay, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 48 años de edad y 2 hijos.  Su pareja es taxista (transportista).

Con el primer préstamo recibido de S/ 300.00 pudo iniciar su negocio de venta de comida, con este dinero compró víveres.

En la actualidad vende una variedad de comida par todos los gustos, cocina platos de la selva, la costa y la sierra del país porque hay muchas personas de afuera que buscan ese tipo de alimentos por su rico sabor.  Con este préstamo de S/. 1 ,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará más utensilios como son cucharas y platos.
 
“Me encanta la cocina y para que los cliente se vayan contentos preparo varios platos cada día.  Aprendí con Manuela Ramos que como mujer puedo administrar mi propio negocio y así generar mas ingreso para mi familia.
texts.en:
Wilma R. H. belongs to 'Las Estrellitas de Pucallpa' (The Little Stars of Pucallpa) community bank in a squatter settlement called '4 de Junio' in the Manantay district of Pucallpa city. She is 48-years old and has two children. Her husband is a taxi driver. With her first loan of 300 PEN she was able to start her business of selling food, using the money to buy supplies. Currently she sells a variety of food for every preference, cooking regional dishes from the jungle, coastal, and mountain regions of the country, as there are many people from other areas that look for these types of foods for their delicious flavors. With this loan of 1,000 PEN, Wilma will buy more cooking utensils such as spoons and plates. "I love to cook and to make sure my customers leave happy, I prepare a variety of dishes everyday. With Manuela Ramos I learned how, as a woman, I can manage my own business and thus generate more income for my family."

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of kitchen utensils such as plates and cutlery.

loans.name: Yolita

texts.es:
YOLITA P. I., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJRES SHIPIBAS” vive en Jr Bellavista, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 58 años de edad, 3 hijos, y su pareja es jubilado (recibe pensión del estado).

Se inició en el negocio de venta de pescado, con el primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró una balanza y pescado para vender, cuenta con clientes frecuentes.
 
Hoy, ella ha progresado con su familia y el negocio de la  venta de pescado es rentable ya que en la Región contamos con 120 diferentes tipos de pescado.
Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, comprará pescados en variedad y sobre todo frescos.

“Me encanta lo que hago, cuento con clientes muy amables y todo lo que compro para vender lo vendo.  Si no fuese por aquel primer préstamo que me dió Manuela Ramos, hoy seguro que estaría en mi casa aburrida o quizás enferma, por ello doy gracias al apoyo que da Manuela.
texts.en:
Yolita P. I. belongs to the community bank “Mujeres Shipabas,” lives on Jr Bellavista, in the city of Pucallpa, and is 58 years old. Her partner is retired and receives a state pension.

She began a business in fish sales. With her first loan of S/ 300.00 Nuevos Soles, she bought a scale and fish to sell. She has frequent clients.

Today, she has made progress in her family, and the fish business is profitable. Already, the region has 120 different types of fish.

With this loan of S/2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, she will buy fish in different varieties and, above all, fresh.

“I love what I do. I have friendly customers and everything I buy, I sell. If it weren’t for the first loan that Manuela Ramos gave me, today I would surely be in my house, bored and maybe sick. For this I give thanks for the support Manuela gives.”

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fish in bulk

loans.name: Eliseo Gerardo

texts.es: Don Eliseo es originario de la Comunidad de Paqui a 8 Kilometros de la ciudad de Totonicapan don Eliseo su actividad principal es la confeccion  cuenta con su pequeño taller con quince maquinas de coseher, en donde cada operario  elabora  cuatro docenas por dia y el producto ya terminado don Eliseo los entrega en la Ciudad Guatemal, en Mazatenango, y San Francisco el Alto hoy necesita de un credito para la compra de materiales, ya que tiene un pedido muy grande
texts.en:
Don Eliseo is a founder of the Community of Paqui at 8 kilometers from the city of Totonicapan. His principal economic activity is embroidery. He has a small workshop with fifteen sewing machines in which each operator produces four dozen a day. When the products are ready, Don Eliseo brings them to Guatemal city in Mazatenango and San Francisco el Alto. Today, he needs a loan to buy materials since he already has a large order.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Cesar Agusto

texts.es: El señor Cesar Agusto S., tiene la edad de 63 años, habita en Lomas del Gavilán, en municipio de Nindirí, junto a su esposa , la cual le ayuda con los trabajos agrícolas , ellos tiene a su cargo cuatro hijos , tres varones de 12,11 y 6 años y una niña de de cuatro todos ellos estudian actualmente , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Cesar desde hace 55 años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que a enfrontado es la falta de financiamiento , sus sueños es poder ver a sus hijos con una carrera universitaria , para que no pasen todas las dificultades que el a pasado . Con el financiamiento va a comprar insumos y fertilizantes para mejorar el cultivo y poder lograr una buena producción que se venda a buen precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Mr. Cesar Agusto S. is 63 years old. He lives with his wife in Lomas del Gavilán in the town of Nindirí. She helps him with the agricultural work. They have four children, three boys 12,11 and 6 years old and a four-year old girl. They are all currently going to school. The plans are to improve living conditions for his family. Cesar has worked in agriculture for 55 years. The lack of financing is the biggest difficulty he has encountered. His dream is to see his children get a university degree so that they don’t live through all the difficulties he has. He is going to buy supplies and fertilizer with the financing to improve the crop for better production to sell for a good price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies and fertilizer to improve the crop

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es:
La señora Epifania tiene 45 años, esta casada y tiene un hijo. 

Su negocio tiene una antigüedad de 19  años. Ella comenta que anteriormente trabajaban en una cerámica de la zona y de ahí pudieron ahorrar la plata para poder abrir una despensa la cual hoy en día es su principal fuente de ingreso. Además de esta actividad realiza servicio de vianda a los empleados de una cerámica que se encuentra al lado.   La inversión del préstamo fue para la compra de mercaderías para surtir más su negocio.

Los ingresos que le generan estas  actividades le permiten cubrir los gastos familiares, también la cuota de su crédito y así poder vivir dignamente.

Al principio comenta que fue muy difícil porque no contaban con capital suficiente que se requiere para iniciar un negocio y que gracias al apoyo de la Fundación pudieron aumentar su stock.
texts.en:
Epifania is 45 years old, married, and has a son.

Her business is 19 years old. She says that, previously, they worked in a local ceramic shop to save money to be able to open a store, which today is her principal income. In addition to this, she runs a food service for the employees in a ceramic shop. The loan investment was to buy merchandise to stock up her store.

The profits from this work allow her to cover household costs and loan payments. In this way, she is able to live with dignity.

In the beginning, she says, it was very difficult because she didn’t have sufficient capital to start a business, but thanks to the support of the Fundación, they could expand their stock.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, noodles and sugar

loans.name: Hilaria Sabina

texts.es: La señora Hilaria Sabina con residencia en el cantón Nimapa del departamento de Totonicapan ella cuenta con su pequeño taller en donde trabajan diez persona, en la elaboracion de playeras, mochilas,gorras otros. ellas las entrega directamente a los clientes en Guatemala, San Francisco el Alto, con el taller que lo ha tenido mas de quince años les ha permitido darle educacion a sus hijos y que los hijos se estan especializando para diseñar nuevos productos y estar en la moda del Joven. Con el credito que solicita le permitira comprar  materia prima.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hilary Sabina is a resident of the canton Nimapa in the department of Totonicapan. She has a small workshop where ten people work, they manufacture shirts, backpacks, hats, and other things. They deliver the products directly to customers in Guatemala, San Francisco el Alto. The workshop she has had for more than 15 years has enabled her to provide education to her children. Her children are specializing in designing new products that are in fashion with youth. The loan requested will allow her to buy raw material.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La señora Rosa P. se ha destacado por ser una excelente cocinera teniendo su propio negocio de venta de comida en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua donde a diario se desempeña vendiendo los deliciosos platillos preparados por ella misma.

Hoy en día ha venido a Ceprodel con un propósito y este es el ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la materia prima para la elaboración y venta de los alimentos y así mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa P. stands out as an excellent cook. She has her own business selling food in the wholesale food market in Managua, where she sells delicious dishes prepared daily. Today she has come to Ceprodel to request a loan, so she can buy raw materials in order to manufacture and sell food, thereby improving the conditions of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
El Sr Teodoro G. es de la ciudad de Carapeguà y tiene  30  años de edad.  Vive actualmente con la Sta  Liliana y tienen una hija en edad escolar.  Ellos viven en casa  propia. Trabaja en forma independiente y también como empleado de una cutiembre desde hace 6 años hasta hoy, elaborando todo tipo de artículos que tiene relación con el cuero vacuno.

Como  no  pudo realizar  ningùn estudio  universitario, Teodoro buscò  un  empleo  como  medio  para  poder  sobrevivir  y mantener a  su familia.  Su  conyugue lo  ayuda trabajando como empleada  domèstica y con el  ingreso de ambos  logran  salir adelante. 

Con el crèdito obtenido comprarà cuero.
texts.en:
Teodoro G., 30, is from Carapeguá city. He lives with Liliana, and they have a school aged daughter. They live in their own house. He works independently, and he also has been employed in a tannery for six years. He makes all types of articles from cowhide. As he could not go to the university, Teodoro looked for a job as a means to be able to survive and support his family. Liliana helps by working as a domestic employee. Their joint income allows them to get ahead. He will use the loan to buy leather.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy leather

loans.name: Esmelda María

texts.es:
La señora Esmelda B. se dedica a la venta de mariscos en el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua siendo este su negocio con el cual mantiene su núcleo familiar compuesto por sus dos pequeños hijos en edades escolares.

Con el propósito de adquirir los mariscos, ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito y de esta manera continuar su venta en su localidad que tanto necesita de su inversión para crecer.
texts.en:
Mrs. Esmelda B. sells seafood in the wholesale market in Managua. The business maintains her immediate family, comprised of her two small children who are of school age. With the intention of acquiring seafood, she has come to apply for a loan at Ceprodel. This way she can continue to sell in her area, also making investments needed to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Hopkins, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase seafood.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
MARGARITA A. D. L., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SHIPIBAS”, tiene 58 años D. edad, 6 hijos, y su pareja es pensionista (venta D. alimentos).

La señora Margarita se dedica a la venta D. pasamanería.  Con el primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles, compró productos para abastecer su negocio.

Actualmente el negocio ha mejorado, tiene más productos que ofrecer a su clientela.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00 Nuevos Soles, piensa invertirlo en la  ampliación D. su local y en la compara D. 1 docena D. hilos, 1 paquete D. cintas para decoración, etc.

“Doy gracias a Manuela Ramos por confiar en nosotras que no podemos acceder a otros prestamos y sobre todo nos anima a seguir adelante pese a las diferentes dificultades que pasamos”.
texts.en:
Margarita A. D. L. belongs to the “Mujeres Shipibas” community bank. She is 58 and has 6 children. Her partner receives a pension (food sales). Margarita sells ornamental trimmings. With her first loan of 300 PEN she bought products to stock her business. The business has improved. She has more products to offer her customers. With this loan of 3,000 PEN she plans to invest in expanding her location, buying a dozen threads, a package of ribbons for decoration, etc. “I am thankful to Manuela Ramos for having confidence in those of us who do not have access to other loans. Above all, Manuela Ramos encourages us to keep going forward in spite of the different difficulties we have.”

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her business location.  Buy threads and ribbons for decoration.

loans.name: Julio Felix

texts.es: El señor Julio Felix P. Visito las oficina de la sucursal de Asdir Totonicapan en solicitar un credito para gastos de estudios  Universitarios  para la elaboracion de una tesis. para el no es gasto si no una inversion su activida principal de señor Julio es jefe de una agencia bancaria del departamento de Totonicapan es originario de una comunidad muy lejana.
texts.en:
Julio Felix P. visited the office of a branch of the Asdir Totonicapán to ask for a loan for the expenses of writing a thesis for his University studies. To him it is not an expense, but rather an investment. Julio is the manager of a banking agency in the Totonicapan department. He is from a community that is far away.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay educational expenses

loans.name: Rosa Micaela

texts.es: Doña Rosa es Originaria de la zona 1 de la ciudad procer de Totonicapán ella visita las oficinas de ASDIR para solicitar un credito que sera utilizado en la compra de materiales para la remodelacion de su hogar y su actividad principal presta sus servicios profesionales como maestra primaria rural en la comunidad de Chotacaj del departamento de Totonicapán
texts.en:
Ms. R. C. is a native of zone 1 of the patriotic city of Totonicapán. She visited the offices of ASDIR to request a loan that will be used to buy materials to remodel her home. She works as an elementary school teacher in the rural community of Chotacaj, district of Totonicapán.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Leng C., 26, is a woman living in Pursat Province. She earns a living cultivating rice on farmland she inherited from her grandmother. She is a widowed mother who cares for one minor child who is enrolled in school. She lacks capital for the upcoming rice farming season; thus, she has decided to seek a loan to purchase rice seed.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for growing rice

loans.name: Oeur

texts.en:
A thatch cottage located in Pursat Province is where Mrs. Oeur S. lives with other family members since 1979. Mrs. S. is 62 and her husband, Mr. Choum, is age 57. Currently they both make their daily income by planting all kinds of crops.

The old couple has seven children, six of whom are married and live independently, and they are working in different jobs. S. humbly requests a loan as capital to support her business operation by buying rice seeds for growing.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza A. is 41 years old and the mother of seven children. She manages a small farm on which her main crop is rice. She has buyers and she knows exactly to whom to trade all her produce. She wanted to grow her rice farm business. "Thanks to CEVI staff, (Kiva’s Field Partner) who helped me sustain our livelihood through the years", she said.

The purpose of her loan is to buy herbicides and fertilizers. These will do a lot of things to increase her yield.


CEVI is helping more people, especially farmers, to start a new business. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides and fertilizers

loans.name: Chhouk

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhouk T., 39, has been a local farmer for more than five years. She grows two types of crops: rice and vegetables, and she can plant twice a year. Usually she harvests and sells to buyers monthly. Her husband works with her in the business and they have seven children. All their children are students who always help with the crops when they are not going to school.
During the rainy season, T. lacks capital for the upcoming rice farming season. Thus, she has decided to seek a loan in order to buy seeds to begin planting crops.
T.'s husband is pictured.

loans.use: To buy seeds to begin planting rice

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Of the 70% of Cambodian people who make a living as farmers, one of them is Mr. Sok T.. He is 53-years old and runs a farming business. In order to support his business, T. has decided to ask for a loan from Kiva to be used as capital to buy fertilizers and more seeds. T. and his wife have five children. Two of them are married and live independently and the others are single and help with the farming work.
Mr. T.'s wife is pictured.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Bien

texts.en:
Mr. C. uses one hectare of farmland, located in Pursat province, for planting all kinds of crops. He and his wife usually grow morning glory, cucumber, and cabbage. Two months after planting, they harvest the crops and sell to a market seller for a profit. They have seven children, all of whom help with the crops.
Mr. C. is lacking capital to expand his business. He discussed this with his wife and they have decided to seek a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds and to raise a ridge for growing crops.
C.'s wife is pictured.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds, and to raise a ridge for growing crops

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma O. grows corn. She is 36 years old and has two children. She started farming after she decided to get married and have a family. She still has her cornfield. She sells all her harvest to her regular buyers in the nearby village. 

She is requesting a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. Some of the loan also will be used to start another line of business to supplement the family income.

Many times, Emma was down in her business. However, because of her strong partnership with CEVI, she was able to overcome the downturn. CEVI keeps its promise to provide easy access to loan services. In addition to that, she also receives training and insurance coverage from CEVI.

loans.use: To purchase one sack of fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa H. grows corn. She is 26 years old and has five children. She married so early she was never able to study in college because they didn't have enough money to pay her tuition. Her husband, Johnniel H., is a farmer. They have been working together in the farm to feed and clothe their children.

She is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy herbicides, fertilizer and other farm inputs. The loan will help her grow more corn on her farm. Corn is the second most commonly grown crop in the Philippines, and Adelfa is one of the corn producers who wish to increase the size of her farm for her family's sake.

CEVI has reached out to a lot of people, especially farmers, to sustain their livelihood. CEVI is organized to help alleviate poverty. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage services to support businesses.

loans.use: To purchase herbicide, fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Ni Made Rani

texts.en:
Ni Made Rani (DNR.M-0642) is a 41-year-old woman living in the town of Dsn. Anggasari, Ds. Ekasari. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ni Made Rani owns and operates a business raising livestock. Her main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. Ni Made Rani has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 400,000 IDR a month from this activity.

In 2007, Ni Made Rani joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditons and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Made Rani has successfully repaid a previous loan of 300,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to build shelter for her livestock. Ni Made Rani is now requesting a loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase medication for her livestock. This loan will be her third loan from DINARI. Ni Made Rani plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About DINARI:
The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socioeconomic development opportunities to small business owners.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Made Rani - (DNR.M-0642) merupakan 41 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Dsn. Anggasari, Ds. Ekasari. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Made Rani memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Made Rani sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 15 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Made Rani menghasilkan sekitar 400,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2007, Ni Made Rani bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Made Rani meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membangun tempat berteduh/kandang bagi ternak peminjam. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pengobatan bagi ternak peminjam. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Made Rani berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk membayar biaya sekolah anak-anak peminjam.

Tentang DINARI:
Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase medication for livestock

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita T. manages a small cornfield in her village. She rents the land for Php 1,000 and all her produce is sold to corn traders in the nearby town. Corn is popular in Agusan del Sur. People love corn a lot, especially when boiled. Teresita is 51 years old, married and has three children.

She is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy herbicide and fertilizer for her farm. Insects are very harmful to her crops. She wants to protect her corn from any form of infliction by spraying regularly with herbicides. 

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines. It provides not only loans but also training and insurance coverage services to support small businesses.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides and fertilizer

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: A medium-size wooden house located in Pursat Province belongs to Mrs.S., age 42. Since 2000, S. and her husband have been running a business growing crops. The family relies on both seasons for growing, including the dry season and the rainy season. Beside growing crops, the family has been widely known for a long time as skilled in raising pigs. Because of financial problems, they could not afford to raise pigs since their income is just enough for the basic needs of the family. Hence, Mrs. S. has decided to seek a loan from Kiva as capital to purchase piglets to raise. The couple has three teenage children who are attending school.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani

texts.en:
Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani - (DNR.M-0643) is a 33-year-old female living in the town of Dsn. Anggasari, Ds. Ekasari.  She is widowed and has 2 school-aged children.  To make a living, Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for her business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani has been engaged in this business for over four years and earns approximately 300,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2007, Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani has successfully repaid a previous loan of 350,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future.  Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be her third loan from DINARI.  Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani - (DNR.M-0643) merupakan 33 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Dsn. Anggasari, Ds. Ekasari.  Dia (perempuan) janda/duda (pasangan meninggal) dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 4 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2007, Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Ni Nyoman Putri Widiani berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk meningkatkan/memperluas bisnis peminjam.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Ni Ketut Ranis

texts.en:
Ni Ketut Ranis (DNR.M-0646) is a 35-year-old female living in the town of Dsn. Anggasari, Ds. Ekasari.  She is married and has two school-aged children.  To making a living, Ni Ketut Ranis owns and operates a business venture raising livestock.  Her main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale.  Ni Ketut Ranis has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately 250,000 IDR a month from this activity.

In 2007, Ni Ketut Ranis joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living conditions and ability to engage in business activities.  Ni Ketut Ranis has successfully repaid a previous loan of 200,000 IDR from DINARI.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  Ni Ketut Ranis is now requesting a loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.  This loan will be his third loan from DINARI.  Ni Ketut Ranis plans to use the additional revenue generated from his business to financially support immediate members of his family.

About DINARI:
The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socioeconomic development opportunities to small business owners.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Ketut Ranis - (DNR.M-0646) merupakan 35 tahun pria.  Dia (laki-laki) tinggal di kota Dsn. Anggasari, Ds. Ekasari.  Dia (laki-laki) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Ketut Ranis memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Ketut Ranis sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 8 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut Ranis menghasilkan sekitar 250,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2007, Ni Ketut Ranis bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Ketut Ranis meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli ternak indukan.  Dia (laki-laki) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli pakan ternak & pasokan lain.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Ni Ketut Ranis berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam.

Tentang DINARI:
Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Jero Ketut Pudak

texts.en:
Jero Ketut Pudak (DNR.M-0647) is a 46-year-old woman living in the town of Dsn. Anggasari, Ds. Ekasari. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Jero Ketut Pudak owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. Her main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. Jero Ketut Pudak has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately 300,000 IDR a month from this activity.

In 2007, Jero Ketut Pudak joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business activities. Jero Ketut Pudak has successfully repaid a previous loan of 400,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. Jero Ketut Pudak is now requesting a loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock to raise & sell. This loan will be her third loan from DINARI. Jero Ketut Pudak plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to supplement her family's income.

About DINARI:
The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socioeconomic development opportunities to small business owners.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Untuk membiayai hidup, Jero Ketut Pudak memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak. Dalam 2007, Jero Ketut Pudak bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Jero Ketut Pudak meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.
