*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha M. owns a small farm. She grows corn and sells all of it in the nearby village. From her income, she is able to send all three of her children to school. The profit goes to pay the tuition, books and other school fees. Her husband, Pio M., is a farmer. They have been together for 20 years already.

She is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy hybrid corn seeds and fertilizer. The loan will also help her start a new business. 

CEVI aims to help people improve their lives. They provide not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and hybrid seeds

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda H. manages a small farm. She is 57 years old and has four children in school. Although education is a very expensive investment, she wants to send all her children to college to provide them a brighter future. She believes that after school, all her children will be able to have their dream job and support their future families.

She is asking for a loan of Php 9,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy hybrid corn seeds and sacks of fertilizer to improve her business. Corn is a popular food in Mindanao and Florenda would like to take advantage of it to earn a living for her family.

For many years, CEVI has reached out to thousands of people to start and have their own business. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage services as well.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid corn seeds and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Oem

texts.en: The picture shows Mrs. Oem P. who is a modest villager living in Siem Reap Province, in Cambodia. She owns farmland in the village where she plants rice and vegetable crops to make an income. P. is a divorced mother who has given birth to five children who are still single. Two of her children help with the family's daily expenses by working in different jobs. One of P.'s daughters is selling grocery items out of the home. Recently, they ran out of grocery items. This is why P. would like an $ 800 loan. She plans to order additional grocery inventory to sell and the rest of the money will go to supporting the farming business.

loans.use: To order additional grocery inventory to sell.

loans.name: Olaberdi

texts.ru: Олаберди Сотиболдиев  1955 годарождения , женат имеет  7 детей. Все дети обустроены хорошо. Старшие сыновья имеют свои семьи, время от времени  помогают ему. Олаберди имеет 2  высшых образования , одно педагогическиое и второе бухгалтерский учет.  Работает он в школе бухгалтером. Но заработную плату с после новго года неполучал.  Поэтому дома  содержит большое стадо коров и коз. Сейчас стадо взрослых коров и коз пасуться на пастбище. Молодняк остается дома , потому что им трудно идти в дальную дорогу. Кредит получил на покупку скота, на эти деньги он купил 6 коров. Благодарен КИВА за поддержку и планирует  сотрудничать с Микроинвест и в будущем.
texts.en:
Olaberdi S. was born in 1955. He is married and has seven children. All of his children are doing well. The older sons have their own families, and from time to time assist him. Olaberdi studied both teaching and bookkeeping in college. He works in a school as a bookkeeper, but he has not received his salary since the beginning of the year. Therefore, at home he keeps a large herd of cows and goats, which he puts out to pasture; however, the young ones stay close to home, as it is difficult for them to travel a long ways. The loan he took out was for the purchase of cattle, and with this money he bought six cows. Olaberdi is grateful to Kiva for the support, and plans to remain a client of MicroInvest in the future.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Nicasio

texts.en:
Nicasio C. is a corn grower. He is 46 years old, married and has 3 children. He wants to grow his farm. He also dreams of venturing into other business opportunities to augment their income. As a father, he wishes to give the best to his children. Now, he engages himself in corn farming. It helps a lot to pay their daily needs.

He is asking a loan of PHP 10,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy sacks of corn seed and fertilizers. This loan will truly help him expand his business.

CEVI aims to help draw people out from poverty. It provides not just loans but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of corn seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
The happy face in the picture is Mrs. Rin P., 40, who lives in a rural area of the province of Siem Reap. Mrs. P. and her husband currently make a daily income of $5 per day working as carrying workers in the fish market. The couple has five children who are single; most of them are not long in school.

To help respond to the family's demands, two of their children work as carry workers at the same place. The family has been building their house for a long time but their house still needs spare parts. That is why P. has decided to seek a loan, to buy housing equipment to finish building their house.

loans.use: To buy housing equipment

loans.name: Net

texts.en:
Mrs. Net S. opened a small shop in front of her house for selling a few groceries. She sells her items to her neighbors who live near her house. From the business, she generates an income of $3 a day to manage her family's daily living. As the another source of the family's income, her husband catches fish in and around Tunle Sap Lake to sell at the market.

S. has been married for a long time but has no child and she plans to have a child next year. Recently, S. sold all her wares from her store. To earn extra income, she is applying for a loan to increase inventory for sale.

loans.use: To increase inventory for sale

loans.name: Zayba Group

texts.en:
Zayba is the group leader of Zayba group. There are two members in this group. Both of them would like to receive money for their business. They are very happy that this loan program is in this country.
 
Zayba wants to take a loan for her husband’s business, a general store, so he can complete his stock and buy necessary materials for his shop. Also Yaqot bakam wants to take a loan for her son’s bakery business. He wants to enlarge his shop.
 
They say that this loan can be very useful because its provides a chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand their business.

loans.use: their enlarge their businesses

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario G. is 39 years old, married and has 2 children. She is a corn farmer and trades all her harvest in the market by sacks. From her business, she has been able to raise funds to support her family needs. She wants to grow her business more so that she could easily send all her children to school.

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. She thinks that she needs to improve the soil condition of her farm to increase her yield. She also plans to start a new business to supplement her income.

CEVI is a non-profit organization organized to respond to the needs of small enterprise. It provides easy access to credit for all its clients. It also gives trainings and insurance coverage services to support businesses' growth.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Sarefa

texts.en: Sarefa is the daughter of M. A.. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan, and she has three children. She has a business running a beauty salon, and she wants to make her business grow. So, she requests an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 12 months. She says thank you to Kiva lenders who can support all the world.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora A. is managing a small farm. She grows corn close by her house. She is 34 years old and has 3 children. Her husband, Mansueto A. is also a farmer. Aside from corn, both of them grow vegetables in their farm. The income that Nora gets from her corn farm has helped a lot to sustain the whole family.

She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers. She thinks that by doing so, she will increase her yield. Nora is also interested to venture to other possible income areas. She needs a loan not just to improve her farm but to start a new business as well.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines. It provides not just loans but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides and seeds

loans.name: I Made Ardana

texts.en:
I Made Ardana (DNR.M-0644) is a 52-year-old man living in the town of Ds. Tuwed, Melaya. He is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To making a living, I Made Ardana owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. I Made Ardana has been engaged in this business for over 4 years.

In 2008, I Made Ardana joined DINARI, Kiva's partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. I Made Ardana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 400,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to rent land to raise additional crops.

I Made Ardana is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. The loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI. I Made Ardana plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

I Made Ardana - (DNR.M-0644) merupakan 52 tahun pria. Dia (laki-laki) tinggal di kota Ds. Tuwed, Melaya. Dia (laki-laki) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia dewasa. Untuk membiayai hidup, I Made Ardana memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah membudidayakan tanaman. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menanam & memanen buah & sayuran untuk dijual. I Made Ardana sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 4 tahun.

Dalam 2008, I Made Ardana bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. I Made Ardana meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk menyewa lahan untuk memelihara tanaman tambahan. Dia (laki-laki) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,500,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli benih, bibit, & tanaman muda tambahan untuk dipelihara. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. I Made Ardana berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk tabungan sebagai cadangan bagi keadaan darurat di masa mendatang.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Nadya Group

texts.en:
Nadya is the group leader of Nadya group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive a loan for their business.
Nadya and Gull Soum want to take a loan for their business of tailoring, so that they can expand and progress their business. Also, Nabylah wants to take a loan for her business of carpet weaving. Finally Shazya wants to take a loan for her husband’s business which is a car part shop. They all want to increase and expand their businesses.      
They are very happy with this process of gaining a loan in Afghanistan. It is a great help to poor people in Afghanistan and they are thankful that they can all be leaders in this process.

loans.use: to expand and progress their businesses

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn M. lives in Katipunan, Guipos, Zamboanga Del Sur.  She is 43 years old, married and has 3 children, all of whom are in school.  Her husband works at a public market as a ticket collector in Pagadian City.  Jocelyn has a sari-sari store as her source of income, which started with initial capital of PHP 3,000.  She wanted to expand her sari-sari store, so she applied for a loan of PHP 7,000 payable over 6 months from Paglaum Co-op.  The loan will be used to purchase additional stock for her sari-sari store.  Her sari-sari store income helps with their daily expenses.  She plans to purchase farmland as another source of income for the family.

loans.use: additional stock for her sari-sari store

loans.name: I Wayan Buda

texts.en:
I Wayan Buda is a 66 year-old man living in the town of Ds. Tuwed, Melaya.  He is married and has 9 adult children.  To make a living, I Wayan Buda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting fruits & vegetables for sale.  I Wayan Buda has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 500,000 - 600,000 IDR a month from these activities.


In 2007, I Wayan Buda joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,500,000 IDR from DINARI.  This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment.  I Wayan Buda is now requesting a new loan of 1,500,000 IDR which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  The loan will be the 3rd loan he has taken out from DINARI.  I Wayan Buda plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family.


About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Ghullam Yahya Group

texts.en:
Ghullam Yahya is the leader of the Ghallam Yahya group. There are two members in this group and they each want to take a loan for their carpentry businesses. Ghulam Yahya wants to take a loan to make his shop larger. M. Akram wants to take a loan to increase his stock and buy necessary materials for his shop.

With these loans, they can expand their businesses, support their families, and make a better future for their families. They are really happy with the process of small loans in their poor country.

loans.use: To increase the size of his shop.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana L. is engaged in the cosmetics trade. She sells lipstick, perfume, make-up, lotion, and other beauty products. She uses the income from selling these items to pay for her family's growing needs. Marciana is 40 years old and has four children.

She is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy more cosmetic products to sell. Marciana already has an established network of buyers for her products but she needs to have more items to accommodate all her customers.

CEVI helps people start and own their own business. It provides not only loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetic products for sale.

loans.name: Muborak

texts.ru: Муборак – 41 года. Она вдова и мать 2-х детей. У нее среднее образование. У Муборак было всего лишь 20 овец. Но теперь Муборак узнала о кредитовании нашей организации, и пришла брать кредит для покупки одной дойной коровы. Сейчас Муборак будет помогать ее брат. Кроме скотоводства, Муборак еще шьет национальные платья на заказ. Это ее дополнительный доход. Муборак очень рада что в трудный момент ее жизни наша организация помогает ей.
texts.en:
Muborak is 41 years old. She is a widow and a mother of two. She has a high school diploma. She raises cattle and makes national costumes. This brings her extra cash. Muborak used to have 20 sheep but she has recently found about about our organization and decided to apply for a loan that would allow her to purchase a milk cow. Muborak's brother is going to help her.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: cattle farming

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia E. is a food vendor. She is managing a small food stall to earn a living for her family. She started her business using her small savings. Until now, she was able to sustain her business. The income that she gets from cooking and selling food is what she uses to pay the electricity, tuition, and their other needs.

The purpose of her loan is to buy additional ingredients for her food business. She wanted to grow her business to give her children a bright future. Schools are very expensive that is why she is working so hard to support her children in their studies.

CEVI is reaching out to small business people to grow their livelihood. CEVI offers not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: I Komang Muriada

texts.en:
I Komang Muriada is a 35-year-old male living in the town of Ds. Tuwed, Melaya. He is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, I Komang Muriada owns and operates a business venture in the agricultural sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. I Komang Muriada has been engaged in this business for more than three years and earns approximately 800,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2007, I Komang Muriada joined DINARI, a Kiva partner, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. I Komang Muriada has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

I Komang Muriada is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. The loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI. I Komang Muriada plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small-business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

I Komang Muriada - (DNR.M-0649) merupakan 35 tahun pria. Dia (laki-laki) tinggal di kota Ds. Tuwed, Melaya. Dia (laki-laki) menikah dan memiliki 3 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, I Komang Muriada memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah membudidayakan tanaman. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menanam & memanen buah & sayuran untuk dijual. I Komang Muriada sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 3 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, I Komang Muriada menghasilkan sekitar 800,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2007, I Komang Muriada bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. I Komang Muriada meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli benih, bibit, & tanaman muda tambahan untuk dipelihara. Dia (laki-laki) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 6,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli benih, bibit, & tanaman muda tambahan untuk dipelihara. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. I Komang Muriada berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk membayar biaya sekolah anak-anak peminjam.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Nasema Group

texts.en:
Nasema is the leader of the Nasema group. There are two members in this group and each member wants to take a loan to expand her business. Nasema wants to take a loan for her tailoring business to buy new machines. Sakaba wants to take a loan for her husband's fruit and vegetable shop.

This group is requesting a loan of 28000 Afghani for the term of eight months. They are very happy to have this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy new machines for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Ni Putu Okayoni

texts.en:
Ni Putu Okayoni (DNR.M-0650) is a 28 year old woman who lives in the town of Ds. Tuwed, Melaya. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ni Putu Okayoni owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Ni Putu Okayoni has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 750,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ni Putu Okayoni joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Putu Okayoni has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Ni Putu Okayoni is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI. Ni Putu Okayoni plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate members.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Putu Okayoni memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah membudidayakan tanaman. Dalam 2007, Ni Putu Okayoni bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Putu Okayoni meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli pupuk seperti pupuk kandang. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio A. owns a small sari-sari store business. She is 40 years old, married, and has five children. She would like to improve the size of her store. She needs assistance to grow her business even more. The profit from her business goes to pay for the tuition and needs of her children. She started her business in 1993 using a small amount of money that she saved.

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI (a KIVA field partner in the Philippines). She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise, which will help her draw a lot more customers. In that way, she will have bigger profit.

CEVI is reaching out to more people to start and own their own businesses. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Mrs. Thon N. is 46 years old and lives in a small wooden house with her husband in Siem Reap Province. They have a workshop from which they sell electronic tools. Almost all of their clients are neighbors and other people who live near their village. Besides selling tools, N.'s husband also repairs old electronics for additional income.

The couple have no children but plan to birth a child next year. Because the family's business is growing and gaining clients, N. and her husband are applying for a loan to purchase additional spare parts.

loans.use: To purchase additional spare parts.

loans.name: Meua Group

texts.en:
Meua is the leader of Meua group. They are four members in this group and each of them wants to take a loan to progress their business and make it enormous.

Meua wants to take a loan for her husband's stationary shop. Gul Stan wants to take a loan to expand a general store. Now Gul wants to take a loan for her husband's fruit and greenery shop. Zaker wants to take a loan to expand a tailoring business. They are requesting a loan of 40000 Afghani for the term of eight months. They are all very thankful for FAS and Kiva lenders for supporting all poor people.

loans.use: To expand her husband's stationary shop.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.en:
Alfredo S. is a fisherman. He fishes and sells his catch in the village for a living. He learned fishing from his father. Now he is teaching his son to fish to have food to eat on their table. His wife Milagros is a fish vendor. They both buy fish from other fishermen to sell in the market. The income is what they use to buy their needs.

He is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy more fish to sell. Some of the loan will also be used to buy fishing materials like nets and baits. He will also have his boat repaired.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines. CEVI gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials and other fish to sell

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sriati

texts.en:
Ni Ketut Sriati is a 32-year-old woman living in the town of Tukadaya, Melaya. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ni Ketut Sriati owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products to the local community. Ni Ketut Sriati has been engaged in this business for more than three years and earns approximately 500,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2008, Ni Ketut Sriati joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Ketut Sriati has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to invest in renovating the business.

Ni Ketut Sriati is now requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the second loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI. Ni Ketut Sriati plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Ketut Sriati - (DNR.M-0651) merupakan 32 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Tukadaya - Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Ketut Sriati memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor ritel. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah membuka toko umum. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menjual produk makanan & barang kebutuhan sehari-hari di tengah masyarakat setempat. Ni Ketut Sriati sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 3 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Ketut Sriati menghasilkan sekitar 500,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2008, Ni Ketut Sriati bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Ketut Sriati meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk berinvestasi dengan merenovasi bisnis. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli produk tambahan untuk dijual. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Ketut Sriati berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk membayar biaya sekolah anak-anak peminjam.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sayad Ashar Group

texts.en:
S. Ashar is the group leader of S. Ashar group. There are four members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for her or his business to purchase more materials for their business and make a good income for their family in future.

S. Ashar wants to take a loan for his business of fresh fruit product and he wants to buy necessary materials for his shop. Jamelah wants to take a loan for her hairdressing business. Samera wants to take a loan for her carpet weaving business. M. Mabeyn wants to take a loan for his general store. They are very happy with this loan in Afghanistan.

With this loan they can make their businesses larger and support their families and make a better future for themselves and for their families.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for their businesses

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda J. owns a boat. She is a fish vendor. Everyday she goes out in the village and sells freshly caught fish. Her husband, Romualdo, is a fisherman. They work their best to earn a bigger income for their 2 children. Nilda is 38 years old. She wanted to construct a stall or store where she could display all her fish.

She is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fishing materials like nets and bait. She will also used the loan to buy more fish from other fishermen to sell.

CEVI is reaching out to people especially the poor to start a business for their families. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fishing materials

loans.name: Ni Putu Sri Wiriani

texts.en:
Ni Putu Sri Wiriani - (DNR.M-0652) is a 27 year-old female living in the town of Tukadaya - Melaya. She is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Ni Putu Sri Wiriani owns & operates a business making & selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fried foods in the local community. Ni Putu Sri Wiriani has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 500,000 IDR (~USD 45) per month from these activities.

In 2008, Ni Putu Sri Wiriani joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and have the ability to engage in business activities. Ni Putu Sri Wiriani has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. Ni Putu Sri Wiriani is requesting a new loan of 5,000,000 IDR which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from DINARI.  Ni Putu Sri Wiriani plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Putu Sri Wiriani - (DNR.M-0652) merupakan 27 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Tukadaya - Melaya.  Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 2 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Putu Sri Wiriani memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pangan.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah membuat & menjual makanan.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menjual makanan kering di tengah masyarakat setempat.  Ni Putu Sri Wiriani sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 3 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Putu Sri Wiriani menghasilkan sekitar 500,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2008, Ni Putu Sri Wiriani bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Putu Sri Wiriani meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli kendaraan pengangkut untuk meningkatkan bisnis.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli produk tambahan untuk dijual.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Ni Putu Sri Wiriani berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk meningkatkan kondisi kehidupan secara umum keluarga peminjam.

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

loans.use: To purchase additional food products to sell

loans.name: Voeur's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Voeur U., the man pictured in the photograph, has been selected to be the leader of this group by the other four group members. U. is a 70-year-old married man with seven children. He and his wife currently sell natural medicines, including medicines made from root trees. They normally go to forests far from their home to dig the root, and subsequently mix the medicines and sell them to patients. Unfortunately, their family is facing many difficulties with respect to their living conditions; in particular, their house is in need of some serious repairs. Therefore, U. is requesting a loan to be used to repair his house.

The members of this group live in Chong Kneas Commune, in Siem Reap Province. The other four borrowers in this loan group are: (1) L., a grocery seller who looking for a loan to buy more items to sell; (2) L., who catches fish for resale purposes with her husband, and who is applying for a loan to buy a boat for fishing; (3) L., a local fisherwoman who is seeking a loan to finish building her house; and (4) Y., who would like a loan in order to purchase a net for her fishing business.

loans.use: To repair his house

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un célibataire très travailleur, pour pouvoir subvenir à ses propres dépenses, il a appris le métier de la tapisserie qu’il exerce aujourd’hui. Il fabrique des meubles, des lits et des coussins qu’il vend à ses clients. Les matières nécessaires qu’il utilise dans son activité sont épuisées, pour se réapprovisionner il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter des mousses et des tissus.
texts.en:
This gentleman is single and a very hard worker. In order to provide for himself he learned the upholstery trade, which he practices today. He builds furniture, beds and cushions which he sells to his clients. As he has run out of materials necessary for his business, he is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchase foam and fabric.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of foam and fabric

loans.name: Aluka Opira Lillian Group

texts.en: Mrs. O. Lillian, 38, is widowed, with 4 children 2 boys and 2 girls (aged 20, 18, 16 and 12 years) plus 3 orphan. All the children are in school. She has been in her business for over 9 years. She had realized little capital. Now she is using this loan to purchase more sorghum flour, millet flour, and maize flour to expand on her inventory and improve on her capital. She is a hardworking woman whose dream is to educate her children and to complete her residential house.

loans.use: To purchase more sorghum flour, millet flour, and maize flour.

loans.name: Komlan Edouard

texts.fr: Monsieur A.  a appris la soudure, en 2004 il a ouvert son propre atelier de soudure qu’il a appelé «ETS TOUS UNIS ». Il fabrique des portes de maison, des grilles qu’il vend. Son matériel de travail est vétuste ce qui fait qu’il accuse parfois du retard dans l’exécution de son travail. Il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter des outils de travail. Il est marié à une femme qui est  couturière, il est père de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. A. has learned how to weld. In 2004, he opened his own welding workshop he called "ETS TOUS UNIS". He makes doors and gates for homes and sells them. His equipment is dilapidated, which results in him appearing to be late sometimes in carrying out his work. He's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy work materials. He is married to a woman who is a dressmaker. He is the father of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work equipment and supplies

loans.name: Mrs. Touch Mom Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of twenty four members, is located in Srae Ampil village in Kandal province. The loan that the group is seeking would be used for various purposes.

Mrs. Touch M. is the village bank president, and she was selected to this position by her fellow group members. She is a farmer who works on a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Since her plantation has been doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing another piece of land on which to cultivate rice. Additionally, she wants to use any leftover loan proceeds to buy fertilizer in order to grow additional crops. Her husband, Mr. E. Set, is a construction worker. Mrs. Touch M. is 55 years old, and she is the mother of three children. One of her children is employed in a garment factory, while the others are attending the local school.

All of the members of the village bank are shown in the picture, though some of thE. are not visible. Three group members are seeking so-called "end-of-term" (EoT) loans, whereas the rest of the members have monthly payment loans. Borrowers of these EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. Interestingly, EoT loans are AMK’s main loan product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor; specifically, they allow borrowers to repay portions of the loan principal whenever they are financially able to do so. In any event, most such borrowers start to make principal payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. Indeed, AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To expand her farming operations by purchasing land and fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. San Ma Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank is comprised of 18 people who live in the Srae Ampil village in Kandal province. They are seeking a loan which will be used for various purposes.

Mrs. San M., a 53-year-old woman, is the village bank president. She and her husband, Mr. Sam Tha, are farmers who cultivate rice for a living. On their plantation, they have two problems: they do not have rice seeds or fertilizer. Thus, Mrs. San M. decided to request a loan to purchase rice seeds and fertilizer. She has four children, three of whom are construction workers while the other child is attending the local school.

Seven members of this group are seeking "end-of-term" (EoT) loans, while the rest are seeking monthly payment loans. Borrowers of these EoT loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. Interestingly, EoT loans are AMK’s main loan product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor; specifically, they allow borrowers to repay portions of the loan principal whenever they are financially able to do so. In any event, most such borrowers start to make principal payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. Indeed, AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva loans.

loans.use: To improve her farming operations by purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Aluka Okech Agnes Group

texts.en:
Mrs. O. Agnes is aged 36 years and married with 4 kids (3 girls and 1 boy) plus 2 orphans who are all in schooling. She has been selling through a boutique for over 8 years. She is using the loan to purchase new clothes and new shoes.

O. Agnes is a hardworking woman whose stock is now big and she is contributing to the paying of school fees with her husband. Her dream is to have more stock than she has now.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes and new shoes

loans.name: Kossiwa Ameniuade

texts.fr: Cette femme est une résidente du quartier d’adidogomé, elle est mariée et a 01 enfant. Son mari est un maçon. Afin d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses de la famille elle a commencé en 2004 le commerce de pagnes, elle le fait de façon ambulante. Elle veut agrandir ce commerce, pour cela elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 20 pièces de pagnes de qualité « hitarget ».
texts.en:
This woman is a resident in the Adidogomé district. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a bricklayer. In order to help her husband in taking care of the family's expenses, she began selling pagnes (a type of brightly-coloured West African cloth) in 2004. She wants to enlarge her business, and for this reason she is seeking (through WAGES) her first loan to buy 20 sets of "hitarget" quality pagnes.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell pagnes (a type of West African cloth)

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Abdoulaye Traoré N. a 40 ans, marié et père de cinq  enfants, il réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants au quartier Hamdallaye de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Traoré après avoir mener plusieurs activités sans succès, s’initia au commerce de produits céréaliers et dispose d’une boutique devant le domicile conjugal où il mène cette activité d’achat et vente  des céréales ,maïs, mil, sorgho et pois sucré  il y a plus de 10 ans. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant   deux ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé le premier prêt il est à son deuxième. 
 Il compte  acheter, 1 tonne de pois sucré, 4 sacs de maïs, 1 tonne de mil et 5 sacs de sorgho.
 Il s’approvisionne à Lobougoula, Kadiolo, Kadiana, Fourou, Bougouni, etc. Les marchandises (pois sucré, mais, mil et sorgho) sont  ramenées pour  être  vendues à (Abidjan, Dakar et Bamako) en gros au comptant. Le pois sucré  est vendu aux usines qui en font des jus.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdoulaye Traoré N., 40, is married and the father of 5 children. He lives with his spouse and their children in the Hamdallaye district of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Mr. Traoré tried out several businesses without success, then began to sell cereals. He has a shop in front of their family home where he has been buying and selling cereals, maize, millet, sorghum, and sugar peas, for the past 10 years. He is much in demand due to the quality of his merchandise.

In order to satisfy his ever-growing clientele, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriaso two years ago. After having correctly reimbursed his first loan, he is on his second. He intends to buy 1 ton of sugar peas, 4 sacks of maize, 1 ton of millet and 5 sacks or sorghum. He buys his merchandise in Lobougoula, Kadiolo, Kadiana, Fourou, Bougouni, etc. The merchandise (sugar peas, maize, millet and sorghum) are taken to be sold in Abidjan, Dakar and Bamako, wholesale and for cash. The sugar peas are sold to factories that make juice out of them.

He expects to use this loan to make a monthly profit of 200,000 F CFA which will be used to increase his working capital, contribute to family expenses, pay the interest on the loan, investing any remainder into his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing cereals (maize, millet, sorghum and sugar peas)

loans.name: Hon

texts.en:
Mrs. Hon H. was born in 1958 and has been living for years with other family members in Battambang Province. Mrs. H. and her husband own a plantation that was inherited from their grandparents, on which they cultivate all kinds of crops. The couple has four children: one is married and lives separately and the other three are students, and they also help their parents' business when they are not attending school.

The family is lacking capital in order to support their business actions. Therefore, H. humbly requests a loan of $ 800 from Kiva's partner HKL to be used to buy fertilizers and seeds to grow.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds to grow

loans.name: Ajoga Athocon Hellen Group

texts.en: Mrs. A. Hellen is a 31-year-old married woman with 2 kids (a boy and a girl, aged 12 and 10 years respectively), 2 orphans, and 4 step kids, who are all in schooling. A. Hellen has been sewing clothes for over 10 years, tailoring Nigerian fashions of bitegi and also selling materials. She is using the loan to purchase more materials for bitegi. She is a hard working woman who is also helping her husband to contribute in paying the school fees of their children. Her dream is to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: To purchase more material clothings for bitegi

loans.name: Dodo

texts.ru:
Абдуллоев Додо Нарзуллоевич 1962 года рождения ,таджик ,женат, имеет 6 детей. 
 Жена Азизова Равшан проживает с мужем и детьми в г.Истаравшане.
 Клиент уже около 10 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Ему помогает сын Иззатулло.
 Клиент берёт займ 1200 сомони сроком на  10 месяцев.
 Дополнительный семейный доход он получает за счет реализации помидоров и огурцов, которые он выращевает вместе со своей семьей.
texts.en:
Dodo A. was born in 1962. He is Tajik. He and his wife, Ravshan Azizova, have 6 children and reside in Istaravshan. Dodo has been working in agriculture for over 10 years. is son Izzatullo assists him in this business. The family earns extra cash by planting cucumbers and tomatoes. Dodo is applying for a 10-month loan of 1200 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to grow vegetables

loans.name: Youssouf

texts.fr:
Monsieur Youssouf Berthé a 37 ans, marié et père de trois enfants,  il réside avec sa femme et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur  Berthé  est un mécanicien de formation qu’il a appris auprès de son père garagiste. En plus de la mécanique, il s’est initié aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment la vente d’articles divers pour la quincaillerie. La mécanique fut petit à petit  abandonnée au profit de la quincaillerie. En effet il possède une quincaillerie située au grand marché de Sikasso. Il mène cette activité il y a plus 5 ans. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits.
 Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  avec qui  il est à son premier prêt individuel.
 Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter 15 scies de différentes qualités, 4 cartons d’ampoules électriques (économique, néon, etc.), 10 boîte de colle, 15 cartons baquettes, 15 paquets de peinture, 50 mètres de fil,  5 pelles, 5 piques, etc . Les marchandises  sont achetées à Lomé pour être vendues dans sa quincaillerie en détail à une clientèle composée généralement des constructeurs de maison (architectes, entrepreneurs, maçons, etc.).
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Youssouf Berthé, 37, is married and the father of 3 children. He lives with his wife and their children in a big traditional extended family in Sanoubougou 1, one of the working class neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Mr. Berthé is a trained mechanic, a trade he learned from his garage-owning father. Besides mechanics, he started selling hardware to earn a living. Slowly but surely he abandoned mechanics in favor of selling hardware. Now he has a hardware store situated at the big market in Sikasso. He has been in business for more than 5 years. He is much in demand with his clientele because of the quality of his merchandise.

In order to satisfy his ever-growing clientele, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom he is on his first individual loan. With this first loan he intends to buy 15 saws of varying sorts, 4 cases of light bulbs (economical kind, neon, etc.), 10 pots of glue, 15 cases of rods, 15 cases of paint, 50 meters of wire, 5 shovels, 5 pick axes, etc. The merchandise is bought in Lomé to be sold in the hardware store, retail, to a clientele composed mostly of contractors building houses (architects, entrepreneurs, masons, etc.)

He expects to use this loan to make a monthly profit of 300,000 F CFA which will be used to increase his working capital, contribute to family expenses, and pay the interest on the loan, investing any remainder into his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hardware for re-sale

loans.name: Bisozi Group

texts.en: Jane is a married woman with 8 children.  Her oldest child is 24 and her youngest is just 12 years old. On top of the 8 children, Jane also cares for 3 dependents. Jane has been in the business of farming for the past 20 years. She has a large scale maize plantation and she also grows gnuts (gnuts are peanuts, and they are used to make a thick peanut sauce that is consumed throughout Uganda). Because Jane has a large scale operation her customers know she can always provide an ample supply of produce. This makes her a very competitive seller. Today, Jane is requesting a loan of 300,000 USH.  This loan will be used to buy pesticides and quality grains.  Jane hopes that her business will help her to get enough money that she can pay school fees for all of her children through university.  She says that if this happens, all her family and business dreams will have come true.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and quality grains.

loans.name: Charlotte

texts.en: Charlotte A. is a 39 year old widow.  She has 9 children and lives in Tuburan District, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del Sur.  Charlotte has applied to Pagalaum Coop for a loan amounting to PHP 3,000 (USD 75), payable in 6 months, so that she can purchase 2 piglets.  She plans that the income generated from the pigs after 4 months will help to cover the educational expenses of her children. She has also engaged in a snacks business which helps in providing for their daily needs. For other source of resources, she receives a monthly pension.

loans.use: To purchase 2 piglets.

loans.name: Gull Dasta Group

texts.en:
Gull Dasta is the group leader of Gull Dasta group. There are three members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for their businesses.

Gull Dasta wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring. She wants to buy a new machine for her business. Also, Nasema wants to take a loan for her husband’s business as a mechanic. He wants to buy necessary materials for his shop. And Raqya wants to take a loan for her son’s business of carpet weaving. He wants to make his shop larger.

They want to say that this loan is very useful for each one of them because this loan can provide a good chance for poor entrepreneurs to expand and become stronger in their businesses and lives. This group wants to thank this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To improve and expand their business

loans.name: Ajoga Glory Ocaba Group

texts.en: Glory O. is a married woman, aged 35 years, with 4 kids. She has 3 boys, 1 girl and 3 orphans, all in school. She has been selling paint for over 15 years now. She is using the loan to purchase Sadolin paint, which is the best paint, to attract customers and she will also purchase feed for poultry. She is proud because her standard of living has improved and she can also help others. Her dream is to own a machine for poultry feed.

loans.use: To purchase Sadolin paint and poultry feed.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en: Marina T. is 59 years old and lives in Katipunan,Guipos, Zamboanga Del Sur. Marina's husband works on the farm.  Her sari-sari store is still going, but her inventory is not enough to meet the demands of her customers. She has applied for a loan with the amount of PHP 5,000.00 (USD 125), payable in 6 months. This will be her 2nd cycle of project loan with Paglaum Coop. She will use the amount to purchase 4 cases of softdrinks, candies, noodles and other inventory.  Marina is determined to help her husband in providing for their daily needs with income generated from her sari-sari store.  She plans to have retirement savings and insurance benefits for their future.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Diakalia

texts.fr:
Monsieur Diakalia Traoré a 38 ans, marié et père de quatre  enfants, il réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie au quartier de Bougoula Ville, le centre ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Diakalia n’ayant pas eu à fréquenter l’école  s’est très vite initié à une activité de menuiserie  auprès de son père  qui était un  contremaître qualifié, très connu et très sollicité par la population Sikassoise. Après des années passées auprès de ce dernier, il  décide de s’installer à son propre compte. Avec  sa  grande expérience, il reçoit beaucoup de commandes, mais ses moyens sont insuffisants pour satisfaire tous ses besoins qui ne cessent d’augmenter. Il décida alors de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ deux  ans. Il est à son deuxième prêt individuel après avoir remboursé sans difficulté le premier.
Avec ce deuxième prêt il compte constituer un important stocks en bois de construction avec  un chargement de camion “10 tonnes”  en chevrons et planches et  un demi chargement de contreplaqués.   
 Il achète ces bois dans les localités environnantes (Tinkrela, Denderso, Lobougoula, etc.) avant de les scier et de les ramener à Sikasso pour en faire des charpentes, des meubles, bancs, tables-bancs, bureau, chaises  etc  afin de les revendre. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 250 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Diakalia Traoré, 38, is married and the father of four children. He lives with his wife and their children in a big traditional extended family in the Bougoula Ville district, in downtown Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Not having been able to attend school, Diakalia started up a carpentry business early on, together with his father who was a licenced master, well-known and much in demand in Sikasso. After some years of working together, Diakalia decided to set himself up alone. With his great experience, he receives lots of orders, but his finanacial means are not sufficient to satisfy all the ever-growing needs of his clientele. He decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso about two years ago. He is on his second individual loan after having reimbursed the first without difficulty.

With this loan he intends to stock up on construction wood with a truckload of 10 tons of rafters and boards and a half-load of plywood. He buys this wood in surrounding localities (Tinkrela, Denderso, Lobougoula, etc.) before sawing it and bringing it to Sikasso to make frames, furniture, benches, picnic tables, chests of drawers, chairs, etc. for sale.

With this loan he hopes to make a monthly profit of 250,000 F CFA which will be used to increase his working capital, contribute to family expenses, and pay the interest on his loan, investing any remainder in his business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of wood to make rafters, planks; purchase of plywood, etc.

loans.name: Toek

texts.en: Mrs. Toek S. is a villager in Phos village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Mun Tha, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate both rice and vegetables. Mrs. Toek S. is requesting a loan to purchase a motorbike to drive and transport her vegetables to sell in the local market. She is 39 years old and the mother of three children who attend the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to drive and transport her vegetables to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios V. is 61 years old and lives in Upper Lumbia, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del Sur. Her husband works as an ice drop vendor. Her source of income is generated from her dress-making.  She has applied loan of PHP 7,000.00 as her 2nd cycle of project loan. With the loan, she is intending to purchase curtain cloth, pillow case, shorts and pajamas cloth.  The income generated from her business helps in providing for their basic needs, an allowance for her grandchildren and loan repayment.  She plans to purchase another sewing machine, if savings merit.

loans.use: To purchase cloth to make curtains & pillow cases, tread, needle for dress-making business.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy F. has been engaged in the business of buying and selling beauty products and cosmetics since the past five years. She lives in Pag-asa, Dumalinao, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. She puts on display her fashion products during the market days in her village and in the neighboring town. She requests a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase more stock for her business. As of now, she limits her display only to nearby towns owing to expensive transportation fare. Hence, she plans to buy a multicab to help her move around to other towns to display her stock.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of combs, cosmetics, wallets, hairclips, lotions, mirrors, etc

loans.name: Idalyn

texts.en:
Mrs. Idalyn V. is a 32-year-old married mother of three children and lives at Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Her husband works abroad as a carpenter. She is hooked on to the idea of setting up a little "sari-sari" (variety) store. She thinks her family’s daily needs can be supplied by the income generated from the store. She says it's challenging facing everyday hardships, especially when she is far away from her spouse.

Idalyn has applied for a loan of PHP 8,000 as additional capital for the sari-sari store. In the future, the couple wishes to operate a bigger grocery store. They aspire to support their children’s educational needs until they establish their own careers. Idalyn maintains that all their sacrifices are for their children.

loans.use: additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma P. is a 47-year-old widowed mother of four children. She is a resident of Panaon, Misamis, Occidental, Philippines. She raised her four children all by herself after her husband passed away. She relies on her pension income and coconut farm to meet her family’s daily needs. Recently, she applied for a loan in Paglaum to start a hog-raising business. She plans to buy two piglets and sacks of feed. In the future, she plans to expand her business into a piggery and hopes that the business would take care of her family's future.

loans.use: To buy pigs for her hog-raising business

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Suon T., 40, has been a rice farmer for years. Besides her farm work, she always sells all kinds of fruits in the local market and earns an income of $4 per day. To help meet the family's daily expenses, her husband works as an internal staff member for an organization and gets a specific salary of $180 a month. All four of T.'s children are still single and attend school. Mrs. T. needs to expand her business by borrowing money lent from Kiva. She will use the loan to order fruits and rice to stock and resell to gain additional income.

loans.use: To order fruits and rice to stock and resell

loans.name: Okaba Agness Alumukeng Group

texts.en: Mrs. O. Agness is a married woman, aged 48 years. She has 5 kids, 3 of whom are schooling, and 3 orphans who are also going to school. She has been selling charcoal for over 2 years. She is using the loan to purchase more bags of quality charcoal to sell. Her dream is to bring more than 10 bags of charcoal.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of quality charcoal to sell

loans.name: Vińa

texts.en:
Vina C. has 7 children and lives in East Poblacion, Rizal Zamboanga Del Norte with her common-law husband.  

She’s now on her fourth cycle under the PDP-LP program, and is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000. Her common-law husband is a carpenter and also trying hard to support the family. Presently, her husband has a wood planer and wanted to buy equipment for his carpentry works. Vina wanted to help her partner realize his aimed carpentry equipments.

For added income, Mrs. Vina also sells snacks every day in a school near to their place. She hopes that she could have a steady business in the future that would be successful in their place.

She deeply wishes that she and her partner will be wed soon and hopes for all her children get a good education.

loans.use: To buy equipments for her husband's carpentry business

loans.name: Alumukeng Lumumba Night Group

texts.en: Mrs. L. Night is 39 years old and married with no children. She has been selling charcoal for over 3 years. She is now requesting a loan to purchase bags of charcoal. She is happy because she can help herself out and also help her community by supplying charcoal to them at fair prices. Her dreams are building a house and obtaining livestock for more wealth.

loans.use: To purchase bags of charcoal

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn V. is a rice grower. She is 51 years old and has 6 children. Her life is totally spent growing plants. Her parents taught her everything about farming. While her harvest is intended for family consumption, she sells some to her neighbor to augment the family's income.

She is asking for a loan of Php 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farm necessities. The loan will help a lot, especially her family by increasing their harvest.

CEVI helps her sustain and grow her business even more. She receives not just loans, but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy farming fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie E. is a pig grower. She is 51 years old and has 7 children. She always dreamed of having a bigger farm. She wanted to make her business grow to support her children who are starting their own families.

She is a former employee of a radio station in Mindanao. She quit her job because she married her husband, Moises E.. Now she is asking for a loan of Php 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy feed for her pigs. Presently she has 3 pigs which she is raising for fattening. She started her business in 2001 and until now was able to sustain her piggery.

CEVI helps her grow her business even more. She receives not just loans, but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase feed

loans.name: Kheun

texts.en:
Mrs. Kheun Y. has had a job as a rice farmer in the village since 1980. She is age 42 and the mother of four single children, three of whom are students, while the other one is a fisherman. She is married to Mr. Chek, age 39, who sells fish that he catches in the local public lake.

The family faces difficulty with transportation because they always need to pay a lot for taxis. Because of the problem, Y. has decided to seek a $500 loan to purchase a motorbike so that she can use it for the family's transportation needs. She intends to use 30% of the loan for her farming operations. (Mrs. Y.'s husband is pictured).

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for family needs

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria S. is a farmer. She grows rice a short distance from their house. She is 47 years old and has two children. Her husband, Jose S., is also a farmer. He is the one managing the farm. Maria worked previously in Manila as a salesclerk. She stopped working there because she was paid less by her employer.

She is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farm necessities. The loan will truly help her increase the yield of her farm. She is looking forward for the upcoming harvest once she can purchase the things she needs for her farm.


CEVI is reaching out to more people to help them grow their business. It provides credit assistance, training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and herbicides

loans.name: Kele Amia Grace Group

texts.en: Mrs. A. Grace is a married woman, aged 38 years, with 4 kids (3 boys and 1 girl) and 4 orphans, who are schooling. She has been supplying beans for over 7 years. She will use this loan to purchase beans in large quantities. She is active and her dream is to construct a house and educate her kids.

loans.use: To purchase beans in large quantitities

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima F. manages a small rice field in their village. Her harvest is intended for family consumption. The remainder is sold to rice traders for additional living expenses. Her husband, Gonzalo, also grows vegetables in addition to their farm. Both of them work together to provide for the growing needs of their five children.

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional stocks of merchandise for her store. She thinks that by doing so, she could attract more customers and increase her sales.


CEVI is a non-profit organization that aims to help small businesses to grow. CEVI provides all its clients with loans, training and insurance services to better support their clients’ livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Kele Oyella Agnes Group

texts.en: Mrs. O. Agnes is a married woman, aged 36 years, and blessed with 5 kids (all boys) and 2 orphans who are schooling. She has been making local brew for over 10 years. O. Agnes will use this loan to purchase yeast, millet flour, and sorghum flour for making local brew. She is doing well because she is able to pay school fees for her children and has improved her farm productivity. Her dream is educating her kids.

loans.use: To purchase yeast, millet flour, and sorghum flour for making local brew

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila G. is a sari-sari store (general store) owner. She sells variety of goods like rice, salt, vinegar, milk and much more to earn a living for her family. Her husband, Helbert G., is a farmer. They work together for the needs of their two children.

Prescila is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase additional merchandise for her store. The loan will also be used to buy fertilizers and other farm necessities.


CEVI is reaching out to more people to help them to start and establish their own livelihood. It provides loans, training and insurance coverage to help small businesses to grow.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for her store

loans.name: Aluka Bruna Osozi Group

texts.en: Mrs. Bruna O. is a married woman, aged 50 years, with 9 kids who are all studying. She takes care of 6 orphans. She has been in the business of selling smoked fish for over 20 years. She will use this loan to purchase more smoked fish and other things so she that she can improve on her farm productivity (millet, simsim, and sorghum). Her dream is to educate her children and still increase on her farm productivity.

loans.use: To purchase more smoked fish and improve her farm productivity

loans.name: Melchor

texts.en:
Melchor E. owns one hectare of land in Banga, South Cotabato in Mindanao. He is 58-years old, married, and has four children. He wants to expand his business. His wife, Erlinda E., is helping him manage their small rice farm. The income that they get from their farm is used to pay for tuition, books and other school expenses of their children. 

Melchor is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farm necessities. The loan will not only increase his yield, but will enable him to provide well for his family.

CEVI has reached out to many farmers to help sustain their livelihood. CEVI provides not only loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilzers and farm necessities

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Mrs. Kong B. is 55 years old and a resident of Battambang Province, where she earns a living by working as a domestic cultivator. Beside the farming business, Mrs. B. owns a small store next to her house and uses it to sell types of desserts to neighbors. She is a widowed mother who has eight children, three of whom are single and under her care, while the other five are married and live independently.

Mrs. B. wants her single children to have a suitable business. That is why she has decided to seek a loan as capital to buy grocery items for her children to sell.

loans.use: To buy grocery items for her children to sell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa B. owns and manages a farm. She grows rice that she sells to rice traders in their village. She also reserves some of her harvest for her family's consumption. Elisa is already a widow. She wants to expand her business to support her five children. She also raises pigs in her backyard. Her children help her raise the pigs for additional income.

The purpose of this loan is to purchase fertilizers and chemicals. She will also use some of the loan for her other business to supplement their income.

CEVI is a non-profit organization and a partner of WorldVision Philippines. CEVI offers not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and chemicals

loans.name: Aluka Riekotho Agness Group

texts.en: Mrs. R. Agness is widowed, aged 35 years, and has 4 kids - 2 boys and 2 girls – who are all in school. She also has 3 additional dependants. She has been selling silver fish (known as Omena) and samosas for over 15 years. R. Agness will use the loan to purchase more silver fish, wheat flour and peas for making samosas. Her dream is to educate her children and to construct a house and increase her farm productivity.

loans.use: To purchase more silver fish (omena), wheat flour and peas for making samosas.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma B. is a farmer and her main crop is rice. She sells her harvest in sacks to the rice traders in her village. She also saves some of her rice for family consumption. Alma is already a widow. She manages her farm alone to support her children.

She is asking a loan of Php 15,000 to buy the fertilizers that she needs. She is also interested in looking for some other possible income areas to contribute better to the family income.


CEVI’s aim is to help small business to grow. To achieve that goal, CEVI provides not just loans but also training and insurance coverage services to all their clients.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Djumagul

texts.ru:
Джумъагул Азиммуродова родилась в 1979 году в Шахристанском районе кишлака Шахристан.Она уже более 13 лет занимается животноводством. Дома имеет 7 голов крупнорогатого скота, откоромом и продажей которых и занимается Джумъагул.
 Она очень трудолюбивая женщина и дополнительно занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур, для того чтобы прокормить семью.
 Она нуждается в займе в размере 800 сомони на 6 месяцев для откорма скота.
Джумъагул замужем и имеет 2 детей. На снимке Джумъагул со своей младшей дочкой.
texts.en:
Djumagul A. was born in 1979 in the region of Shahristan village. She has been in the animal husbandry business for more than thirteen years. She has seven heads of large cattle at home which she feeds and sells. She is a very hardworking woman and she additionally grows some vegetables to feed the family. She needs a loan of 800 somoni ($225USD) for a term of six months for raising and feeding the cattle. Djumagul is married and has two children. Djumagul is with her younger daughter on the photo.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding and selling cattle

loans.name: Meira Okwong Betta Group

texts.en: Mrs. O. Betta is a married woman, aged 50 years. She has 9 children and 11 orphans. She has been making pancakes and frying ground nuts for over 20 years. She will use the loan to purchase ground nuts and cassava flour, sweet bananas and cooking oil for baking pancakes. With this loan, her business will expand. She is actively dreaming to purchase a bicycle.

loans.use: To purchase ground nuts and cassava flour, sweet bananas, cooking oil for baking pancakes.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe L. has a small rice field. She is married to a farmer, Rogelio L., and has three children. Her husband is the one managing their farm. She just inherited the farm from her parents and hopes to make it productive in their honor.

Fe is requesting a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and chemicals to increase her farm's yield. The loan will help her family a lot to increase its income.


CEVI's aim is to help people grow their small businesses. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilzers and chemicals for her farm

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon D. is a pig grower. He has been into this business since 2006. He was convinced to pursue raising pigs because, aside from the fact that he loves pigs so much, he has earned a lot of profit since he started his business. As the head of the family, Gideon work very hard to succeed in this kind of endeavor to support the needs of his family.
