Gideon is asking for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy pig feed. Currently he has five pigs for fattening. He needs support, especially in buying the feed, to sustain his business.


CEVI helps people to grow their business. It provides all its clients not only with loans but with training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase feed for his pigs

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila G. is a rice farmer. She is 50 years old and has two children. She wants to grow her business to be able to support the needs of her children. She has previous work experience in a factory. She was not happy about her job because her employer paid her less. She decided to quit her job and went home to manage a farm instead.

She is asking a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farm necessities. The loan will really help her whole family to have a better harvest.

CEVI is helping her sustain her livelihood. She is provided not only loans but also training and insurance coverage to help her grow her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Джурабек

texts.ru:
Джурабек Бегбутаев занимается животноводством около 8 лет. Он проживает вместе со своей женой и двумя детьми в Шахристанском районе. Джурабеку 26 лет имеет среднее образование, по национальности  узбек. Жена Бегбутаева Машхура домохозяйка, занимается воспитанием детей и помогает мужу. Добывает, перерабатывает и продает молоко. Это их дополнительный зароботок.
 Джурабек хочет получить займ и использовать его для откорма скота и переработки молока, так как дома он имеет 7 голов крупного рогатого скота. Он считает что сумма займа в размере 1600 сомони на 6 месяцев поможет ему решить свои проблемы в животноводстве.
texts.en:
Jurabek Begbutaev has been raising livestock for around 8 years. He lives together with his wife and two children in the Shahristan region. Jurabek is 26 years old, he has a high school education and his nationality is Uzbek. His wife, Mashhura Begbutaeva, is a homemaker; she raises the children and helps her husband. She gets, processes and sells milk. This is their supplementary income. Jurabek would like to get a loan and use to fatten livestock and process milk, as he has 7 heads of cattle at home. He believes that a sum of 1600 somoni for 6 months will help him to solve his livestock problems.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fatten livestock

loans.name: Gaville

texts.en:
Gavile E. is a rice grower. She sells most of her harvest to the rice traders and saves a little for family consumption. She is 48 years old, married, and has six children in school. Her husband, Ruel E., manages the farm. They work their hardest to support the whole family’s needs. Aside from rice, Gavile also raises pigs and cows at the same time. She thinks that by doing so she will be able to earn more money to fulfill other needs and send her children to school easily. She is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. The loan will really help the whole family have a better harvest.

CEVI's mission is to help small businesses grow. To achieve its goal, CEVI provides more than just loans to all its clients. It provides training and insurance coverage services as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Mademoiselle  sassou afi habite le quartier d’adidogimé, pour subvenir à ses propres besoins elle a appris le métier de la coiffure et a ouvert en 2001 son atelier de coiffure, à ce métier elle a ajouté la vente de mèches, perruques et de tissages qu’elle vend à ses clients. Son stock de mèches est épuisé, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour renouveler son stock de mèches, perruques et tissages.
texts.en:
Miss Afi Sassou lives in the Adidogomé district. To meet her own needs, she trained to become a hairstylist and opened her own hair salon in 2001. In addition to this work, she sells hair extensions, wigs, and hair weaves to her customers. Her stock of hair extensions is depleted, so she is seeking (through WAGES) her first loan to renew her supplies of hair extensions, wigs, and hair weaves.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions and hair weaves

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio F. is a rice grower. He is 58 years old and has five children. His wife, Girlie F., is the one taking care of their children. Antonio wants to provide for all the needs of his children. To achieve his goal, he established his own sari-sari store (general store) in front of their house in 1985. Until now, he has been able to sustain his business and make it a little bigger.

Antonio is asking for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for his store. The loan will really help him attract more customers. In that way, he thinks it would be easy for him to send all his children to college.


CEVI is reaching out to more people to help them start and have their own business. CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for his sari-sari store

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.fr: Cette dame est une veuve qui a à sa charge 04 enfants, l’activité qu’elle exerce et qui lui permet de subvenir aux charges de ses enfants est le commerce de charbons de bois dans son quartier, la plupart de ses clientes sont les femmes de son quartier. Actuellement elle veut agrandir son stock pour mieux vendre et subvenir convenablement aux charges de sa famille raison pour laquelle sollicite de WAGES un deuxième crédit, elle a déjà obtenu un premier crédit qu’elle a complètement remboursé.
texts.en:
This lady is a widow with four children in her care. The business she runs and which allows her to meet the needs of her children is the sale of charcoal in her area. The majority of her clients are women from her locality. Currently, she wants to enlarge her stock to sell better and more adequately meet the needs of her family; for this reason, she is seeking (through WAGES) her second loan. She has already obtained one previous loan, which she repaid completely.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell charcoal

loans.name: Joseph Ben

texts.en: Joseph Ben E. is married with 3 children and has received an education through Junior High School. Since 2002 Joseph has worked as a trader selling fishing materials at Moree, near Elmina. His wife also works as a trader in the Elmina area. Joseph Ben uses his income to pay for his children’s school fees and also the family’s light and water bills.  He will use the loan to purchase fishing nets, floats and spooks. With the new profits from his expanded business, Joseph Ben plans to build a house for his family.

loans.use: He will use the loan to purchase fishing nets, floats and spooks.

loans.name: Muazzam

texts.ru: Косимова Муаззам хочет параллельно получить кредит на закуп сезонного ассортимента товаров. Она продаёт женскую одежду, колготки , носки и нижнее бельё.  Предыдущий займ она потратила на закуп зимнего ассортимента, а сезонного у неё мало. Поэтому она решила съездить в Истаравшан и привести товар. Муаззам хорошо погашает свой кредит и имеет постоянный поток клиентов. Микроинвест рад сотрудничать с такими клиентами , как Косимова Муаззам.
texts.en:
Muazzam K. wants to take out another loan in order to purchase a selection of seasonal goods. She sells women's clothing, stocking, socks and undergarments. She spent the previous loan on the purchase of winter items, but she has little for the current season. Therefore, she decided to go to Istaravshan on a buying trip. Muazzam makes her loan payments on time and has a steady stream of customers. MicroInvest is pleased to work with such clients as Muazzam K..

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of women's undergarments

loans.name: Rahbaroy

texts.ru: Орзиева Рахбарой , женщина в возрасте 35 лет , замужем , имеет троих детей. Рахбарой работает медсестрой в больнице Паласса. Её заработная плата очень низкая, поэтому она вместе с мужем занимается откормом и продажей скота. Также у неё дома имеется большой земельный участок, на котором она посадила огурцы и помидоры. В период закруток Рахбарой будет консервировать свои овощи с огорода. У  Рахбарой отец наш давнишний клиент , который кредитуется для бизнеса животноводства. Он посоветовал своей дочери увеличить скот , пока он дешёвый на рынке. Сейчас у Рахбарой три коровы, на снимке одна из них. Поэтому Рахбарой обратилась к нам.
texts.en:
Rahbaroy O. is a 35-year-old married woman, who has three children. She works as a nurse in the Palassa hospital. However, her salary is very low, and this is why Rahbaroy and her husband are involved in livestock feeding and sales. She also has a large plot of land at home where she planted cucumbers and tomatoes. Rahbaroy plans to can the vegetables from her garden. Rahbaroy’s father is a long-time client of ours. He obtains financing for his animal husbandry business. He is also the one who advised his daughter to increase her livestock headcount while livestock market prices are low. Rahbaroy now owns three cows, one of which is pictured here. This is why Rahbaroy requested this loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Nozira

texts.ru:
Муминджонова Нозира 1950 года рождения, таджичка,образование среднее.Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Постоянное ее место работы, вот уже 15 лет, это овощной рынок города Истаравшана. Она торгует фруктами, в основном арбузами. И в этом ей помогает ее внучка - Фарзонаи Хасан.
Просит помощи у КИВА. Ей нужно 1600 сомони для реализации и товарооборота.
 Муж Нозиры работает охранником, а сама Нозира дополнительно получает пенсию, но реализация фруктов на рынке является основным источником доходов для семьи Муминджоновых.
texts.en:
Born in 1950, Nozira M. is married and has three children. She has a secondary education. The vegetable market in the city of Istaravshan has been her permanent place of work for the last 15 years. Nozira sells fruits, mainly watermelons. Her granddaughter, Farzonai Khasan, helps her with the business. Nozira reached out to Kiva for help. She needs a sum of 1600 somoni for sales and product turnover. Nozira’s husband works as a security guard, and Nozira also receives an additional income from her pension. However, the fruit sales business provides the primary income for the family.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase product turnover

loans.name: Meira Awachango Jane Group

texts.en: Mrs. Jane A. is a married woman, aged 39 years. She has 5 kids (2 boys and 3 girls) all going to school. She has been selling palm oil and local brew for over 18 years. She is going to use the loan to purchase yeast & millet flour for making the local brew to sell, a goat and palm oil. She is hard-working and her dream is to educate her children and to construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase yeast & millet flour for making a local brew to sell, a goat, palm oil.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Since 2004 Agnes Q. has worked as a trader selling second hand clothing and charcoal at Ankwanda near Elmina.  She is divorced and her 2 children are receiving an education through Junior High School.  She is responsible for paying for her family’s various expenses including school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase additional second hand clothing and charcoal for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to purchase land and build a house for her family.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to purchase additional second hand clothing and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Luzira Posta Babirye Catherine Kitibwa Group

texts.en:
Ms. B. Catherine K. is a single lady aged 34 years. She has two children, aged 13 and 9 years. Both her children go to school.

She requests to use this loan to sell airtime, timber, poles for building houses, and for her boutique which has shoes and clothes. She has been in the business for over 3 years. Her business had less capital but now it is increasing because of the loan. She likes to serve people in her community with food supplements, timber and building poles, and with the shoes and clothes in her boutique. She is active, hardworking and encouraging. Her dream is to help the needy.

loans.use: To sell airtime, timber, poles for building houses, boutique (shoes and clothes)

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Danaya de l’association Lafia est constitué de cinq  femmes (dont quatre mariés et une  célibataire) qui ont en moyenne 32 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à Ouayerma II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso troisième région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur cinquième  prêt solidaire, tous les précédents se sont bien dénoués. Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de tissus, de  pagnes wax et bazins,  des fruits, du bois de chauffe,  des prestations  avec la teinture etc. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 3chargements de camionnette en bois de chauffe, 7 pièces de pagnes  wax,  5 complets de bazin, 6 régimes de bananes, 10 paniers de fruits, 20 complets de tissus et 4 paquets de colorants et ingrédients pour la teinture. Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Bamako, de Médine à Sikasso ville et dans les localités avoisinantes.
 Les marchandises sont vendues dans les différents  marchés de Sikasso et dans les familles à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant. Elles font leur prestation de teinture  dans leur famille.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 22.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Certaines femmes du groupe Danaya ambitionnent acheter un terrain à usage d’habitation et d’autres évoluer en solo.
texts.en:
The Danaya group of the Lafia association is made up of 5 women (four of them married and one single) who have an average age of 32 and 2 children. They mostly live in monogamous families in Ouayerma II, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali.

They work together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele and are on their fifth solidarity loan, all the preceding loans having been reimbursed correctly. They have various businesses, among others selling cloth, high quality "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) and damask fabric, fruit, firewood, dyed products, etc.

With this new loan they expect to buy 3 wagonloads of firewood, 7 bolts of "pagnes", 5 outfits made out of damask, 6 stalks of bananas, 10 baskets of fruit, 20 cloth suits and 4 packs of coloring and ingredients for doing dyeing. They buy their goods at the market in Bamako, in Médine in the town of Sikasso and surrounding neighborhoods.

The merchandise is sold in the various markets of Sikasso and out of their families to a clientele composed of men and women, mostly for cash. They do their dyeing in their families' homes. They each expect to make an average monthly of 22,500 F CFA of which part will be used for family needs and the rest reinvested in their businesses.

The ambition of some of the women of the Danaya group is to be able to buy a lot on which to build a house; other members would like to start up businesses on their own.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles for re-sale

loans.name: Kikiafu 1 Lanyaro Teddy Group

texts.en: L. Teddy, aged 28, is married and has 3 boys (aged 13, 10 and 3). She also has another dependant. All of the children go to school. She is using the loan to purchase material clothing for bitegi, uniforms for school children. She has been in her business for 17 years. Her dream is to construct a residential house and leave rental housing.

loans.use: to purchase material clothing for bitegi, uniforms for school children.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: 51-year-old Paulina E. is from Jimenez,Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with 5 children. Her husband administers the making of metal works such as window grills, steel chairs, motorcycle cabs, and more. She received various loans from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and all these loans were repaid in a timely manner. She is a member in good standing. The loan efforts of Paglaum MPC have helped the couple send their children to school and meet their daily necessities. The couple is truly thankful to Paglaum MPC for keeping them company in all their financial needs. What they focus on is taking care of their existing business and in marketing.

loans.use: additional capital for metal shop.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene C., a 32-year-old housewife is married to a pedicab driver. The couple has two children. The family resides in Panaon, Misamis Occidental. Arlene decided to buy a second-hand pump boat as an additional source of income. Whatever fish the pump boat catches she delivers to her customers, reserving some of for the family's food for the day as her husband's pedicab driving will not suffice. Soon she hopes to buy another pump boat to meet her family's daily needs as well as the cost of educating of their children.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand pump boat

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz T., a 49 yr old businesswoman, married with 1 child, lives in Panaon Misamis Occidental.  Her husband is a driver. She started a salon business by offering home service to her customers, when she was able to save a little, she opened a beauty parlor. With the money she borrowed from Paglaum she plans to add more services for her customers. She dreams of sending her child to college someday.

loans.use: To buy equipment for the beauty salon

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina S., a 67-year-old dressmaker, is married with 2 children lives in Tuyabang Bajo, Oroquieta city. She started her dressmaking business with a small amount of capital, now she plans to expand to cater to her growing customer base. She wants her business to grow and prosper and thereby give her family a better life.

loans.use: Buy cloth for her dressmaking

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en: Teodora Q., a 58-year-old housewife with 4 children is a resident of Aloran, Misamis Occ. Her husband is a farmer, and she decided to venture into business to augment the family's income.  Her loyal cutomers are her neighbors and friends. In the future she hopes that her growing business can send her children to college.

loans.use: Additional stocks for her mini store

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en: Fidelina D. is 51 years old, a resident of Oroquieta City, and married with 1 child. She buys and sells cut flowers; she plans to add to her capital the loan she has requested from Paglaum.  Her business is growing. Her customers are her friends, relatives and neighbors. She strives to make her business grow for her future and her family's.

loans.use: Additional capital for her flower business

location.town: Tuyabang Alto Oroquieta City Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe C., a 46-year-old mother of 7 children, resides with her family in Panaon Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a laborer in the market, but his income is not enough to support their daily needs. Fe decided to acquire a loan from Paglaum and start raising pigs in her backyard.  She hopes that this will be a means to improve her family's life.

loans.use: To start a back-yard piggery

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.en: Gilberto J. is 53 years old, married with four children, and retired from the military.  He lives in Canubay, Oroquieta City. His business is a mini grocery and a public utility cab that he operates himself.  He started his business by selling barbecue in front of his house and now it has expand to a small store. He requested a loan from Paglaum to buy more stocks for his store.  He hopes that through his business he will be able to send his children to college.

loans.use: To increase store inventory

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
El Señor Edgar C. tiene 30 años de edades y es soltero.  Edgar es oriundo de la ciudad de Carapeguà y vive con sus padres en casa propia.

Edgar  se  iniciò al trabajo independiente desde muy joven. Empezó a trabajar en una fabrica de calzados como costurero. Trabajó en la fabrica por mas de 3 años y de apoco fue ahorrando para poder empezar a trabajar por cuenta propia. Su  familia se dedica a la venta  ambulante de artesania y tal es  asì que al  reunir un capital importante decidiò acompañar a su padre por  sus recorridos  por  su  zona de trabajo para conseguir sus  propios clientes. Actualmente ya tiene su propia clientela formada y cada día va aumentando de clientes y  su  microempresa esta  en crecimiento constante.
    
Con el  crédito desea comprar  hilo y color.
texts.en:
Señor Edgar C. is 30 years old and single. Edgar comes from the city of Carapeguà and lives with his parents in their own house. He started working for himself at a young age. He started working in a shoe factory as a tailor. He worked there for over three years and he was gradually saving up so that he could begin to work for himself. His family works at peddling artisan crafts, and the way that is, in order to raise a good amount of capital, he decided to go with his father through the streets of the zone where he works in order to get his own clients. Currently he has his own customers lined up and every day he is adding more. His micro-business is constantly growing. With this loan he intends to buy thread and color.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Threads and Color

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Mrs. Juanita M. is 53 years old and married with 6 children. She is into vegetable farming as her business and at the same time is a hard-working house-wife. She is also supported by her daughter who is currently working in Ozamiz City. She is applying for a loan from Paglaum MPC for the purpose of house repair.

She is hoping that someday she can own a residential lot with her effort through financing with Kiva.

loans.use: House repair

location.town: Sangay Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Asuru A Inzikuru Judith Group

texts.en: Mrs. I. Judith, 33, is married with 5 children (4 boys and 1 girl), all in school. She has been in her business of tailoring and selling clothing material for over 4 years. She will use the loan to purchase clothing material for tailoring and also for sale. She is a hard-working woman who wishes to own buses with time.

loans.use: Cloth for tailoring and resale

loans.name: Rito

texts.en: Rito F. is a 32-year-old watch repairman from Lopez Jaena, Mis. Occ.  He is married and has 2 children.  He operates a watch repair shop in the town center. He plans to use the loan from Paglaum to buy accessories and equipment for his watch repair shop. His regular customers are his friends, neighbors and passersby. He dreams of expanding his business someday to provide for his children's future.

loans.use: Equipment and accesories for watch repair shop

loans.name: Federico

texts.es:
El joven Federico tiene  25 años de edad  y vive en la Ciudad de Carapeguà, en compañía Calixtro.  Vive con su madre y  hermanos que son menores que el y estan en etapa escolar.  La familia vive en casa propia.
 
Federico es  un  joven emprendedor  y  luchador.  Se iniciò en la actividad de la zapaterìa  siendo  un  niño, iniciandosè como  secretario y asì  fue aprendiendo  y  hoy  dia  es su  profesiòn.
Con  sus  ingresos ayuda a su madre con  los  gastos de la casa y  juntos asì  buscan una  forma decente  para salir adelante y enfrentarse a la vida. Anhela  poder estudiar para  poder ser un  profesional y salir adelante. 

Con  el crèdito adquirido  comprarà una  màquina para zapaterìa.
texts.en:
Federico is a 25-year-old young man who lives in the Calixtro district, of the city of Carapeguà. He lives with his mother and his siblings, who are all younger than he is and still in school. They live in their own home. Federico is an enterprising young man who is also a fighter. He got started in shoe store as a child. He first worked as a secretary, learned along the way, and now it's his profession. With his earnings, he helps his mother with the household expenses. And together like this, they try to find a decent way of getting ahead and facing life. He yearns to study so he can be a professional and get ahead. With the loan, he will buy a machine for the shoe store.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Una maquina para zapateria

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
Mrs. Emilda S. is 42 years old, married and resides at Sangay Daku Ozamiz City. She has four children. Two of them are married and two work at LUAN CHING farm located at Pulot Ozamiz City. She is a business-minded woman engaged in a sari-sari store.  She started her business through financing by Paglaum MPC. She has shown strong leadership in her group and as a center officer. Now she is applying for her 8th cycle for PHP 14,500.00 to use as additional capital for her business. She also works as a care taker at LUAN CHING farm. 

She hopes that someday she can own a sari-sari store with her efforts and financing from KIVA..

loans.use: Capital for her sari-sari store

location.town: Sangay Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Eupricina

texts.en: Eupricina M. a 51-year-old fish and vegetable vendor. She lives in Navalan Village, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is married to Felix M. who works as a farmer. She has six children; two are studying and four are married.  Her fish and vegetables are displayed in the village market everyday.  She applied for a loan of PHP 14,000.00 to purchase more kinds of fish and vegetables. She plans to sell every morning to other villages. Her business income helps them meet their daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase fish and vegetables

loans.name: Hector

texts.es:
Héctor O. es un Sr. de 46 años de edad oriundo de la ciudad de Roque González.  El está casado hace más de 23 años con Sra. Petrona Fleitas de 50 años de edad y tienen 5 hijos, 2 en edad escolar y 3 hijos que ya son mayores de edad y gracias al apoyo de  sus padres pudieron estudiar y  ya son todos  profesionales.

	Hace 20 años empezó con una pequeña despensa en su domicilio, donde la Sra. atendía mientra él estudiaba para culminar su estudio de docencia y asì obtener titulo  de profesor y conseguir empleo para tener un  ingreso fijo para mejorar la calidad de  vida de su familia.  En la actualidad ambos se ayudan  para  salir adelante administrando juntos la despensa, ya que es el centro de compra mas importante y concurrida de la ciudad.

	Con el crèdito comprara harina ,azucar, yerba, aceite y  fideo.
texts.en:
Mr. Héctor O. is 46 years old and from the city of Roque González. He has been married for over 23 years to Mrs. Petrona Fleitas who is 50 years old. They have 5 children, 2 school age and 3 grown up. All three are now professionals since they were able to study thanks to their parent’s support.

He began 20 years ago with a small store in his home. His wife tended to it while he studied to finish his teaching degree so he could get a job with a steady income to improve his family’s quality of life. Currently they both help to get ahead. They run the store together since it is the most important and most frequented shopping center in the city.

He will buy flour, sugar, herbs, oil and noodles with the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of flour, sugar, herbs, oil, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en: Mrs. Carmela A., 50 years old, is married and lives at Dicayas, Dipolog City. She is blessed with three children. One of her children is in school. Her husband is a driver. She wants to help him have additional income. She has an existing sari-sari store and is eager to develop it. She turned to Paglaum MPC for assistance and has no regret in her membership. Recently, she applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional stock as well as soft drinks and canned goods for her store. She prays for the success of her business and the future of her children.

loans.use: To purchase canned goods and soft drinks for her store

location.town: Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en: Mr Rodolfo V. is 66 years old and married with one child. He is presently living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. His wife is a housekeeper and also helps him to raise their pigs as they are a major source of household income. Their regular customers are the meat market retailers. Rodolfo and his wife want to construct additional cages for the pigs. Their hope is to have a decent living, and be able to save money for their old age and their only child.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos. Cuenta con una librería que tiene montado en su propio domicilio, donde tiene venta de todo tipo de útiles escolares como: cuadernos, libros, reglas, pinceles, corrector, cartulinas, entre otros.

Carlos emprendió este negocio en el año 2005, con un pequeño ahorro con que contaba. El realizo algunas modificaciones para poder tener el espacio correspondiente para su salón comercial. 
Carlos, con sus ganancias de su venta aporta a los ingresos de la casa y junto con sus padres hacen frente a los gastos  familiares.
Carlos comenta que tiene bastante venta. Es por ello que desea adquirir mayor cantidad de materiales escolares y asi satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos is 28 years old, single and has no children. He has a bookstore that he has set up in his own home where he sells all kinds of school supplies such as, notebooks, books, rulers, paintbrushes, Wite-Out and cards among other things. Carlos got his business going in 2005 with some small savings that he had. He made some modifications in order to have sufficient space for his sales room. With the earnings from his sales, Carlos contributes to the household income, and together with his parents they meet the family's expenses. Carlos mentions that he has plenty of business. That's why he wants to acquire a larger inventory of school supplies so that he can meet the demand from his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy school supplies for his store.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Mrs Marina P. is married to Russel P., a driver, and they are blessed with three children. They currently live in Sipac, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. Marina is a responsible member of Kiva partner, PMPC – she has made her payments religiously and regularly, and therefore has no record of default. She has had a sari-sari ('various kinds') store business for almost a year, which she manages well.

Now Marina is requesting 5000 PHP for her second loan so that she can buy additional stock for her grocery store. Her dream is that her business will succeed, the store building become secure and stable, and that she could meet her customers' needs completely. Her hope is that all her children finish their education and get a job some day.

loans.use: To purchase items, such as household and food supplies, for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Karina Ysabel

texts.es:
Karina es socia del Banco Comunal Golondrinas.
Karina es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Karina junto a su esposo tienen una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende repuestos y accesorios de vehículos, actividad que realizan hace dos años y poco a poco esta mejorando sus ventas.
Karina necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de faja y filtros.
Los sueños de Karina son tener casa propia y otra tienda de repuestos.
texts.en:
Karina is a member of the Golondrinas (The Swallows) Communal Bank. She is 29 years old, lives with her domestic partner and has two children. Karina and her spouse have a store in some rented space where they sell spare parts and accessories for motor vehicles. They have been doing this for two years and little by little they are increasing their sales. Karina needs a loan of 3,000 Sols which will be invested in the purchase of fan belts and filters. Karina dreams of having her own house and another parts store.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fan belts and filters

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Mrs Elvira B. lives in Barangay Sinian, Baliangao, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. She is an active member of Kiva partner, Paglaum Multi-purpose Cooperative (PMPC), which she joined in April 2006. She was inspired to be part of PMPC when she heard about the many positive benefits of the cooperative. She also wanted to make use of the credit facilities, especially for starting up her fish selling business.

Elvira requested the loan amount of 5500 PHP as additional capital for her fish selling business. Her hope is that her business would be sustainable and that she could live a more comfortable life in the future.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for her fish selling business

loans.name: Achimi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de matériaux de construction, il exerce cette activité depuis 2004, beaucoup d’entrepreneur viennent acheter chez lui. Actuellement il fait face à une demande élevée qu’il ne peut satisfaire avec son stock actuel. Il sollicite alors de WAGES son premier crédit pour augmenter son stock de matériaux de construction. Il est marié et père de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
This gentleman runs an income-generating business selling construction supplies. He has been in this business since 2004, and many entrepreneurs come to buy from him. Currently, he is facing an increased demand that he cannot satisfy with his existing stock. He is thus seeking (through WAGES) his first loan to increase his stock of construction supplies. He is married and has three children.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction supplies

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila es socia del Banco Comunal Golondrinas.
Teofila es casada, tiene 45 años y 7 hijos, Teofila tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. su esposo. Además Teofila venD. salchipollos sus ventas lo realiza por las noches.
Teofila necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, aceite y fideo.
Los sueños D. Teofila son tener mas capital y mas mercadería.
texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the Golondrinas (“Swallows”) Communal Bank. Teofila is 45 years old, married, and has 7 children. Teofila has a store in her home were she sells general groceries, vegetables, and meats. She tends to her store every day with help from her husband. In addition, Teofila sells salchipollos (a Peruvian chicken dish) in the evenings. Teofila needs a loan of 2000 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, oil, and noodles. Teofila’s dream is to have more capital and more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing rice, sugar, oil, and noodles.

loans.name: Ma. Cecelia

texts.en: Mrs. Ma. Cecelia A. is engaged in selling fish to the community.  She is married with two children, both in school.  She is an active member of Paglaum MPC. Now she is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to have additional capital for selling fish.  Her husband helps her dry fish to sell for added income. Cecelia hopes that she can give her children a brighter future by letting them complete a good education.

loans.use: To purchase fish

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Golondrinas.
Maria es soltera y tiene 27 años, Maria vende tarjetas telefónicas por mayor y menor, además trabaja en la botica e Internet de su hermana, se encarga de la atención de ambos negocios.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de tarjetas telefónicas.
Los sueños de Maria son aumentar su negocio y tener un punto de venta estable.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Golondrinas (“Swallows”) Communal Bank. Maria is 27 years old and single. She sells phone cards, both wholesale and retail. She also works in her sister’s pharmacy and internet café, where she looks after both businesses. Maria needs a loan of 1800 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of phone cards. Maria’s dream is to increase her business and to have a regular point of sale for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing phone cards.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth C., 36, lives in Dicayas, Dipolog City with her husband and four children, two of whom are still in school. Many are inspired by her dedication and hard work for the benefit of her family.

Elizabeth works as a snack vendor to her neighbors and the neighboring barrios, selling native snacks such as "suman" and bananas. Because of increased demand for her products, she investigated many lending institution for financial assistance. Since joining Paglaum MPC, which extends financial services to the poor, she has been a good member, having already received and repaid two loans. Now, she is seeking a loan of 12,000 PHP to be able to purchase ingredients for her native snack-making. Elizabeth would like to establish a mini-restaurant and snack house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making native snacks.

location.town: Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Golondrinas.
Maria es soltera y tiene 40 años, Maria tiene un puesto en un pequeño mercado en donde vende especerías (condimentos para comida) que ella misma prepara en su casa.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de aji colorado, ajos.
Los sueños de Maria son mejorar su negocio y tener un puesto estable.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Golondrinas (“Swallows”) Communal Bank. Maria is 40 years old and single. She has a stall in a small market where she sells spices and condiments, which she prepares in her home. Maria needs a loan of 1200 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of red peppers and garlic. Maria’s dream is to improve her business and to have a permanent stall in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing red peppers and garlic.

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en: Mrs. Nonita C., 52 and married with two children, lives in Taguilon, Dapitan City where she manages her mini-restaurant known as Emmineth's Eatery. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase kitchen utensils in order to render better service and increase her customer base. Nonita is working with dedication because she wants to enable her children to finish college.

loans.use: To purchase additional kitchen utensils and stock.

loans.name: Lola

texts.es:
Lola es socia del Banco Comunal Golondrinas.
Lola es casada, tiene 23 años y 2 hijos, Lola viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende verduras, frutas, abarrotes y de las ferias compra quesos, ajo, gallinas productos que vende en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Lola necesita un préstamo de 2100 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ajo, quesos.
Los sueños de Lola son mejorar su negocio, comprar un puesto en el mercado en donde venda comida.
texts.en:
Lola is a member of the Golondrinas Community Bank.

Lola is married, 23 years old and has two children. Lola travels to different markets in the region where she sells vegetables, fruits, groceries and buys cheese, garlic, and rooster products that she sells in the city of Ayacucho.

Lola needs a loan of 2100 soles ($700 USD), money that will be invested in the purchase of garlic and cheeses.

Lola’s dreams are to improve her business and buy a stand in the market to sell food.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase garlic, cheese

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet P. is a store owner in Sto. Niño, Village, Pagadian City, Zamboanga Del Sur, where she lives.  Forty-nine years old and the mother of three children, she is married to Elmo P., who works as a mechanic at a shop.  Juliet, who has operated a sari-sari store for almost nine years, is requesting a loan of PHP 7,000.00, her second one with Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative.  She will use the money as additional capital for her store, extending the space available for her stock of goods.

loans.use: Additional capital for her sari-sari store.
